title: Product Security Engineer
full_description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
At Boeing, we are all innovators on a mission to connect, protect, explore and inspire. From the seabed to outer space, you will learn and grow; contributing to work that shapes the world. Find your future with us. The Boeing Global Services (BGS) Government Vehicle Health Management Systems (GVHMS) Team is currently looking for an experienced Cyber Security / Information Assurance (CS/IA) engineer to join our team in Hazelwood, MO.
Our amazing team of engineers develops, fields, and supports platform health management systems for the F/A-18, MQ-25, F-15, T-38, T-7, and proprietary platforms. Our software acquires and manages platform health and usage data, performs health, and usage assessment and recommends maintenance actions. We are tasked with the creation, design, development, modification, proof of concept, verification, testing, and demonstration of products and solutions to maximize platform mission readiness and effectiveness, reduce lifecycle costs, and keep our customers safe.
In this role, you will work on our team of Product Security Engineers along with our internal team as well as external suppliers to ensure all stakeholders are meeting customer and internal CS/IA requirements. The CS/IA engineer will be required to assess compliance with CS/IA requirements, work with stakeholders to resolve compliance issues, and communicate status accordingly. This role will also be responsible for certifying compliance for the system and hardware assets as well as serving as a CS/IA focal on other efforts across the organization including requirements definition, issue remediation, as well as supporting Certification & Accreditation (C&A) activities for the team.
Position Responsibilities:
Assists with CS/IA compliance for internal teams and external suppliers
Work with internal and external teams to resolve compliance issues
Analyze, implement, and test security controls
Evaluate security vulnerability alerts/bulletins
Test/apply security patches
Support other CS/IA or team tasking as needed
Asset management
Inventorying or imaging systems
Help contribute to improving cyber procedures (including documentation)
We work in a casual but professional environment with multi-disciplined teams of engineers that take pride in developing, integrating, testing and delivering innovative solutions. There is long-term potential for career growth into technical leadership or management positions and we value the curiosity, tenacity and imagination our engineers bring to our teams each day.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/ Experience):
Bachelor of Science (or higher) degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry, or other relevant technical field. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.
Security+ and/or equivalent Cyber Security certification(s)
1+ years of professional experience in a cyber-security, information assurance, or related field
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Experience interpreting and applying NIST 800-171 and DFARS requirements
Familiarity with System Security Plans and Access Control Policies and POA&Ms
Information Technology (IT) or Software engineering experience, including knowledge of Microsoft operating systems and client-server and web-based architectures, is desirable
Experience with performing ACAS scans of systems and interpreting results
Experience with STIG and SCAP tools on Windows-based applications
Experience scanning source code with security tools Fortify and Coverity
Experience with Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) reports and following external vulnerability trends
Experience identifying security vulnerabilities within source code
Experience with eMASSter tool or other security report writing software
Experience with the RMF or DIACAP process
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.
Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.
Summary pay range for Experienced: $91,800.00 - $124,200.00

Applications for this position will be accepted until Jul. 02, 2025

Export Control Requirements: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

This position requires the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. An interim U.S. Secret Clearance Pre-Start and final U.S. Secret Clearance Post-Start is required.

title: Solutions Architect
full_description:
Join the Equifax Technology team as a Solutions Architect and architect, design, and implement cutting-edge solutions leveraging Cloud Native capabilities in GCP/AWS. You will establish the foundational Solution Intent for projects, collaborating with team members to define component responsibilities. You will develop essential architecture deliverables, including usage, cost, and failure models, ensuring solutions align with technology strategy and are efficiently built and operated. You will be instrumental in defining and prioritizing non-functional requirements and providing technical guidance throughout the implementation process, ensuring the final product adheres to the solution intent. Your strong technical skills and design acumen will be vital in building smart and effective solutions.

What you’ll do
Architect, design and implement smart solutions in GCP/AWS using Cloud Native capabilities.
Establish the high-level Solution Intent for given project or problem statement
Establish responsibilities of major logical components of the solution in collaboration with other team members
Develop architecture deliverables necessary to illustrate system behavior, including usage models, and cost of ownership models and failure analysis model
Ensure that the solution is aligned with the technology strategy, uses standard solution building blocks and can be built and operated in an efficient manner aligned with economic value of the project
Develop, analyze, split, and prioritize work required to implement the system’s non-functional requirements
Provide technical oversight of implementation, keeping the final build and overall implementation aligned with the solution intent

What experience you need
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent job experience required
3+ years of experience architecting and developing software in the public cloud., including 5+ years overall relevant experience.
Experience in monitoring infrastructure and application uptime and availability to ensure functional and performance objectives.
Experience in one or more languages such as Python, Bash, Java, Go, JavaScript and/or node.js
Demonstrable cross-functional knowledge with systems, storage, networking, security and databases
Partner with Engineering, and SREs to analyze any outages or resiliency issues and provide remediation steps
Experience with microservice best practices and design patterns
Experience with event driven architecture and immutable data management patterns (CQRS)
Proficiency with continuous integration and continuous delivery tooling and practices
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Cloud Certification Strongly Preferred

What could set you apart
An ability to demonstrate successful performance of our Success Profile skills, including:
Application Development/Programming - Experience working with software design, programming languages (preferably Python, Java, Javascript) and solution architecture. Knowledge of Event Driven Architecture, Functional/Object Oriented Programming
Cloud Services (AWS/GCP) - Leveraging cloud native GCP/AWS service while architecting particular product/platform
DevSecOps - Need to have a strong understanding of both security and DevOps principles. They need to be able to design and implement solutions that meet the security and compliance requirements of the organization. Ability to work with developers and operations teams to ensure that the solutions are implemented in a way that does not impact the development or deployment process.
Technical Communication/Presentation - Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to tailor to specific audiences. Work with others to achieve results and proactively address sources of conflict and emotion with focus on the best solution for Equifax
Technology Advising/Consulting - Understand business goals and how to use technology to achieve them. Understand the IT environment and the challenges the unit is facing. Develop a technology solution that will help achieve the BU goals. Provide ongoing support to ensure that it continues to meet the goals. Monitor the solution for any potential problems and take corrective action as needed.

title: Telecommunications Engineer (Mitel)
full_description:
Are you a skilled Telecommunications Engineer with a passion for cutting-edge technology and a knack for problem-solving? Forward Slash Technology , a leading Cyber Security, Information Technology, and Managed Services provider based in St. Louis, MO , is looking for an experienced professional to join our growing team.
If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are eager to work with the latest Mitel technologies, we want to hear from you!
Why Join Forward Slash Technology?
Exciting Projects: Work with cutting-edge VOIP solutions and traditional telephony systems
Career Growth: Access ongoing learning opportunities and professional development
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a passionate and forward-thinking team
Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, healthcare, retirement plans, and more
What You’ll Do
As a Telecommunications Engineer , you'll be responsible for
Designing, implementing, and maintaining traditional telephone and VOIP solutions
Troubleshooting and resolving telephony infrastructure issues efficiently
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure seamless network integration
Providing top-tier support to clients and internal teams
Monitoring system performance and ensuring optimal reliability
Managing ticket queues and documenting solutions to ensure customer satisfaction
Staying ahead of industry advancements to continuously improve our services
What We’re Looking For
To succeed in this role, you should have the following.
Technical Expertise
Solid knowledge of Mitel MiVoice, Mitel 250, Mitel 5000, Mitel 3000, Mitel MiCollab, and PBX systems
Strong understanding of VoIP, SIP protocols, LANs/WANs (routers, switches, etc.)
Familiarity with troubleshooting tools and best practices in telecommunications security
Soft Skills
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong customer service mindset with exceptional communication skills
Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
A team player attitude with a positive and professional approach
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, or related field from an accredited university and 2-5 years of experience
Be Mitel Certified Associate (MCA) or Mitel Certified Professional (MCP) certified
Engineers should possess CCNA or CTP certification and have an excellent, thorough fault process mentality to correctly gauge calls along with other relevant technical abilities and knowledge
Proven track record in IP-based telephony installations and troubleshooting
Specific Requirements
To maintain employment with our company, by mandate, each employee MUST complete and have the following.
Must be able to pass a MSHP/Federal fingerprint-based background check (no felonies)
Must complete training for and successfully complete a CJIS (Criminal Justice Information Systems) Security & Privacy Training Certification
Must be a US Citizen
Must have a valid US driver's license with a clean driving record
What We Offer
Competitive salary based on experience
A dynamic work environment with opportunities for career advancement
Healthcare benefits, Retirement IRA, paid time off, and more
A chance to work with cutting-edge technologies in an ever-evolving industry
Ready to take the next step in your career?
Apply Now and become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and growth.
This is a full-time position in our St Louis-based office.

title: Cloud Solutions Architect
full_description:
Company Details:

Midwest Employers Casualty (MEC) is a member of the W. R. Berkley Corporation, a fortune 500 company, rated A+ (Superior) by A.M. Best Company, based in Chesterfield, MO. We improve the quality of life for employees severely injured on the job and help companies understand and mitigate their risk for workers’ compensation injuries. MEC has a friendly, results-focused work environment. We seek employees who take initiative, are quick to adapt, are dependable, and like working as part of a team.

https://www.mecasualty.com/

The company is an equal employment opportunity employer.
Responsibilities:
Join our team at MEC as a Cloud Solutions Architect, where you will be at the forefront of designing, implementing, and maintaining our cloud-based solutions using Microsoft Azure services. This critical role supports our ongoing growth by developing and maintaining scalable, secure, and optimized cloud solutions for MEC and other operating units within W. R. Berkley Corporation.

What You Will Do:

Solution Design: Collaborate with Software Developers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Solution Developers to design scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud solutions.
Service Provisioning: Manage Terraform, GitHub Workflows, and other tools to support deployment and configuration of Azure services, including compute, storage, databases, networking, security, and containerization. Work with MEC’s partners, such as Berkley Technology Services and other operating units, as appropriate.
Platform Roadmap: Develop and maintain a roadmap for service upgrades to mitigate application interruptions, or work with MEC’s partners as appropriate.
Deployment Architecture: Establish and refine DevOps standards and best practices and manage the solution deployment architecture.
Security and Compliance: Ensure that solutions adhere to security policies and compliance requirements. Assist Data Scientists and Solution Developers in developing artifacts for the W.R. Berkley Building Permit and AI Governance processes.
Automation and Orchestration: Leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) frameworks such as Terraform templates to automate service deployment and management processes, or work with MEC’s partners as appropriate.
Pipeline Management: Implement and manage data pipelines to and from on-prem and cloud data sources, or work with the Data Engineer as appropriate.
Data Modeling: Visually diagram how data will be acquired, stored, and used within the solutions, following accepted corporate best practices, or work with the Data Engineer as appropriate.
Data Management: Design data storage solutions and ensure that user and application access to data is securely managed, or work with the Data Engineer as appropriate.
Service Monitoring: Monitor the performance and availability of managed services and provide reports to management.
Service Optimization: Continuously improve and optimize services to meet the needs of Solution Developers and Modelers.
Job Schedule Management: Establish and manage schedules of batch and other routine processes.
Support and Maintenance: Provide support for service-related issues and perform regular maintenance tasks.
Disaster Recovery: Work collaboratively with MEC’s partners to establish recovery time objectives for Azure subscriptions and regularly test disaster recovery plans.
Cost Management: Regularly monitor the costs of MEC’s Azure subscriptions and provide reports to management.
Qualifications:
What You Bring:
Educational Background: A university or college degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in Microsoft Azure services including compute, storage, networking, and security.
Certifications: Relevant certifications such as Azure Solutions Architect or Azure DevOps
DevOps Experience: Experience with DevOps tools such as Terraform and GitHub Workflows for CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code.
Cloud Solution Design: Experience in designing scalable, secure, and resilient cloud solutions.
Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Excellent analytical abilities with a knack for solving complex problems and proposing effective solutions.
Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Strong capability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment, with stellar communication skills.
Why Join Us?
Impactful Work: Make a tangible difference in MEC's reporting and analytics capabilities.

Continuous Growth: Engage in endless opportunities for learning and professional development.

Collaborative Culture: Thrive in a team-oriented environment that values each member's contribution and fosters innovation.

Diverse Environment: Join a workplace that appreciates and nurtures diversity, ensuring all voices are heard and respected.

Culture & Benefits: We offer flextime with core hours and a hybrid schedule. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurance that begin day one of employment, Flexible Spending Account, life insurance, Employee Assistance Plan, paid holidays, tuition/training reimbursement, bonus structure, 401(k) savings plan with profit sharing (averaging 10% the past few years), employee referral program, business casual attire (nice jeans allowed), and fun social events, just to name a few.

Ready to Make a Difference?
If you are passionate about driving data excellence and enjoy working in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we want to hear from you! Apply today to become a pivotal part of our team, shaping the future of our solutions.
Additional Company Details: We do not accept any unsolicited resumes from external recruiting agencies or firms. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Sponsorship Details: Sponsorship not Offered for this Role

title: Software Safety Engineer - BDS Air Proprietary 1 (Associate or Mid-Level)
full_description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Defense, Space and Security (BDS) has an exciting opportunity for a Software Safety Engineer (Levels 2 or 3) on the Air Dominance, Air Proprietary 1 (AP1) Program.
The selected candidate will provide the technical guidance and perform critical system safety engineering work. The work will consist of planning, coordinating, and performing detailed Software Safety tasks such as system and subsystem hazard analysis, fault tree analysis, and software safety analysis to mitigate potential product safety hazards. In addition to working with System Safety personnel, the individual will work extensively with design, development, and test personnel to impart safety requirements early in the design process. These tasks are accomplished within a collaborative environment with other program teams to assist with and/or plan design, develop, and verify lifecycle balanced system solutions including resolution of multi-functional technical issues.
Position Responsibilities:
Apply an interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to plan, design, develop and verify a lifecycle balanced system of systems and system solutions
Perform various analyses and integration activities to optimize total system of systems architecture for Software Safety
Identifies, analyzes, and assesses regulatory and/or contractual compliance of aerospace systems, products and services against the applied development and design assurance standards (MIL-STD-882E, JSSEH, DO-178, DO-254) to provide the necessary hazard mitigation evidence
Analyze software to identify potential failure conditions or investigate reported in-service fleet hazards, risks, and safety concerns
Identifies safety issue systemic root causes and recommends corrective actions using industry best practices (MIL STD-882E)
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to define, validate, and integrate safety requirements
Verifies that the system meets or exceeds the defined safety requirements by conducting safety analyses, audits, and reviews
Demonstrates safety hazard risk mitigation and control methods to the customer and regulators
Resolve multi-functional technical issues
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in Engineering or Computer Science
Experience in related engineering fields, such as software engineering
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Experience with software requirements, software design, documentation and configuration control
Experience with software code development, and testing
Experience programming C/C++ software for real time embedded systems
Electrical Engineering experience
Experience in System and Software Safety
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
Pay and Benefits:
At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage, and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.
Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.
Summary pay range for Associate level (Level 2): $81,600 - $110,400
Summary pay range for Mid-level (Level 3): $97,750 - $132,250

Applications for this position will be accepted until Jul. 10, 2025

Export Control Requirements: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

Export Control Details: US based job, US Person required

Education
Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Required
Relocation
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Security Clearance
This position requires the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. An interim and/or final U.S. Top Secret Clearance Post-Start is required. This position requires ability to obtain program access, for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship only.
Visa Sponsorship
Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.
Shift
This position is for 1st shift

full_description:

Brillio is one of the fastest growing digital technology service providers and a partner of choice for many Fortune 1000 companies seeking to turn disruption into a competitive advantage through innovative digital adoption. Conduct user acceptance testing of APIs to ensure they meet specified requirements and quality standards.
Identify and work with engineers to resolve any issues or bugs in the API functionality.

title: Experienced Communications Engineer
full_description:
About Us:
At Intramotev, we are dedicated to revolutionizing the freight industry by liberating tons of freight from congested highways, reducing carbon emissions, and enhancing transportation efficiency. We are deploying self-propelled battery-electric railcars and vehicles to transform freight logistics and bring innovation to our rail network. Based in St. Louis, MO, we are committed to promoting industrial revitalization, saving lives, and minimizing the environmental impact of trucking/transportation. We actively foster a work environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunities for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Role Overview:
We are seeking an Experienced Communication Engineer to join the engineering team supporting growing demands in the development of autonomous, self-propelled rail vehicles. This role will be responsible for the definition, design, and implementation of robust communication layers essential for the interaction between the tablet controller, edge/site server, and the trains. You will lead in defining and optimizing the required hardware, software, and networking layers for these critical communication pathways, ensuring seamless and reliable data flow for autonomous rail vehicle operations. This position will be based out of St. Louis, MO.
Position Responsibilities:
Design and define the implementation of communication architectures and protocols for rail vehicle systems.
Specify and select hardware components related to vehicle communication systems.
Develop, integrate, and optimize software modules for communication between system components (tablet, server, train).
Define, implement, and optimize networking requirements and configurations for reliable system operation.
Lead testing and validation efforts to ensure communication systems meet operational and functional requirements.
Collaborate extensively with multi-disciplinary engineering teams, including electrical, mechanical, and software engineers, to ensure seamless system integration.
Lead problem-solving and provide comprehensive lifecycle support for fielded communication systems.
Research technological advancements and recommend potential applications and technology investments to enhance our solutions.
Lead and participate in design and peer reviews.
Manage interface architectures, definitions, and control for communication systems.
Team Dynamics:
Work within dynamic teams, typically 3-10 members, on diverse projects.
Foster excellent interpersonal and communication skills to thrive in a collaborative environment.
Adapt to evolving project objectives and requirements introduced through prioritized capability enhancements.
Engage in occasional domestic travel for testing, integration, demonstrations, and customer interactions.
Why Join Us?
Career Growth: Develop your career with a forward-thinking company dedicated to transforming rail technology.
Innovative Environment: Contribute to groundbreaking projects that bridge the past and future of rail transport.
Impactful Work: Be a key player in creating solutions that promote a more sustainable and efficient transportation network.
About You:
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
2-5 years of experience developing communication systems, networking solutions, or related engineering projects
Strong understanding of networking concepts (e.g., TCP/IP, wireless communication, routing protocols)
Proficiency in software development concepts and relevant programming languages (e.g., object-oriented programming, C/C++/Python).
Willingness to expand into technical areas beyond your area of expertise; ability to develop innovative and novel approaches.
Open-minded and comfortable working in a teaming environment or as an individual contributor.
Fluent in both written and verbal English.
U.S. Person (immigration or work visa sponsorship will not be provided).
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Experience with specific communication protocols (e.g., RF, CAN bus, Ethernet, Wireless standards) or interfaces.
Experience with Linux TCP/IP stack networking, such as Yocto, OpenWRT, and Debian.
Experience with low-latency and high resiliency back-end to front-end interfaces.
Experience with debugging and testing complex communication systems.
Experience with software version control tools such as git.
Experience in directly applicable industry or projects, such as Rail, Electric Vehicles, or Unmanned Systems.
Experience with safety-critical systems development and certification.
Demonstrated experience working across organizational boundaries.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies.
Typical Education and Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2-5 years' related work experience, or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master+0-3 years' related work experience, etc.).
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Intramotev is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
If you're passionate about communications engineering and eager to contribute to autonomous rail technology, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Technical Support Engineer
full_description:
Customer Success
St. Louis
Full-time

Description
WHO WE ARE
Come join the company reinventing data security, empowering businesses to realize the full potential of their data. As the leading data security platform purpose-built for the cloud era, Cyera’s mission is to reinvent how businesses secure data, enable agile collaboration, and boldly pursue new business opportunities. We are searching for a highly skilled Technical Support Engineer to play a key role in customer support. This position offers an exciting chance to join a thriving organization and contribute to the forefront of data security, making a significant impact on the protection of data for numerous global enterprises.
As a Technical Support Engineer, your primary duty is to execute and achieve the mission and objectives of the Support Center organization. In this role, you will provide exceptional support to our enterprise customers. You’ll work closely with internal teams to resolve complex issues, drive customer satisfaction, and develop strategies to ensure the highest levels of support and success for our largest, most strategic accounts.
This position is based in St. Louis, MO, and requires on-site presence in the oﬃce

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Technical Issue Resolution

Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues related to the company’s products and services.
Escalate unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams (e.g., R&D, Product Management) and ensure timely resolution.
Customer Communication & Advocacy
Provide clear, detailed, and empathetic communication to customers throughout the troubleshooting process.
Advocate for customers by documenting their challenges and collaborating with internal teams to address recurring issues.
Build trust and confidence by delivering consistent, high-quality support experiences.
Documentation & Knowledge Sharing

Share insights, best practices, and lessons learned with internal teams to enhance collective knowledge and support processes.
Contribute to internal training initiatives, ensuring team members stay up-to-date on the latest product features and support techniques.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
Work closely with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to align support efforts with product enhancements and customer needs.
Provide actionable feedback to the Product team to improve usability, performance, and overall customer satisfaction.
Support pre-sales and post-sales handoffs, ensuring smooth transitions for customers.
Continuous Improvement
Identify trends and patterns in customer issues to proactively suggest improvements to products, processes, or documentation.
Participate in regular team reviews to refine workflows, tools, and metrics for support excellence.
Stay current with new product releases, features, and industry trends to provide the most effective support possible.
Team Collaboration & Development
Document and share best practices both internally and externally to promote knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
Mentor team members, providing guidance and support for their professional growth.
Contribute to hiring by participating in the interview process and supporting the onboarding of new team members.
Foster a positive, collaborative, and high-performing team culture at Cyera.
Have a positive impact on your team at Cyera.
Requirements
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Associates degree or equivalent experience required. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar experience a plus
Strong troubleshooting skills with experience in software support, including proficiency in relevant tools, technologies, or coding languages.
Demonstrated ability to deliver exceptional customer service with empathy and clarity.
Skilled at analyzing complex technical problems, identifying root causes, and delivering timely solutions.
Effective communicator who works well with cross-functional teams to address customer needs.
Highly motivated, resourceful, and committed to continuous learning and improvement.
A self-starter who thrives in an ambiguous, fast-paced, and deadline-oriented startup environment.
A results-oriented mindset, with a proven track record of driving revenue growth, ensuring customer satisfaction, promoting feature adoption, and maximizing customer retention.
Prior experience collaborating with Development teams.
Prior experience working in a software company in a technical customer-facing role.
Demonstrated track record of owning customer relationships.
A self-motivated, proactive, and innovative team player who consistently strives to inspire customer loyalty.
Excellent interpersonal and customer relations skills, particularly when it comes to building and nurturing strategic relationships.
A clear and concise verbal and written communicator, capable of conveying complex information effectively.
Ability to work autonomously, tackling even the most intricate challenges, and successfully completing tasks that may lack comprehensive documentation. They will actively participate in projects aligned with their current skill set, seeking assistance primarily for more complex initiatives or issues.
Willing to assist with on-call evening and weekend support
Preferred Skills:
SQL, AWS, Azure, Zendesk
Experience with SSO

COMPENSATION INFORMATION:
In addition to a standard benefits and equity package, we offer a generous salary. Final compensation will vary based on seniority and relevance of experience, location, and position requirements.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
full_description:
Business Unit Description:
Feeding the world is what we do – how we do it is unique. We are not your textbook consumer packaged goods company. While others may be slow to make change happen, Post continuously drives both inorganic and organic growth. Our history is evidence of that fact with over 100 years of heritage and growth from brands that transcend generations like Honey Bunches of Oats, Fruity Pebbles, Malt-O-Meal, Bob Evans, Kibbles 'n Bits, Egg Beaters, Peter Pan peanut butter and more. Our foodservice and ingredient businesses supply other products you love for brands, restaurants and stores.

Our offices and manufacturing sites are in more than 60 locations in five countries, and we have 11,500+ employees. Over the past 12 years, Post has made 25+ acquisitions and reached $7.9 billion in net sales in fiscal 2024. During turbulent times of market uncertainty, the food industry has provided a level of stability unlike other industries.

Post Holdings, Inc. is a Fortune 500® company headquartered in Brentwood, a suburb of St. Louis, Missouri. Our casual professional atmosphere encourages team members to collaborate, innovate and support our operating companies. Our passion and drive advance the reputation of our operating companies and brands—together, we make a difference.

Responsibilities:
We are looking for a Platform Engineer who is passionate about cloud platforms, integration systems, and modern infrastructure services. The core function of this role is to administer, build, and troubleshoot our cloud-based platforms and workloads. You will leverage a diverse technical background to solve complex problems and develop advanced analytical solutions with minimal oversight. Our distributed business model affords you the ability to support large scale Enterprise platforms, while being engaged in a wide breadth of technologies and projects in a small business atmosphere.

KEY RESPONSIBLITIES
Manage and support platforms and workloads in our Azure and cloud environments to ensure availability and reliability including Data Integration platforms (FiveTran, Attunity, dbt, Automate), and Data Analytics systems (Tableau)
Provide lifecycle and maintenance support of Azure workloads including patching, updating, and ensuring monitoring and alerting services meet business requirements
Manage small to medium sized technical projects
Works with engineering teams to break down goals into actionable tasks articulated in work breakdown structures with resource allocation and task duration estimates
Understand the project management lifecycle.
Troubleshoot issues that impact the availability and performance of the platforms and workloads
Define and document standards and best practices for all aspects of the administration and management of systems within your responsibility
Ensure the security, scalability, and reliability of technology solutions, and address any potential risks or issues that may impact business operations.
Assist in the development and documentation of disaster recovery plans, and manage annual testing of the plans
Collaborate with the Platform Architect and Decision Science teams to ensure scalability, performance, and capacity are in line with business needs
Focus on a quality user experience and demonstrate a high degree of customer service
Demonstrate ability to collaborate with team members of different backgrounds, experience, time zones, and working locations
Collaborate with IT and business partners to drive strategic initiatives forward
Convey complex technical information for diverse audiences
Continuously evaluate and improve operational processes to enhance efficiency and reduce risk
Remain up-to-date with Azure, data integration, and analytics systems

Qualifications:
QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university preferred (Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Systems, or other quantitative subject a plus); or 5+ years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience
5+ years of experience with Azure platforms including compute and networking. Certification a plus.
3+ years of experience managing a data analytics platform or other Enterprise data systems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to distill complex ideas concisely to a variety of audiences.
Demonstrate high personal standards of behavior in a professional environment. Demonstrate accountability, competence, and the ability to manage through influence.
Strong analytical, logic, and critical thinking skills required.
Advanced user in Microsoft Office Suite, including PowerPoint & Visio; must have expert functional knowledge of Excel.
Self-directed with a hunger to continually learn and grow.
Ability to work on multiple projects, competing priorities, and ensure follow-through on committed deliverables.
This is a hybrid role based in St. Louis, Missouri. In office days are Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays. Work from home days are Mondays and Fridays.

title: Information Systems Administrator (ITSA)
location: 1200 Market St Rm 212, St. Louis, MO 63103
full_description:
Description

Salary: $104,078 - $163,332
Position Grade: 20M
Department: ITSA
Job Type: Full-Time (Permanent)
Examination Number: EX1399
Location: Downtown - St. Louis, MO
The position is responsible for the stability and security of both cloud and on premise networks, a fiber network, and all networked devices. Further, the Information Systems Administrator stays abreast of emerging technologies and recommends strategies to ensure ITSA (Information Technology Services Agency) offers innovative solutions to our customers.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Manager of the ITSA Network Systems staff of 20-25 employees, supporting approximately 40 city and county agencies.
Plan, organize, and manage staff and overall operations to ensure the stable operation of the organization's IT infrastructure.
Ensure the stable operation of the in-house computer network. This includes planning, developing, installing, configuring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing all network devices (PCs, laptops, tablets, printers, and other networked devices).
Oversee the ITSA help desk operations and ensure proper staff management to meet service level agreements.
Oversee the design, installation, and optimization of ITSAs cloud environment (including private cloud/servers) and related components to achieve high performance of supported business applications. Develop processes and procedures for ongoing management of the cloud environment. Oversee the physical security, integrity, and safety of on premise data centers.
Serve as ITSA’s risk manager, assessing and holistically managing all aspects of risk brought to bear on the enterprise by IT security and legislative/regulatory compliance issues
Stay abreast of the current cyber security landscape and ensure mitigations are in place to minimize any known risks.
Develop and maintain both disaster recovery and business continuity plans.
Responsible for putting policies and procedures in place to ensure assets are inventoried and properly accounted for.
Communicate the current priorities of the IT department to their staff, which ultimately come from the priorities of the current elected administration.
Work with the Director of ITSA and their counterpart Information System Administrator in Application/Systems Development to plan new technology projects.
Supports the formulation of an ITSA strategic plan and actively participates in the implementation of that plan, ensuring staffing aligns to the set priorities.
Communicate effectively with both non-technical customers about recommended solutions and with technical staff regarding the deployment of agreed upon solutions.
Represent ITSA on technology planning teams, provide advice and counseling to planning members to ensure enterprise guidelines are adhered to when considering new technologies.
Ensure smooth transitions when new technologies are launched.
Monitor project timelines with direct reports, manage project risks, assist with clearing roadblocks, and re-allocate resources as necessary.
Develops metrics to measure project status and project leader performance.
Determines staff, material, and equipment needs for supporting the infrastructure and recommends/justifies budgetary requests for resources, including use of bond funds and capital improvement funds.
Manages any contracts or vendor agreements relative to network support.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Data Utilization: Requires the ability to perform mid to upper-level data analysis including the ability to coordinate, strategize, systemize and correlate, using discretion in determining time, place and/or sequence of operations within an organizational framework. Requires the ability to implement decisions based on such data, and overseeing the execution of these decisions.
Human Interaction: Requires the ability to manage and direct a large group of employees, which may include firstline supervisors. Oversees and controls employee discipline, selection and allocation, and planning of human resources.
Equipment, Machinery, Tools and Materials Use: Requires the ability to operate, calibrate, tune and synchronize, and perform complex rapid adjustment on equipment, machinery and tools such as personal computers, network, calculator, and/or related materials used in performing essential functions.
Verbal Aptitude: Requires the ability to utilize a variety of reference, descriptive and advisory data and information such as purchase requisitions, status reports, contracts, technical operating manuals, disaster plans, procedures, and non-routine correspondence.
Mathematical Aptitude: Requires the ability to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division; calculate percentages, and decimals. Requires also the ability to perform advanced algebraic and geometric operations; ability to interpret descriptive statistics.
Functional Reasoning: Requires the ability to apply principles of logical or synthesis functions involving planning and directing of interrelated activities or multiple departments. Ability to deal with several concrete and abstract variables in working out approaches to major problems.
Situational Reasoning: Requires the ability to exercise the judgment, decisiveness and creativity required in situations involving the direction, control and planning of an entire program or multiple programs.
Environmental Factors: Work is normally performed in an office environment under generally safe and comfortable conditions where exposure to irate individuals poses a very limited risk of injury.
Physical Requirements: Tasks involve the ability to exert light physical effort in sedentary to light work, but which may involve some lifting, carrying, pushing and pulling of objects weighing five (5) to ten (10) pounds, such as office supplies. Tasks may involve extended periods of time at a keyboard or workstation.
Sensory Requirements: Requires the ability to recognize and identify similarities or differences between characteristics of colors, shapes and sounds associated with job-related objects, materials and tasks, such as evaluating software applications.
Qualifications

A Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other closely related information technology degree; plus seven years of experience in designing/managing/integrating diverse technology infrastructure systems, which includes five years of experience in a management or supervisory role.
Preference: A Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other closely related information technology degree.
Scoring Components and Their Weights
Experience and Training: 100%
May be Subject to:
Background Investigation: Pass/Fail
Medical Examination: Pass/Fail
Documentation of Academic Credentials must be Submitted Upon Request
When completing the Employment History and the Educational/Training History sections of the Employment Application, please be as thorough as possible when describing your education, training and experience relating to this position. Applicants will only receive credit for their experience, training and education as shown on the application. Resumes will not be accepted as a substitute to a fully completed application. Incomplete applications will not be considered.
Veterans Preference Points
To be eligible for veteran's preference points, the applicant must submit a copy of their DD 214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty with the Employment Application or upon request. The Director of Personnel may, in their discretion, accept alternate documentation.
City Residence Preference Points
City residents who pass an examination for a position in the classified service and do not receive any other preference will receive a five (5) point preference on a scale of 100 points on the exam. An additional one (1) point shall be added to the passing score of City residents who receive any other preference on a scale of 100 points. City residents must have resided in the City for at least one (1) year at the time of filing their application to be eligible for the preference points.
Accommodations
If assistance with the job application is necessary based on a physical impairment, mental impairment, or otherwise, they should reach out to the Office on the Disabled with contact information. This office will not disclose any information that an applicant or employee has a disability or has discussed possible accommodations without the applicant's or employee's prior consent.

title: Systems Administrator

full_description:
Description:
Position Overview: Service Desk Systems Administrator
The Service Desk Systems Administrator plays a vital role in delivering exceptional technical support and ensuring user satisfaction with all Karpel services and product platforms.
This position is responsible for overseeing and managing incoming support requests, ensuring timely responses, and prioritizing escalated issues. The administrator will help the team meet service level agreements (SLAs) by evaluating the urgency and business impact of each request, ensuring that critical issues are addressed promptly and effectively.
Success in this role requires a proactive mindset, the ability to work independently, and a strong commitment to team collaboration to maintain a cohesive and high-performing support environment.
________________________________________
Key Responsibilities
Respond swiftly to unplanned incidents or service disruptions, restoring functionality with top priority.
Collaborate with leadership and engineering teams for advanced technical support.
Identify and resolve recurring issues to prevent future escalations.
Proactively safeguard client and company data through best practices.
Provide coverage during staff shortages, absences, or unexpected workload increases to ensure uninterrupted service.
Support project managers during product implementations to ensure a smooth transition and immediate issue resolution.
Participate in a 24x7x365 on-call rotation to monitor systems and services, minimizing downtime and maintaining reliability.
Manage employee onboarding and offboarding processes efficiently to ensure seamless transitions.
Stay up to date with support tools such as Avanan, AutoElevate, PAX8, SentinelOne, and KnowBe4.
Apply the six-step troubleshooting methodology to resolve issues and document the resolution process thoroughly.
Perform additional duties assigned by leadership.
________________________________________
Professional Development Focus Areas
Continuously update technical skills and product knowledge.
Make consistent progress toward achieving annual SMART goals (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound).

Qualifications
Education: Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Experience: 2+ years in a technical support or service desk role, preferably in a SaaS or enterprise environment.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency with Windows OS, Active Directory, and Microsoft 365.
Familiarity with remote support tools and ticketing systems.
Experience with cybersecurity tools (e.g., SentinelOne, Avanan).
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.
Team-oriented with a proactive, customer-focused mindset.

title: Mid-Level System Architect
full_description:
**ACTIVE TS/SCI SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIRED**
The D2 team is looking for a System Architect to work on Enterprise Cross Domain Systems and associated projects. These systems provide reliable data transfers between domains for general users and programs. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and overseeing the implementation of complex and scalable system architectures. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into robust and high-performing technical solutions.

Responsibilities
Define system architecture: Lead the design, development, and documentation of system architectures for new products, features, and services.
Conduct feasibility studies: Evaluate the technical feasibility and risks associated with proposed system designs.
Develop technical roadmaps: Define and maintain long-term technical roadmaps for system evolution and modernization.
Ensure system scalability and performance: Design and implement systems that can handle high volumes of traffic and data.
Collaborate with development teams: Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams throughout the software development lifecycle.
Stay abreast of technology trends: Research and evaluate emerging technologies and their potential impact on our systems.
Ensure system security and reliability: Design and implement security measures to protect system integrity and availability.
Communicate effectively: Clearly communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Active TS/SCI Clearance (must obtain a CI Poly within 6 months of start date) (US Citizenship required)

title: Associate Communications Engineer (Entry-Level)
full_description:
About Us:
At Intramotev, we are dedicated to revolutionizing the freight industry by liberating tons of freight from congested highways, reducing carbon emissions, and enhancing transportation efficiency. We are deploying self-propelled battery-electric railcars to transform freight logistics and bring innovation to our rail network. Based in St. Louis, MO, we are committed to promoting industrial revitalization, saving lives, and minimizing the environmental impact of transportation/trucking. We actively foster a work environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunities for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Role Overview:
We are seeking an Entry-Level Communications Engineer to join the engineering team supporting the development of autonomous, self-propelled rail vehicles. This role will focus on supporting the definition, design, and implementation of the communication layers necessary for the interaction between the tablet controller, edge/site server, and the trains. You will contribute to defining the required hardware, software, and networking layers for these critical communication pathways. This position will be based out of St. Louis, MO.
Position Responsibilities:
Support the design and definition of communication architectures and protocols for rail vehicle systems.
Assist in specifying hardware components related to vehicle communication systems.
Contribute to the development and integration of software modules for communication between system components (tablet, server, train)
Help define networking requirements and configurations for reliable system operation.
Participate in testing and validation efforts to ensure communication systems meet operational and functional requirements.
Collaborate with multi-disciplinary engineering teams, including electrical, mechanical, and software engineers.
Support problem-solving and lifecycle support for fielded communication systems.
Assist in researching technological advancements related to communication systems for potential application
Participate in design and peer reviews.
Team Dynamics:
Work within dynamic teams on diverse projects.
Foster excellent interpersonal and communication skills to thrive in a collaborative environment.
Adapt to evolving project objectives and requirements.
Engage in occasional domestic travel for testing, integration, demonstrations, and customer interactions.
Why Join Us?
Career Growth: Develop your career with a forward-thinking company dedicated to transforming rail technology.
Innovative Environment: Contribute to groundbreaking projects that bridge the past and future of rail transport.
Impactful Work: Be a key player in creating solutions that promote a more sustainable and efficient transportation network.
About You:
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
0-2 years of experience with communication systems, networking, or related engineering projects (including academic or internship experience).
Basic understanding of networking concepts (e.g., TCP/IP, wireless communication).
Familiarity with software development concepts (e.g., object-oriented programming).
Willingness to expand into technical areas beyond your area of expertise; ability to develop innovative and novel approaches.
Open-minded and comfortable working in a teaming environment or as an individual contributor.
Fluent in both written and verbal English.
U.S. Person (immigration or work visa sponsorship will not be provided).
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Experience with specific communication protocols (e.g., CAN bus, Ethernet, RF) or interfaces.
Coursework or projects focused on embedded systems communication or network programming.
Experience with debugging and testing communication systems.
Experience with software version control tools such as git.
Experience in directly applicable industry or projects, such as Rail, Electric Vehicles, or Unmanned Systems. (Note: less experience expected for entry level).
Experience with Linux TCP/IP stack networking, such as Yocto, OpenWRT, and Debian.
Typical Education and Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 0-2 years' related work experience or relevant project experience.
Relocation:
This position may offer relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Intramotev is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
If you're passionate about communications engineering and eager to contribute to autonomous rail technology, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Technology Product Development Tools Administrator
full_description:
Why Stifel:
Stifel strives for a culture that puts its clients and associates first: a culture where everyone belongs, everyone is welcome, and everyone contributes to the success of our clients, their careers, and the firm as a whole.

Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.
What You'll Be Doing:
The Technology Product Development Tools Administrator will manage, configure, and optimize the development tools used by our Technology Product Software Development teams. This individual will play a key role in ensuring the smooth operation of tools like Jira, Azure DevOps, etc. setting up workflows and managing permissions, and ensuring tools are aligned with our Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). This position will also be instrumental in working through audit requests, generating management reports, and maintaining consistency across the tools used by teams. The Tools Administrator will have a strong understanding of software development practices, hands-on experience with development tools, and the ability to drive tool effectiveness across multiple teams in a fast-paced, agile environment.
What We're Looking For:
Administer, configure, and manage a variety of development tools (including Jira, version control systems, CI/CD tools, etc.).
Create and manage workflows, permissions, and user access within development tools to ensure seamless integration and efficiency.
Regularly evaluate and optimize the use of development tools to ensure they align with the needs of the teams and the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Act as the primary point of contact for troubleshooting tool-related issues, providing timely support to teams using development tools.
Resolve technical challenges with development tools, ensuring that they are configured correctly and supporting development workflows.
Collaborate with development teams and leadership to continuously improve the efficiency of development processes, recommending new tools or enhancements to existing tools as needed.
Ensure tools are optimized to streamline workflows, improve team collaboration, and maximize productivity.
Assist in preparing for internal or external audits related to development tools, providing necessary reports and documentation as required.
Ensure that tools are compliant with organizational standards and best practices, and maintain documentation for audits.
Track and maintain records of tool usage, changes, and permissions for audit purposes.
Maintain development tools standards documentation. Generate reports on tool usage, system performance, and workflow efficiency to provide insights to management and stakeholders.
Create Jira dashboards and reports to capture valuable metrics throughout the cycle from ideation through execution.
Ensure consistency in tool usage and configurations across all teams, promoting best practices and standard operating procedures.
Provide training and guidance to development teams on the best practices for using development tools, workflows, and the importance of the SDLC processes.
Communicate any changes, updates, or new practices to stakeholders and teams in a clear and concise manner.
What You'll Bring:
Proven experience managing development tools such as Jira (or similar) and other SDLC tools.
Strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) practices and development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
Experience configuring workflows, permissions, and roles within development tools like Jira, Rally, etc.
Experience in supporting and troubleshooting development tools and resolving issues in a timely manner.
Familiarity with audit processes and creating compliance reports.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and provide technical guidance to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
Education & Experience:
Minimum Required: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Minimum Required: 3+ years related IT experience, working with software development tools.
Systems & Technology:
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git, TFS), CI/CD tools, and other development-related technologies.
Jira Certification (Jira Software Administrator or similar) is a plus.
Experience with tool integration (e.g., integrating Jira with other tools like Azure DevOps, Jenkins, etc.).

#LI-LL1
About Stifel:
Stifel is more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Project Engineer
full_description:
About Forward Slash Technology
Forward Slash Technology specializes in designing secure, scalable, and integrated technical infrastructures for SMBs and local/state government clients. Our services include network design and architecture, server and endpoint solutions, surveillance systems, access control, custom integrations, and ongoing monitoring and audit services. Join a team that values innovation, collaboration, and delivering cutting-edge technology solutions to our clients.


Position Summary
The Project Engineer plays a vital role in the successful delivery of technology projects, managing them from initial planning through implementation and support. This position requires expertise in network design, server and workstation builds, access control systems, and other technical solutions. The Project Engineer will collaborate closely with clients and internal teams to ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.


Key Responsibilities
Project Planning and Coordination
Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in alignment with client needs
Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation
Coordinate with engineering, sales, and operations teams to ensure alignment and efficiency.
Technical Execution
Design and implement network architectures, surveillance systems, A/V solutions, access control systems, and other IT infrastructures
Configure and deploy servers, workstations, and wireless solutions
Oversee the integration of custom technical solutions, ensuring functionality and scalability.
Client Collaboration
Act as the primary technical liaison for clients throughout the project lifecycle
Provide regular project updates, addressing technical concerns and managing expectations
Conduct training and handovers for client teams as required
Quality Assurance
Ensure all deliverables meet Forward Slash Technology’s quality standards and comply with relevant regulations and security protocols
Conduct thorough testing and validation of all systems before deployment
Reporting and Documentation
Maintain detailed project documentation, including configurations, test results, and system diagrams
Prepare and present final project reports for internal and client review.
Qualifications and Skills
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Experience
3+ years of experience in project engineering within the IT/technology sector
Hands-on experience with network design, server builds, access control, and surveillance systems
Technical Skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365/Azure, Windows Server, and related platforms
Knowledge of network security protocols, database administration (e.g., IBM DB2), and wireless solutions
Familiarity with access control systems, A/V setups, and custom integrations
Soft Skills
Strong problem-solving, organizational, and multitasking abilities
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Certifications
Relevant certifications (e.g., CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert) are a plus
Why Join Forward Slash Technology?
Be part of a growing company that values innovation and client satisfaction
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunities for ongoing professional development and certifications
Collaborative work environment with a focus on work-life balance
Mandatory Requirements
To maintain employment with Forward Slash Technology, all employees must meet the following requirements:
Pass a Missouri State Highway Patrol (MSHP) and federal fingerprint-based background check
Successfully complete Criminal Justice Information Systems (CJIS) training and certification
Be a U.S. citizen residing in the St Louis Metropolitan area
Hold a valid U.S. driver's license with a clean driving record
Pass random drug tests as required
Work Location : In person in our Des Peres, MO office

title: Confidentiality & Privacy Risk Manager - Technology Assessments
location: 100 S 4th St Ste 300, St. Louis, MO 63102
full_description:
Confidentiality & Privacy is seeking an experienced Manager to contribute to strategic priorities and mitigation of confidentiality and privacy risks across the Deloitte US Firms. This role will primarily support the operational processes in evaluating technologies for confidentiality and privacy risks and may also participate in key strategic priorities. The successful candidate will be expected to quickly build subject matter expertise in the US Firms' confidentiality and privacy policies while providing impactful contributions to technology risk management. He or she will be expected to participate and manage confidentiality and privacy initiatives designed to safeguard confidential information and protect Deloitte's brand and reputation.

Recruiting for this role ends on July 4th, 2025.

Work you'll do
Lead Confidentiality and Privacy Impact Assessments. Complete technical reviews for systems in development, being procured, or undergoing changes to evaluate for vulnerabilities and/or gaps in established controls, recommend mitigation measures. Update and track activities methodically with relentless attention to quality, accuracy, and timeliness.
Conduct risk assessment of established and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, internet of things, and metaverse technologies, and follow-up on progress of remediation activities.
Review and advise on technical requirements, vendor solutions, and data protection features of applications and systems utilized and/or delivered by the Deloitte US Firms.
Serve as the subject matter expert who business teams can turn to and rely on for timely and impactful guidance regarding confidentiality, privacy, technology, and risk.
Coordinate with leadership and key stakeholders to prioritize and complete assessments.
Prepare and present analyses for leadership/management.
Develop in-depth understanding of the US Firms' businesses and enabling areas to provide quick response and guidance based on potential risks to Deloitte.
Lead projects to develop, implement or enhance the US Firms' confidentiality and privacy risk program.
Contribute to the design, development, and deployment of technology solutions to enhance confidentiality and privacy processes and mitigate risk.

The successful candidate will possess:
Demonstrated track record in sound judgment, investigation, strong attention to detail, and persistence in following/driving assessments to conclusion.
Excellent organizational, communications (oral and written), problem solving, and interpersonal skills.
Strong client service orientation - our stakeholders expect and deserve high quality work products and effective resolution of identified issues.
Executive presence, strong facilitation skills.
Remain calm while retaining your ability to influence others in high pressure situations.
Highly collaborative work ethic with demonstrated agility and strong teaming skills.
Strong project management skills exhibiting an ability to prioritize and multi-task across various initiatives and activities.
Quick and eager learner to apply new skills and technologies in a results-oriented manner.
Demonstrated track record of adding value through a combination of deep technical expertise, professional judgment, and process/program/project ownership.
Experience and proficiency in MS Office products to include Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Teams.

The teamManaging risk across the Deloitte US firms is of utmost importance. As a manager in National Risk, you will help to proactively identify, mitigate, manage, and monitor risks. You will also have opportunities to contribute to strategic initiatives of the Deloitte US firms and interact with risk and business leaders. This interesting and diverse role provides an exciting opportunity for professional growth.

Qualifications:Required:
BA/BS in computer science, management information systems, cybersecurity, or related field or significant privacy industry experience required.
7+ years of related experience, including a minimum of 5 years in Risk Management, technology risk, privacy, or cyber security. Prior experience in project delivery or quality management strongly preferred.
Knowledge of technologies used to collect, share, access and use personal data such as cookies, web beacons, data warehouse, and web analytic and decision support software.
Experience with privacy platform software preferred.
Knowledge of U.S. privacy legislation such as HIPAA, CAN-SPAM, COPPA, FCRA, GLBA, stated privacy laws, state data breach laws and the capability to apply regulatory requirements within an operational context.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Ability to travel 0-10%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve

Licenses, Certifications, and Other Requirements
Certified International Privacy Professional (CIPP), Certified Information Privacy Manager (CIPM), Certified Information Privacy Technologist (CIPT), Certified Information Security Systems Professional (CISSP), or Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) certification preferred.
Working hours must allow for collaboration with colleagues in India and may require starting no later than 9:00 ET.

Information for applicants with a need for accommodation: https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $88,600-$163,500.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Industrial Engineer (Mfg Industrial Engrg)
full_description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
The Boeing Defense, Space & Security (BDS) Production Engineering team is seeking Industrial Engineers to join the St. Louis 777X program located in Berkeley, MO. The 777X program is increasing production rates and our team is currently hiring for a range of experience levels including Experienced or Lead Industrial Engineer.
Position Responsibilities
Applies industrial engineering concepts, approaches and techniques to product, process and services to meet program requirements of moderate complexity.
Maintains and develops plant and equipment layouts, capacity plans, accident prevention measures, sequencing of operations and work flows.
Supports the evaluation of new techniques and technological developments for integration into the production process and service operations.
Designs, maintains, and optimizes the production system by integrating design, supply base, facilities, equipment, and personnel.
Completes work flow design and analysis.
Develops moderately complex models, databases and spreadsheets to analyze data and provides summary analysis and metrics for consultation to leaders.
Assists with research, design, development, improvement, and implementation of processes and tools to enhance schedule performance, lower cost, and improve quality, for large scale systems integration and asset utilization.
Develops and implements plans and programs for facility/factory modifications and revisions to operating methods.
Provides product assembly instructions and standardizes assembly practices.
Prepares operations plans, includes work statement analysis, budgeting and forecasts, capacity and constraint analysis and production change, to ensure technical goals and objectives are met.
Supports execution planning by using project management, planning and scheduling and shop load practices.
Provides production, supply chain logistics, performance visibility and recovery planning support of moderate complexity.
Reconciles compliance with established industry safety, design standards and ergonomic guidelines.
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.

2+ years of experience working in a manufacturing setting
2+ years’ experience applying advanced knowledge and application of production engineering principles to analyze and implement manufacturing processes and methods
2+ years’ experience in project management and leading cross functional teams
Experience with capacity planning, manpower forecasting, line balancing, time and motion studies, process modeling and lean manufacturing
