title: Network Engineer III
full_description:
What You'll Be Doing:
The Network Engineer II role is responsible for installing, troubleshooting, and maintaining Stifel data and application networks. This is achieved through the completion of various projects and tasks which require continuous and successful collaboration with the Network Engineering team, their IT associates, and other business stakeholders.
What We're Looking For:
Administering, monitoring, and maintaining IT and digital communication infrastructure, including wireless, LAN, and WAN
Working with third-party carriers, vendors, and providers to maintain the reliability and stability of the network
Responsible for installing and upgrading network specific hardware for branch office locations
Updating and maintaining network documentation
Managing incidents and change requests via an established ticketing system
Participate in on-call rotation and/or as the first point of contact for issue escalations
What You'll Bring:
Working knowledge of computer, network, and telecommunication systems
Strong logic and reasoning skills with a high attention to detail
Excellent written, verbal, and customer service skills
Ability to describe technical information in a user-friendly manner
Self-motivator who has the ability to effectively work both individually and with a global team
Education & Experience:
Minimum Required: Bachelor�s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or or equivalent experience
Minimum Required: 2-4 years� experience implementing, designing and or troubleshooting data networks
Licenses & Credentials:
Minimum Required: Net+ Comp TIA Certification, or CCNA Certification
Systems & Technology:
Proficient in Microsoft Visio, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook
About Stifel:
Stifel is more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Account Service Representative (PINS)
full_description:
At Zelis, we Get Stuff Done. So, let’s get to it!

A Little About Us
Zelis is modernizing the healthcare financial experience across payers, providers, and healthcare consumers. We serve more than 750 payers, including the top five national health plans, regional health plans, TPAs and millions of healthcare providers and consumers across our platform of solutions. Zelis sees across the system to identify, optimize, and solve problems holistically with technology built by healthcare experts – driving real, measurable results for clients.

A Little About You
You bring a unique blend of personality and professional expertise to your work, inspiring others with your passion and dedication. Your career is a testament to your diverse experiences, community involvement, and the valuable lessons you've learned along the way. You are more than just your resume; you are a reflection of your achievements, the knowledge you've gained, and the personal interests that shape who you are.
Position Overview
The Account Services Representative will report to the Account Servicing Supervisor as part of the Zelis Fraud (Payee Identification and Network Security - PINS) department. The primary job responsibility will be service calls and tickets associated with Provider level access to Zelis’ products. The Specialist will be tasked with inbound and outbound business-to-business healthcare provider validation and troubleshooting for Provider access-related challenges, such as Multi-Factor Authentication, Passwords, Security Questions, and Admin changes. The Specialist should be a skilled communicator who can articulate processes with clients and be constantly aware of risk.
What You’ll Do
Verify that change requests, such as administrator changes and/or security question changes by clients, adhere to established standards.
Routinely monitors existing accounts and relationships for potential risk exposure to the company and assists leadership in mitigating losses.
Understand the scope of the services Zelis provides its clients and the threat landscape that may disrupt these services.
Flags account needing additional information or further review.
Ability to navigate multiple servicing systems for account reviews and client support.
Ability to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.
Continuously define user access policy, standards, roles, and procedures for security, efficiency, and scalability.
Identify and manage risk, payment, and operational, across all components of the customer lifecycle through data gathering and analytics.
Aid in documenting control gap findings, impacts and recommendations to management.
Additional primary duties will be assigned as required.
What You’ll Bring to Zelis
1-3 years of experience in customer service or related field.
Analytical mindset and comfortable working within defined SLA’s.
Ability to understand and communicate new processes, ability to adapt to change and respond effectively in a fast-paced and deadline-focused environment.
Proficiency with MS Office Programs, specifically Word, Excel, and Outlook.
Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning via training and self‐study, especially in areas related to security and risk.
Excellent verbal and written communication.
Experienced in reporting and documentation.
Strong telephone and customer service skills.
Experience with tools like JIRA, Jira Service Desk, Atlassian Access, and Confluence is preferred.
Demonstrated experience with IT controls design and implementation and or troubleshooting is preferred.
A high School Diploma or associate's degree in Cybersecurity, Information Systems, or Computer Science is preferred.
Experience in fraud/risk, information security or IT is preferred.
Location and Workplace Flexibility
We have offices in Atlanta GA, Boston MA, Morristown NJ, Plano TX, St. Louis MO, St. Petersburg FL, and Hyderabad, India. We foster a hybrid and remote friendly culture, and all our employee's work locations are based on the needs of the position and determined by the Leadership team. In-office work and activities, if applicable, vary based on the work and team objectives in accordance with Company policies.

Equal Employment Opportunity
Zelis is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications for the role. We believe in the value of diverse perspectives and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive workplace for all.

Accessibility Support
We are dedicated to ensuring our application process is accessible to all candidates. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require a reasonable accommodation with any part of the application and/or interview process, please email
TalentAcquisition@zelis.com
.

Disclaimer

You will implement IT standards, policies and/or master plan for the IT function. Guide the development and acquisition of new technologies and tools to improve the organization's internal operations and data delivery. Along with continually evaluate technology strategies implement new technological directions, guide the organization in their deployment and advise operations leadership of enhancements to existing applications and implementation of new systems while providing strategic guidance and technical assistance to IT staff and business partners.

WHAT OUR IT DIRECTORS ENJOY MOST
Producing and maintaining technical and procedural documentation as required
Managing diagnoses and resolutions within Mobile Billing hardware and software for internal and external customers.
Developing, implementing and ensuring compliance with policies and procedures that support Billing software and systems.
Developing and training Mobile Billing staff in areas such as, network, VMware, data communication links and other infrastructure services.
Assist in providing innovative ideas for improvements, for corporate, IT processes and new technologies throughout the company.
In this role you will service as the primary technical point of contract for Mobile Billing service and software clients. You’ll also be responsible for ensuring that all Mobile Billing clients are adequately supported in all systems and software that Charter offers. You will also manage Charter’s support staff and assist in making strategic decisions.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO SPECTRUM
Required Qualifications
Experience: IT work experience: 7+ years; Leadership experience: 5+ years; Project management experience: 3+ years
Education: BA/BS in Information Technology, Computer Science, MIS or related field or equivalent work experience
Abilities: Learn and support new systems and applications with detailed accuracy; Successfully distill complex technical information into clear, concise yet comprehensive communication material; Skillfully synthesizes large quantities of complex information under pressure; Multi-task, handle and organize changing priorities in a fast-paced environment; Recruit, motivate, develop, and direct people as they work; Communicate effectively and concisely to different levels and businesses; Ability to lead an operations team with a strong focus on SQL support
Skills: Demonstrated in-depth technical skills with knowledge of a wide variety of tools, technologies, methodologies; Leading others and providing constructive feedback; Work effectively and collaboratively with a wide range of stakeholders; Analytical with problem-solving abilities; decision making
Technical Skills: Hands-on experience in technical operations and SRE; Tier 3 Business Application support, Client server computing; Network Security and Architecture experience
Hybrid Schedule: Four in-office days weekly
SPECTRUM CONNECTS YOU TO MORE
Dynamic Growth: The growth of our industry and evolving technology powers our employees’ careers as they move up or around the company
Learning Culture: We invest in your learning, and provide paid training and coaching to help you succeed
Supportive Teams: Be part of a strong community that gives you opportunities to network and grow, and wants to see you succeed

title: Senior Infrastructure Analyst
full_description:
St. Louis County Government's Department of Information Technology seeks to hire for the position of Senior Infrastructure Analyst. This position will perform complex problem resolution and implement improvement assignments in support of the management and support of IT physical and virtual infrastructure.
The successful candidate will be involved in the installation, configuration, administration and support of our physical and virtual server environment as well as enterprise-wide systems including Microsoft Entra, Microsoft Intune, Office 365, e-Discovery, Active Directory, virtualization, backup/recovery and other cloud services. Responsibility for resolving complex problems and implementing improvement assignment distinguishes this job class from IT17-IT Infrastructure Analyst.
The starting salary range for this position is between $33.17 - $39.80 hourly, depending upon the candidate's qualifications as well as budgetary considerations.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package and a generous Paid Time Off (PTO) policy. To learn more about these and other County benefits, please visit: Competitive Benefits - St. Louis County Website.
St. Louis County Government is a qualified agency for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program managed by the Federal Government. For more information regarding this program, please visit: Public Service Loan Forgiveness | Federal Student Aid.
Examples of Duties
Administer, maintain and secure a variety of enterprise wide and administrative applications supported by the infrastructure and operation activities.
Participate in technology evaluation and implementation analysis for server and server infrastructure applications and services.
Assist in establishing and maintaining standards of system architecture, data communications and system security.
Develop and implement solutions for aging infrastructure.
Completion and project management of assigned projects in timely manner.
Serve as subject matter expert in enterprise wide and administrative applications or technologies.
Comply with industry standard system administration techniques and procedures.
Serve on teams and / or committees as assigned.
Perform other duties as required or assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or a related field.
At least five years of work experience in data systems, network security, operating systems, computer system architecture and virtual infrastructure.
Additional Information
SELECTION AND APPOINTMENT: A selection committee will evaluate the qualifications of each applicant which will include recentness and appropriateness of the applicant's education and experience, answers to the supplemental questions, results of employment references investigated and any other appropriate information available.

The selection committee will admit to the interview only those persons who possess the most job-related qualifications and may establish admittance criteria beyond the minimum qualifications stated above. The interview will comprise 100% of the applicant's earned grade. A candidate must earn a qualifying grade of 70 or more on the interview to be eligible for appointment. After initial interviews with the selected candidates are conducted, an email will be sent to the address on file with instructions on how to complete and submit a Conviction Questionnaire. Candidates have 3 days to complete the required questionnaire.

The five top ranking candidates, based on the final grade, will be certified to the Department Director/Appointing Authority who will make the final decision.

All applicants conditionally offered a merit position will be required to submit to urinalysis to screen for illegal drug use prior to appointment. Screening will be performed by a reputable clinical laboratory. The cost of screening will be covered by the County.

St. Louis County offers its employees many excellent benefits with paid medical insurance, 20 days of PTO (paid time off) the first year and increasing with seniority, and 11-12 paid holidays. Employees hired for full time employment will participate in the St. Louis County retirement plan where they contribute 4% of their salary to the defined benefit plan with vesting after 7 years. Other benefits include: paid life insurance, a credit union, 457 Deferred Compensation Plan, pre-tax premium pay plan, dependent care and medical expense reimbursement plans, and short and long term disability insurance.

In addition to these benefits, as of January 1, 2023, St. Louis County approved up to 480 hours of paid parental leave for eligible employees welcoming new children, either by birth or adoption. The employee can also take up to 80 hours of leave for prenatal care and up to 80 hours for care of the child within the first year.

title: Health Information Technician
full_description:

At ScionHealth, we empower our caregivers to do what they do best. We value every voice by caring deeply for every patient and each other. We show courage by running toward the challenge and we lean into new ideas by embracing curiosity and question asking. Together, we create our culture by living our values in our day-to-day interactions with our patients and teammates.

title: Applications Programmer
full_description:

title: Bioinformatics Research Analyst - Molecular Microbiology
location: 425 South Euclid Avenue, St. Louis, MO 63110
full_description:
Scheduled Hours
40
Position Summary
Provides critically complex research and experimentation for department/s allowing the advancement of scientific analysis and discovery. Serves as a subject matter expert offering support, training and guidance relative to the discipline/area. May participate and/or present on the research developed, or the established work of those within the department.

The Lopez laboratory studies viruses and their interaction with their host. Our goal is to understand how the different components of a virus population affect the infected organism and how this interaction influences the virus evolution and its maintenance in nature. Our multidisciplinary approach to gather an inclusive mechanistic understanding of the processes that result from the interaction of viruses and the infected organism will expose you to a diverse array of techniques and tools, as well as to rich intellectual diversity.
Job Description

Implements: Algorithms and computer software for analyzing omics-based data sets [high-throughput, massively parallel genomic/proteomic/clinical]; Data management and analysis solutions that aid in the storage, investigation and dissemination of large data sets.
Coordinates research project with other investigators and institutions.
Participates in developing hypotheses and experimental design.
Assists with reporting of methods, data and results.

title: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer
full_description:
Job ID: 111662

The Leonardo DRS Land Systems business is a recognized leader in the design and integration of complex technologies into new and legacy systems and platforms for global military and commercial customers. We are a 4 year running Top Workplace in the Greater St. Louis area.
Job Summary
Leonardo DRS Land Systems is seeking a full time Senior Cybersecurity Engineer for our Bridgeton, MO facility. We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to join our team, focusing on the security assessment and risk management of IT systems embedded within tactical vehicles. This role will be critical in ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive data and systems operating in challenging and dynamic environments. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of the Risk Management Framework (RMF) and have demonstrable experience applying it to complex, real-world systems. This role requires hands-on technical expertise, strong analytical skills, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
Job Responsibilities
Risk Management Framework (RMF) Implementation: Lead and execute the RMF process for IT systems within tactical vehicles, from system categorization (SP 800-60) through security control selection (SP 800-53), implementation, assessment, authorization, and continuous monitoring.
Security Assessments: Conduct comprehensive security assessments of tactical vehicle IT systems, including hardware, software, and network configurations. This includes vulnerability scanning, penetration testing (where appropriate and authorized), security architecture reviews, and configuration analysis.
Documentation: Prepare and maintain detailed RMF documentation, including System Security Plans (SSPs), Security Assessment Reports (SARs), Risk Assessments, Plans of Action and Milestones (POA&Ms), and other required artifacts. Ensure documentation is compliant with relevant standards and regulations.
Security Control Implementation and Validation: Work with engineering and IT teams to implement and validate security controls on tactical vehicle systems. This may involve hands-on configuration of systems, development of security hardening guidelines, and collaboration on system design.
Vulnerability Management: Identify, analyze, and prioritize vulnerabilities discovered through assessments or continuous monitoring. Develop and recommend remediation strategies, working with technical teams to implement solutions.
Compliance: Ensure that all security activities and documentation comply with relevant Department of Defense (DoD) instructions, NIST publications (specifically 800-series), and other applicable regulations and policies (e.g., DoDI 8510.01, DoDI 8500.01).
Collaboration: Work effectively with cross-functional teams, including engineers, system administrators, program managers, and government representatives, to ensure security is integrated throughout the system lifecycle.
Continuous Improvement: Stay current with the latest cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and technologies relevant to tactical vehicle systems. Recommend improvements to security processes and technologies.
Travel: This position may require travel to test facilities, potentially up to 25% travel, occasional travel for 1-2 week periods.
Additional Responsibilities: Support, communicate, reinforce and defend the mission, values and culture of the organization. Attend appropriate engineering, customer or business meetings. Lead less-experienced engineers.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field
5+ years of experience in cybersecurity engineering, with a demonstrated focus on applying the Risk Management Framework (RMF). This experience must include performing security assessments of IT systems.
Strong understanding of NIST SP 800-37, SP 800-53, SP 800-60, SP 800-160, and other relevant NIST publications
Experience conducting security assessments, including vulnerability scanning and security architecture review
Experience with vulnerability scanning tools, specifically Nessus or ACAS
Experience with a variety of security assessment tools, such as static code analyzers, dynamic application security testing (DAST) tools, or network analysis tools
Proficiency in both Linux and Windows operating systems
Experience with scripting in one or more common scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash, Perl)
Experience with the configuration, security hardening, and/or troubleshooting of network hardware
Experience with security hardening techniques for operating systems (e.g., Windows, Linux), network devices, and applications
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
U.S. Citizenship required and must have the ability to obtain a DoD security clearance now or within 6 months
Ability to travel up to 25% as required
U.S. Citizenship required. This position requires an active DOD security clearance or the ability to obtain such clearance within a reasonable time after commencement of employment.

The expected pay scale for this position is $90,673.00/year - $140,769.00/year for the state of Illinois. Should the level, location, or scope of the position change during the hiring process, the pay scale may be modified accordingly. When extending an offer of employment, Leonardo DRS considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position; any Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, the candidate’s relevant work experience, education/training, certifications, and key skills; internal equity; and market and business considerations.

Taking care of our people is a top priority at Leonardo DRS. We are proud to offer competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, and vision coverage, a company contribution to a health savings account, telemedicine, life and disability insurance, legal insurance, and a 401(k) savings plan. We champion wellness programs that focus on physical, emotional, and financial well-being. We develop our talent by offering programs and activities to support career-growth, professional development, and skill enhancement. title: Senior Full Stack Developer - ATC
full_description:
Qualifications:
Passionate about software development and delivering large and/or complex solutions in an iterative process.
5+ years of experience in web development technologies such as:
Vue, Angular, or React
JavaScript/NodeJS
Oracle, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB
Possess a solid understanding of Agile principles.
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, and presentation) for both a technical and non-technical audience.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Thorough understanding of what it takes to deliver an application from inception to production.
Comfortable mentoring other developers.
Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science; A combination of education, training, and experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
The well-being of WWT employees is essential. So, when it comes to our benefits package, WWT has one of the best. We offer the following benefits to all full-time employees:
Health and Wellbeing: Heath, Dental, and Vision Care, Onsite Health Centers, Employee Assistance Program, Wellness Program
Financial Benefits: Competitive pay, Profit Sharing, 401k Plan with Company Matching, Life and Disability Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Time Off: PTO & Holidays, Parental Leave, Sick Leave, Military Leave, Bereavement
Additional Perks: Nursing Mothers Benefits, Voluntary Legal, Pet Insurance, Employee Discount Program
World Wide Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to create an environment where all employees are empowered to succeed based on their skills, performance, and dedication. Our goal is to cultivate a culture of belonging that encourages innovation, collaboration, and respect for all team members, ensuring that WWT remains a great place to work for All!
Preferred Locations: St. Louis, MO., and potentially others.
#LI-LIVINGTHEDREAM
#REMOTE
Requirements:
Why WWT?
At World Wide Technology, we work together to make a new world happen. Our important work benefits our clients and partners as much as it does our people and communities across the globe. WWT is dedicated to achieving its mission of creating a profitable growth company that is also a Great Place to Work for All. We achieve this through our world-class culture, generous benefits, and by delivering cutting-edge technology solutions for our clients.
Founded in 1990, WWT is a global technology solutions provider leading the AI and Digital Revolution. WWT combines the power of strategy, execution, and partnership to accelerate digital transformational outcomes for organizations around the globe. Through its Advanced Technology Center, a collaborative ecosystem of the world's most advanced hardware and software solutions, WWT helps clients and partners conceptualize, test, and validate innovative technology solutions for the best business outcomes and then deploys them at scale through its global warehousing, distribution, and integration capabilities.
With over 12,000 employees across WWT and Softchoice and more than 60 locations around the world, WWT's culture, built on a set of core values and established leadership philosophies, has been recognized 14 years in a row by Fortune and Great Place to Work® for its unique blend of determination, innovation and creating a great place to work for all.
Want to work with highly motivated individuals on high-performance teams? Join WWT today!
What is the ATC Products team and why join?
The ATC Products team is dedicated to building innovative digital solutions that amplify and deliver the value of WWT's Advanced Technology Center. Our mission is to empower customers with tools that enable hands-on exploration of technologies, enhance learning experiences, simplify complex technical decision-making, and provide seamless access to ATC support resources when they need help. By creating intuitive platforms for lab hosting, proofs of concept, and educational resources, we equip IT practitioners with the insights they need to drive meaningful business outcomes. Joining the ATC Products team means contributing to impactful solutions that shape how organizations evaluate, adopt, and succeed with cutting-edge technology.
Here are some recent examples of the impactful work we've been involved in:
Integrated Learning Paths into our digital event experience, allowing customers to seamlessly access and enroll in educational content.
Enhanced our learning platform to provide deeper insights into user engagement, including video watch time, the article read duration and lab launches.
Developed a system for awarding digital achievements to users upon completing Cyber Range challenges and key learning milestones.
Developed a digital scoreboard to display team scores in real-time during Cyber Range events and highlight results afterward.
Built a new Help Center for wwt.com to provide a centralized, user-friendly resource for customer support and self-service content.
Implemented an AI-powered spam detection system to improve the integrity of our discussion forums on wwt.com and reduce unwanted contact submissions for our customer service team.
Streamlined our support team's workflow by integrating customer support cases from wwt.com into a third-party ticketing system.
Migrated several key pages of wwt.com to an upgraded Nuxt application, improving performance and maintainability.
What will you be doing?
As a Senior Full-Stack Developer on the team, you will be responsible for designing, building, testing, and delivering quality software that is thoughtful and maintainable. Your primary focus will be developing new features leveraging JavaScript, NodeJS, and Vue.js. You'll tackle emerging issues as they arise, offering technical and process guidance. Additionally, you will play a key role in mentoring other developers to ensure that the team is high-performing and healthy.
Responsibilities:
Build functional software and deliver technical solutions that consistently exceed stakeholder expectations using web and AI technologies.
Ensure software and solutions scale well, are cost-effective, and adhere to software development best practices.
Provide technical and professional mentoring for team members.
Lead projects and complex assignments with broad and ambiguous scope.
Write thoughtful code that is maintainable and efficient.
Interact directly with stakeholders to understand functional requirements and needs.
Demo solutions and communicate status to stakeholders at all levels.
Participate in ideation sessions and strategic planning. Help foster a team-first environment grounded on an understanding of and a commitment to the WWT Core Values.

title: Strategy & Execution Program Manager - Data & Analytics
full_description:
St. Louis
United States of America
Project & Program Management
Full time
5/14/2025
J00167402

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
Equifax Workforce Solutions is hiring a seasoned professional to manage, track, and report on Data & Analytics programs and initiatives. This role requires facilitating Agile planning and execution, and leading strategic initiatives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. The ideal candidate will be results-oriented, possess excellent communication skills, and have a proven track record in project and program management.
What you'll do:
Drive Agile excellence: Serving as scrum master to several teams, you will facilitate the D&A organization's Agile planning and execution program, ensuring adherence to best practices and continuous improvement.
Accelerate project delivery: Implement strategies to optimize project timelines, increase transparency, and maximize efficiency.
Lead strategic initiatives: Take ownership of key projects, ensuring successful execution and alignment with organizational goals.
Develop frameworks: Create and maintain comprehensive project management frameworks, processes, and templates.
Enhance organizational operations: Collaborate with analysts and managers to streamline operations and improve overall efficiency.
Report progress: Provide regular updates on key performance indicators (OKRs) to senior leadership, highlighting successes and areas for improvement.
What experience you need:
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Analytics, or related field.
7+ years of experience in project management, with a focus on Agile methodologies.
Certification in PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Scrum Master (CSM), or other relevant project/program management credentials.
Proficiency in Google Workspace, Smartsheet, JIRA, or similar project management tools.
Willingness to travel up to 1%.
What could set you apart:
Demonstrated ability to achieve measurable results in a fast-paced environment, while managing multiple priorities effectively.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex information to diverse stakeholders.
Strong relationship-building skills, with a focus on collaboration, respect, and empathy.
Ability to engage and influence cross-functional teams, driving consensus and ensuring project success.
Experience working effectively in matrix organizations and leading virtual teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically and creatively.
#LI-ES1
#LI-Hybrid
We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, 401k matching, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.
Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!
Who is Equifax?
At Equifax, we believe knowledge drives progress. As a global data, analytics and technology company, we play an essential role in the global economy by helping employers, employees, financial institutions and government agencies make critical decisions with greater confidence.
We work to help create seamless and positive experiences during life’s pivotal moments: applying for jobs or a mortgage, financing an education or buying a car. Our impact is real and to accomplish our goals we focus on nurturing our people for career advancement and their learning and development, supporting our next generation of leaders, maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment, and regularly engaging and recognizing our employees. Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our employees makes a difference and we are looking for talented team players to join us as we help people live their financial best.
Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Senior Data Engineers
full_description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members by using technology to improve health outcomes around the world. As a diversified, national organization, Centene's technology professionals have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.
EMPLOYER: Centene Management Company, LLC
POSITION: Senior Data Engineers
JOB ID No.: 1574266
DUTIES:
Responsible for the entire software implementation process, including driving the definition of business needs for new BI applications and making enhancements to existing applications.
Meet with business partners for software requirements gathering and user sign off.
Provide guidance to other junior members on the team throughout the entire software implementation process for analytics applications.
Responsible for overall software solution design, including building and testing using the following technologies: MicroStrategy, BTEQ, and Control M.
Conduct root cause analysis and advanced performance tuning for complex business processes and functionality.
Create and maintain technical documentation on the team Confluence Page.
Identify, define and implement necessary technical enhancements in our methods, standards and processes to better enable teams and constructive enterprise applications.
Actively participate in Scrum team.
Attend daily stand-ups, code reviews, backlog refinement and sprint planning sessions.
Monitor the status of work items in JIRA.
Position reports to Centene headquarters at 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, St. Louis, MO 63105 and various unanticipated worksites throughout the U.S. Telecommuting permitted 100% of the time. No additional national or international travel is anticipated.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
PRIMARY REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related, or equivalent experience acquired through accomplishments of applicable knowledge, duties, scope and skill reflective of the level of this position, and 4 years of relevant work experience.
In addition, experience with the following skills is required: 1. Developing Business Intelligence solutions using MicroStrategy. 2. Performing MicroStrategy architectural changes to build semantic layer for ad-hoc reporting use. 3. Developing Control-M scripts to automate the processes and perform day-to-day activities. 4. Designing and developing reporting components in an agile environment utilizing a test-driven development approach. 5. Analyzing data for pattern and trend identification, data mapping and issue identification using SQL tools. 6. Building functional design or prototypes based on JAD sessions with business. 7. Developing processes using Teradata tools and utilities.
JOB SITE: 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, St. Louis, MO 63105
WORK HOURS: Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week [8:00 am to 5:00 pm]
PAY RANGE: $132,921.50 to $158,100.00 per year
Centene offers a comprehensive benefits package including: competitive pay, health insurance, 401K and stock purchase plans, tuition reimbursement, paid time off plus holidays, and a flexible approach to work with remote, hybrid, field or office work schedules. Actual pay will be adjusted based on an individual's skills, experience, education, and other job-related factors permitted by law. Total compensation may also include additional forms of incentives.
To apply, please visit Centene’s web page at http://jobs.centene.com/#careers. Create a candidate profile and apply to requisition 1574266.
Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Applications Analyst
company: XTRA Lease - A Berkshire Hathaway Company
full_description:
Through a strong knowledge of XTRA Lease’s software application and technology infrastructure, help the business effectively utilize our applications. Gain experience and understanding of XTRA Lease’s customized application functionality, processes and tools to provide support and solutions. This position will work with a variety of people from all areas of our business and requires analytical and technical skills. XTRA Lease’s custom applications range from Contracts, Equipment inventory and tracking, Inspections, Maintenance work orders and Billing.
Primary Responsibilities and Duties:
Provide Daily support for production applications that includes assistance to end users located in the field, remote sites, or at the Central Support office.
Perform current state and/or root cause analysis as required to provide direction to development staff in defining solutions.
Create and run SQL for solutions requiring a data fix.
Test and diagnose problems with the developed solutions.
Provide direction to end users on the solutions or work arounds to issues.
Coordinate and conduct application testing for new IT projects, including the development of test cases.
Develop software release notes or User Guides as appropriate.
Limited to no travel is required.
Job Skills:
Six to eight years of experience as an applications analyst for IT systems providing development and support.
Technical aptitude and understanding of the various types of application solution architectures and their limitations such as: Web Applications, Smart Client .net, SSIS
Experience in various methods of data and application validation approaches: unit test cases, automated test cases, regression testing.
Understanding of database structures and how to use SQL tools to conduct data analysis and fix data.
Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work with multiple people within IT and various business departments.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite – Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint
Experience in the transportation industry with emphasis in ERP leasing and maintenance applications is desirable.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Referral program
Retirement plan
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Work Location: In person

title: Mid-Level Airworthiness Certification Engineer
full_description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
The Boeing Company is looking for a Mid-Level Airworthiness Engineer to join our team in Berkeley, Missouri. This position will apply an interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to the full range of activities required to support Airworthiness/Flight Certification of various aircraft and external stores for USAF (United States Air Force)/USN (United States Navy)/Phantom Works/DOD (Department of Defense) programs.

Position Responsibilities:
Critical thinking, problem solving, change management, project management, influencing
without authority, & consultation
Ability to communicate concisely in text, with metrics, verbally, one-on-one, in small groups,
and to large audiences
Experience managing, developing, motivating and communicating responsibilities to team
members
Maintain situational awareness of the overall program and critical path sequencing
Proactively communicate with various leadership team/s, peers and customers
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at the Berkeley, MO site.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor of Science degree from an accredited course of study in engineering, engineering technology (includes manufacturing engineering technology), chemistry, physics, mathematics, data science, or computer science
1+ years of experience working with or on an engineering team

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
3+ years related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience
An active U.S. Secret or active Top Secret Security Clearance
Experience in aircraft certification (FAA, Mil-Hdbk-516, EMAR)
Experience on multi-disciplinary teams to meet tight schedules
Experience on a large project or program which required the use of project management tools and processes
Experience with the operation of aircraft systems or knowledge of aircraft performance in one or more of the following areas: aerodynamics, stability and control, propulsion, structures, and mission systems
Experience with planning project budgets and monitoring financial performance
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace (DFW) where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
Pay & Benefits:
At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.
Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.
Summary Pay Range: $97,750 - $132,250
#CASO

Applications for this position will be accepted until Jul. 03, 2025

Export Control Requirements: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

title: Solution Architect
full_description:
with 10 yrs exp…. we need hands on person who needs to work the development & design
More of Generative AI
Solution Architect
Need someone from Manufacturing domain
Location: St. Louis, MO (Onsite)
Solution Architect for transforming the way digital applications consume and interact with data, ensuring real-time, secure, and scalable solutions that power next-generation experiences.
What you will be doing:
This isn’t just another architecture role—it’s an opportunity to redefine how digital platforms consume and interact with data. You’ll be:
Shaping an API-first, event-driven data ecosystem that powers real-time, high-performance digital experiences.
Architecting scalable, cloud-native data solutions that drive innovation in financial technology.
Guiding engineering teams and influencing data strategy, ensuring long-term scalability and resilience.
Delivering real business impact—not just designing systems, but ensuring they are built, adopted, and optimized for success.
Architect the Future of Data-Driven Digital Experiences – Design and implement scalable, resilient, and event-driven data solutions that power real-time digital interactions.
Champion API-First & Cloud-Native Data Strategies – Ensure data architectures align with modern cloud-native principles, security best practices, and API-driven ecosystems.
Define Data Governance Framework & Security Standards – Establish governance models, access control mechanisms, and security frameworks to ensure responsible data management.
Optimize for Real-Time Data Access – Design operational data stores (ODS), caching strategies, and messaging pipelines to enable high-performance data consumption.
Lead the Evolution from Legacy to Modern Data Architectures – Drive data migrations and modernize legacy databases into cloud-native, distributed architectures, leveraging Modern Data Architecture principles.
Standardize & Scale Data Architecture Best Practices – Establish reusable frameworks, reference architectures, and data management patterns that support digital applications.
Develop Reference Architectures for Data Capabilities – Define data-related technical capabilities and best practices to support solution architects and engineering teams.
Drive Developer-First Enablement – Collaborate with platform engineering teams to build scalable, reusable data access layers and API-driven data services.
Establish Cloud-Based Integration & Data Movement Patterns – Define patterns for Data Fabric, Data Mesh, and Event Streaming to optimize data movement across the cloud.
Ensure Performance, Resilience & Observability – Define strategies for data availability, consistency, and observability to ensure robust and efficient data flows.
Collaborate Across Disciplines – Partner with product teams, solution architects, and engineering leads to ensure data solutions meet business objectives.
Mentor & Influence – Provide technical leadership, guiding teams to adopt best practices in modern data architecture, governance, and optimization.
What you will need:
8+ years of experience in data architecture, data engineering, or solution architecture, with a focus on real-time digital applications and machine learning experience.
Deep expertise in event-driven, API-based, and distributed data architectures for high-performance applications.
Strong knowledge of data modeling, structured data access, and domain-driven data design to enable business capabilities.
Proven experience designing scalable, resilient, and high-availability data solutions, leveraging ODS, in-memory caching, and messaging architectures.
Expertise in Data Governance Frameworks, access controls, and compliance best practices.
Hands-on experience in migrating legacy data systems to cloud-native, scalable data architectures.
Strong grasp of modern authentication and authorization models, including OAuth, OpenID Connect, and role-based access control (RBAC).
Proficiency in SQL, NoSQL, and hybrid data models, with the ability to optimize for different application needs.
Familiarity with DevSecOps principles, ensuring security, compliance, and automation in data solutions.
Ability to educate, influence, and align solution architects and engineering teams on data architecture best practices.
Excellent communication and leadership skills, capable of driving strategic discussions and ensuring adoption of best practices.
Experience in fintech, SaaS, or large-scale consumer-facing digital platforms is highly preferred.
Self-starter with a strategic mindset, low ego, and a passion for innovation in data architecture.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field preferred.
Job Type: Contract

title: ERP Programmer/Analyst
full_description:
Tacony Corporation is searching for an ERP Programmer / Analyst to join the IT Team onsite in St. Louis, MO! We are seeking a detail-oriented individual who has demonstrated experience with developing, enhancing, integrating, and supporting business applications with a primary focus on ERP systems. Additionally, this person will be responsible for creating efficient, scalable, and maintainable solutions that align with our business goals. If you have strong technical expertise with a practical understanding of business process flows, then apply today!
What We Do
What began in Nick Tacony’s basement as a post-war, start-up company over 75 years ago has since grown into an internationally recognized global products company with multiple offices, 300+ employees, and, successful sales in over 100 countries. Now operating under experienced 3rd generation family leadership, the Tacony Corporation (“Tacony”) is ready to write its next chapter as a distributor, manufacturer, wholesaler, and, marketer of diverse and innovative products in the sewing, home floor care, and, commercial cleaning marketplace. We aren’t just looking for anybody, we are dedicated to finding someone who enjoys what they do, enjoys the people they work with and for, and want to be part of a growth oriented, people first, purposeful organization that is dedicated to the customer, its mission, and vision.
What You'll Do
Application Development:
Analyze business requirements to design conceptual and technical solutions.
Establish detailed program specifications on an enhancement request
Translate program specifications into programming language logic
Develop new, enhance, or maintain existing ERP applications and support upgrades and updates.
Perform testing on new or enhanced applications with sample data to validate functionality and performance.
Develop integrations between the ERP system and third-party applications/external systems.
Design and develop proof-of-concept prototypes that can scale into production-ready solutions based on business case.
Manage technical aspects of projects, including third-party contributions, issue tracking, and governance.
Map technical processes and support business process automation initiatives.
Develop integrated solutions utilizing RESTful web services and APIs.
Leverage full-stack development tools, frameworks, and service-oriented architecture (SOA) best practices.
Application Support:
Provide day-to-day support for application users, addressing questions related to processes, functionality, and data interpretation.
Investigate and resolve application issues and system interruptions.
Troubleshoot and resolve bugs arising from software updates, business process changes, or system limitations.

What You'll Need
Technical Expertise:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field and at least 5 years of relevant professional experience in application development and support.
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with MS SQL or other relational database engines.
Minimum 5 years of experience with an ERP system, preferrably Epicor.
Minimum 5 years of experience designing and implementing RESTful APIs.
3+ years of experience with C# and/or VB.NET.
3+ years of experience developing SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) reports.
Familiarity with software development fundamentals, including C++.
Strong skills in application testing, documentation, and ongoing maintenance.
Experience with algorithm design, optimization, and performance tuning.
Understanding of RESTful services, web API development, and integration best practices.
Business & Systems Knowledge:
Understanding of system logic, programming languages, and the Epicor development toolkit.
Knowledge of ERP data structures and system architecture.
Familiarity with business processes and common implementations (e.g., EDI, ACH processing, credit card and PayPal integrations).
Experience interfacing with external platforms (e.g., Magento, Sunset, PayPal).
Solid understanding of SQL for querying and updating relational databases.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to influence cross-functional teams and communicate effectively with stakeholders.
Attention to detail and a methodical approach to development (“step-by-step” programming mindset).
Proven ability to adapt to evolving technologies and environments.
What We Offer
As an employee at Tacony, you receive more than just a paycheck. Our total compensation package includes performance-based incentives, comprehensive medical/dental/vision programs with health savings account (HSA) or flexible spending account (FSA) options, as well as company paid life insurance, a generous paid time off (PTO) program including paid holidays and a volunteer day, and a rich 401K with employer matching contribution!

title: Sr. Consultant - Microsoft Purview and Data Goverance
location: 100 S 4th St Ste 300, St. Louis, MO 63102
full_description:
Job Title: Senior Consultant (Microsoft Purview and Data Governance)

Our Deloitte Cyber team understands the unique challenges and opportunities businesses face in cybersecurity. Join our team to deliver powerful solutions to help our clients navigate the ever-changing threat landscape. Through powerful solutions and managed services that simplify complexity, we enable our clients to operate with resilience, grow with confidence, and proactively manage to secure success.

Recruiting for this role ends 8/31/2025

Work You'll Do

As a Senior Consultant, you will be at the front lines with our clients, supporting them with their Cyber Risk needs, specifically helping them address data governance and compliance challenges using Microsoft Purview. This will include:
Conducting analysis and recommendations for clients' Microsoft Purview environments, including tools such as Data Loss Prevention, Data Security Investigations (preview), and Data Security Posture Management (preview).
Architecting, designing, and implementing large-scale data governance solutions using Microsoft Purview, including Information Barriers, Information Protection, and Insider Risk Management.
Performing technical health checks for Purview environments prior to broader deployments, focusing on Privileged Access Management and Audit capabilities.
Supporting proof of concept and production deployments of Microsoft Purview solutions, including Communication Compliance and Compliance Manager.
Assisting clients with transitions to Microsoft Purview services, including setting up data lifecycle management and eDiscovery configurations.
Assisting clients with integrating Microsoft Purview with other Microsoft security and compliance tools to enhance data governance and compliance strategies.
Assisting clients with data lifecycle management, including data retention, deletion, and archiving strategies using Microsoft Purview Data Lifecycle Management.
Assisting clients with configuration and delivery of Purview security and compliance reports and advanced threat protection capabilities.
Assisting clients manage their data estate, including data discovery, classification, and lineage tracking using Microsoft Purview tools.
Assisting clients with Microsoft best practices for data governance and compliance to improve security posture and reduce risk.
Assisting clients prepare their data governance strategies and perform regular compliance checks using Microsoft Purview Compliance Manager.
Monitoring the health of data governance policies and detecting and mitigating any compliance breaches using Microsoft Purview tools.
Assisting clients through mergers and acquisitions by integrating or segregating their data governance policies using Microsoft Purview.
Providing technical support for Microsoft Purview services and resolving service-related issues through research and troubleshooting.
Implementing industry-leading practices around data governance and compliance using Microsoft Purview.
Troubleshooting system-level problems in a multi-vendor, multi-protocol environment for Microsoft Purview.
Documenting platform technical issues, analysis, client communication, and resolution as part of cyber risk mitigation steps.
Executing on Microsoft Purview engagements during different phases of the lifecycle - assess, design, implementation, and post-implementation reviews.
Performing health checks, discovery, and cleanup of data governance and compliance infrastructure using Microsoft Purview tools.
Analyzing and reviewing data governance services such as data classification, labeling, and protection using Microsoft Purview.
Acting as a subject matter expert on cyber risk for the Microsoft Purview platform.
Contributing to eminence activities, such as whitepapers pertaining to Microsoft data governance technologies.

The Team

Enables trust and safety of online communications and digital products, protecting users, consumers, and patients from harm. Enables clients to provide consumer confidence in knowing with whom they are dealing and ensuring the integrity of access to data.

Required:
5+ years of experience in technical consulting, client problem-solving, architecting, and designing solutions around Microsoft data governance solutions (Microsoft Purview).
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.

Working experience in at least one of the areas listed below:
4+ years of hands-on technical experience with Microsoft data governance and compliance services (Microsoft Purview, data classification, labeling, protection, and integration with third-party solutions) in implementation and operations. This should include designing and implementing Purview for organizations, including integrations with applications.
4+ years of hands-on technical experience in data governance and compliance on Microsoft platforms. This should include designing and implementing data governance policies for organizations, including integrations with applications and compliance reporting.
B. Tech/BE/BCA/MCA Degree required. Ideally in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Security, Engineering, Information Technology.

Preferred:
3+ years of working with data governance protocols and frameworks.
3+ years of hands-on technical experience implementing data governance-focused security solutions for Microsoft technologies.
Certifications such as: Microsoft role-based certifications (e.g.,MS-102), CCSP, CCSK, CISSP, CCNP, CCNA, MCSE, MCSA certification a plus.

Information for applicants with a need for accommodation: https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $118,700 - $218,600.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Program Manager
full_description:
St. Louis
United States of America
Project & Program Management
Full time
6/22/2025
J00168328

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
Workforce Solutions is seeking candidates for this role to be experienced in running large technology initiatives/programs. A successful candidate will operate with a strong sense of urgency and ownership in a fast-paced agile environment. This position is an exciting multi-faceted opportunity for candidates who are highly motivated to succeed, fast learners, influential, passionate about solving problems, and perform as a team player. Due to the rapidly evolving nature of technology, the ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies. A background as a software developer is also preferred.
You will work with leadership and BU to deliver detailed designs for business cases and initiatives across the company. Perform comprehensive risk management, including governing the risk and issue process (identification, mitigation, escalation), and define program controls and governance (processes, procedures, reporting, and policies). Monitor and communicate program/initiative measures of success, plans, status, issues, and risks to team members, stakeholders, and senior management in a timely manner. This role requires the ability to collect and analyze process data; measure the effectiveness of existing business processes; and lead efforts to develop sustainable, repeatable, and quantifiable business process improvements. You will research best business practices within and outside the organization to establish benchmark data and recommend applicable business process improvement opportunities.
What You'll Do
Manage highly complex, cross-functional programs and strategic initiatives, including overall program budgeting, objectives, planning, execution, operations management, reporting, and leading the design and implementation of strategic business initiatives.
Drive program execution and strategy across multiple functional areas, large Business Units (BU’s), regions, or the enterprise.
Perform comprehensive risk management, including governing the risk and issue process (identification, mitigation, escalation), and define program controls and governance (processes, procedures, reporting, and policies).
Monitor and communicate program/initiative measures of success, plans, status, issues, and risks to team members, stakeholders, and senior management in a timely manner.
Direct resources, stakeholders, and deliverables aligned across multiple interdependent projects.
Ensure program deliverables align with desired outcomes and support business initiatives and strategies.
Develop short and long-term delivery strategies while outlining assumptions, success drivers, dependencies, expected outcomes, and strategic alternatives.
Lead budget discussions with year-end goals in mind. Present solutions to maximize profitability and client satisfaction.
Support management of security exceptions, risk assessments, new development security assessments, and similar processes.
Collaborate with risk detection and audit planning.
Collaborate with multiple departments and cross-functional teams.
Act as a point of contact for security concerns, assisting with issue resolution and investigations.
Identify industry best practices and recommend program/security updates or changes as needed.
Analyze business processes, identify intelligent automation opportunities, define AI solution value proposition, reengineer processes to improve automation potential, and recommend AI-powered approaches.
Design and implement intelligent automation solutions and/or create/investigate/roll out tools to optimize and innovate business processes.
Select processes for intelligent automation, gathering requirements, designing, presenting the projects, and rolling out the solutions to end users.
Collect process data; analyze and measure the effectiveness of existing business processes, leading efforts to develop sustainable, repeatable, and quantifiable business process improvements.
Research best business practices within and outside the organization to establish benchmark data and recommend applicable business process improvement opportunities.
Facilitate planning activities for the team.
Facilitate budget activities for the team.
Manage time tracking governance activities for the team (ensuring proper codes are changed, time is submitted and approved, etc.).
What experience you need
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Analytics, or related field.
5+ years of experience in program/project management, with a focus on Agile methodologies.
Experience with AI technologies or a strong eagerness to learn and apply new AI advancements.
Highly analytical professional with expertise in strategic planning, business partnership, and consulting, adept at execution and technical communication to drive results.
In-depth knowledge and experience to operate independently with limited guidance and oversight
Ability to apply a new perspective on existing solutions to solve complex problems
Decision-making within guidelines and policies that impact a range of customer, operational, process, or project activities
Experience in developing work plans for short-term assignments of moderate complexity
Proficiency in process data collection, analysis, and measurement for business process improvement
Experience in researching best business practices for process improvement recommendations
Experience in analyzing business processes, identifying intelligent automation opportunities, and defining AI solution value propositions
Expertise in designing and implementing intelligent automation solutions and tools for process optimization
Ability to select processes for intelligent automation, gather requirements, design, present projects, and roll out solutions to end-users
What could set you apart
Data Analysis & Scripting: Proven ability to analyze complex datasets, identify trends, and derive actionable insights. Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python/JavaScript, ) for data manipulation, automation, and reporting.
Advanced Spreadsheet Proficiency: Expert-level command of Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, including advanced formulas (VLOOKUP, INDEX/MATCH, SUMIFS, array formulas), pivot tables, and data visualization.
Coding & Automation: Familiarity with programming concepts and the ability to write clean, efficient code for process automation, data extraction, or light application development. Experience with APIs and integrating different systems is a plus.
SQL Proficiency: Solid understanding of relational databases and the ability to write SQL queries to extract and analyze data.
Process Optimization: Demonstrated experience in identifying process inefficiencies and implementing technical solutions to streamline workflows and improve operational effectiveness.
Data Visualization Tools: Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio) to create compelling dashboards and reports.
#LI-ES1
#LI-Hybrid
We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, 401k matching, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.
Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!
Who is Equifax?
At Equifax, we believe knowledge drives progress. As a global data, analytics and technology company, we play an essential role in the global economy by helping employers, employees, financial institutions and government agencies make critical decisions with greater confidence.
We work to help create seamless and positive experiences during life’s pivotal moments: applying for jobs or a mortgage, financing an education or buying a car. Our impact is real and to accomplish our goals we focus on nurturing our people for career advancement and their learning and development, supporting our next generation of leaders, maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment, and regularly engaging and recognizing our employees. Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our employees makes a difference and we are looking for talented team players to join us as we help people live their financial best.
Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Database Engineer (DBA) - Progress
full_description:
Company Overview:
For more than 50 years, NISC has developed and implemented enterprise-level and customer-facing software solutions for over 960+ utilities and broadbands across North America. Our mission is to deliver technology solutions and services that are Member-focused, quality driven and valued priced. We exist to serve our Members and help them serve their communities through our innovative software products, services and outstanding customer support. NISC has been ranked in ComputerWorld's Best Places to Work for twenty-two years, and we are looking for qualified individuals to join our team.
Our Members have over 16 million end customers (residential and businesses who receive power, internet, television and/or telephone services) that our enterprise software solution enables our Members to compete effectively in the industry, while excelling in customer service.
Position Overview:
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Database Administrator to join our team, responsible for the installation, maintenance, tuning, and support of enterprise databases. This role involves managing database performance, ensuring data integrity, and supporting internal systems critical to operations, including software distribution and patching processes. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with SQL, Progress OpenEdge, Linux, and scripting languages, and will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot issues, optimize queries, and maintain secure, high-performing database environments. Strong communication skills and a commitment to continuous improvement and shared values are essential.
Primary Responsibilities:
Provide installation, backup, restoring, tuning, technical support repair, and restoring corrupt databases, as needed.
Perform maintenance routines such as rebuilding/repairing indexes, rebuilding stats, dump/loads, and database scans.
Work with either external or internal personnel to troubleshoot database issues.
Develop SQL and tune application SQL as required.
Design/develop/maintain internal systems required for NISC operations including Software Distribution and the patching process.
Work closely with the Quality Engineering department to configure test environments.
Download and apply the latest vendor Security patches.
Develop application tools for database support, build tools, application groups, software delivery, etc.
Design, develop and maintain database schemas and database objects including stored procedures, triggers, and views; as well as deployment pipelines.
Perform database monitoring and performance tuning.
Create documentation and provide guidance to other areas of the business.
Work with other internal teams to ensure critical data projects are completed.
Communicate, both written and verbally, with management, key users, and external vendors.
Build and maintain key relationships with other teams and internal departments. Examples: InfoSec, Tech Support, and other external partners.
Troubleshoot issues to find root cause and participate in corrective/preventive action measures to remediate issues.
Create and maintain a culture of engagement and one that is conducive of NISC's Statement of Shared Values.
Commitment to NISC's Statement of Shared Values.
Desired Experience and Skills:
3-5 years of experience working in database related position with SQL and coding.
Experience in query optimization & performance tuning using OpenEdge tools.
Experience with Progress OE11 or greater.
Experience with Postgres and/or Oracle is a plus.
Experience with Linux OS.
3+ years' experience with shell scripting (bash/python/PowerShell/etc.).
Comprehensive experience in complete ETL cycle including data analysis, database design, data mapping and conversion and data loading would be a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to demonstrate composure and think analytically in high pressure situations.
Work Schedule:
Hybrid from one of our office locations:
Cedar Rapids, IA
Lake Saint Louis, MO
Mandan, ND
Hybrid Schedule: Minimum of working 3 day per week out of an office location and ability to work up to all 5 days a week from an office location.
Required Days from an Office Location: Tuesday and Wednesday - the third required day will be up to the candidate and their supervisor to choose
NISC's Shared Values & Competencies:
We're a cooperative, which means we're owned by the Members we serve. It also means that our focus is on taking care of our Members and our employees, rather than having a big bottom line. Quality service and innovative technology starts with happy and dedicated employees. Join our team and learn for yourself what sets NISC apart.
Integrity – We are committed to doing the right thing – always.
Relationships – We are committed to building and preserving lasting relationships.
Innovation – We promote the spirit of creativity and champion new ideas.
Teamwork – We exemplify the cooperative spirit by working together.
Empowerment – We believe individuals have the power to make a difference.
Personal Development – We believe the free exchange of knowledge and information is absolutely necessary to the success of each individual and the organization.
Benefits:
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance.
Health Savings Account (HSA) with $100 monthly contributions from NISC.
Like to walk? Improve your overall wellness knowledge? Ability to earn up to $800 additional dollars into your HSA each year through our Wellness Rewards program.
Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA) thru Paylocity.
Fully covered life insurance up to x3 annual base salary.
Fully covered short- and long-term disability.
401(k), traditional or Roth, with employee match up to 6% and employer 4% salary base contributions.
PTO accrual levels dependent on years of service, 120 Life Leave Event hours, and 9 paid holidays.
$2,500 Interest-FREE technology loan program.
$25,000 employee educational assistance program.
Volunteer, Wellness, Family Events and other employee fun supplied by our committees.
Employee Assistance Program; assisting employees and dependents with virtually any life event
Benevolence Committee to support employees with financial hardships like unexpected medical bills, funerals and other unfortunate hardships.
Education Preferred:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar discipline, preferred.
Certification in Database Administration, along with relevant experience in lieu of 4-year degree.
Minimum Physical Requirements:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the essential functions of this position, employees must be able to see and communicate. Employees are regularly required to maintain a stationary position, move, and operate computer keyboards or office equipment.
Disclaimer:
Management may modify this job description by assigning or reassigning duties and responsibilities at any time.

Key Words:
SQL | MySQL | Database | AWS Cloud | Aurora | RDS | Big Data | Progress | Oracle | Spark | Databricks | Shell Scripting | Bash | Linux | Python | Cassandra | MongoDB | Terraform

title: Data Analytics Manager - School of Public Health

Reporting to the Director, Data Management and Analytics, the Manager of Data Analytics will play a key role in collecting, organizing, managing, and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data for the School of Public Health’s Innovation Research Networks (IRNs).

Collaborates with IRN co-directors and research personnel to identify data needs, and designs and implements data models, dashboards, and reports. Reviews, manages, and analyzes data from various sources (primary and secondary data, interviews, focus groups, websites, publications, and statistical data sets etc.), identifies trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
