title: Technical Project Manager - IT Infrastructure
full_description:
Job Title: Technical Infrastructure Delivery Project Manager
Job Location: Saint Louis, MO
Job Type: Contract

Position Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Technical Infrastructure Delivery Project Manager to lead and manage the planning, execution, and delivery of major infrastructure projects, particularly in data center environments. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of IT/OT systems, expertise in segregation strategies, and a strong background in cybersecurity. This role demands a proactive leader capable of managing complex technical projects while ensuring security, compliance, and operational excellence. Experience in the pharmaceutical, life sciences, or chemical manufacturing industries is highly desirable.

Key Responsibilities:
Plan, execute, and deliver major data center projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives, timelines, and budgets.
Serve as the primary liaison between stakeholders, technical teams, and vendors, driving project success.
Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with business leaders and technical experts.
Oversee the design and implementation of data center solutions, including hardware, networking, and system architecture.
Ensure robust IT/OT segregation strategies are implemented to meet business and security requirements.
Coordinate with engineering teams to ensure seamless integration of infrastructure components.
Drive the implementation of cybersecurity best practices, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Proactively identify and mitigate security risks, particularly in IT/OT convergence scenarios.
Collaborate with security teams to design and enforce segmentation and access control strategies.
Act as a trusted advisor to senior leaders, providing updates on project progress, risks, and opportunities.
Partner with cross-functional teams, including IT, OT, operations, and vendors, to ensure project alignment and smooth execution.
Develop and implement risk management plans to address potential challenges in data center delivery.
Ensure compliance with local, national, and international regulations regarding cybersecurity and infrastructure standards.
Identify opportunities to enhance project delivery processes and infrastructure scalability.
Stay updated on emerging technologies and trends in IT/OT and cybersecurity to inform project strategies.

Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor//'s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; advanced degree or certifications (e.g., PMP, CISSP, TOGAF) preferred.

Experience:
Minimum of 10+ years of experience in infrastructure project management, including successful delivery of major data center projects.
Expertise in IT/OT systems, with a strong understanding of integration and segregation strategies.
Proven track record in implementing cybersecurity frameworks and strategies within enterprise environments.
Background in working at pharmaceutical, life sciences, or chemical manufacturing companies is a significant advantage.

Technical Skills:
Knowledge of networking, server infrastructure, storage solutions, and data center technologies.
Proficiency in cybersecurity standards (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001) and technologies (e.g., firewalls, intrusion detection, and SIEM).
Familiarity with operational technology (OT) systems and protocols (e.g., SCADA, ICS).

title: Cloud Engineer (TS/SCI Clearance Required)
full_description:
North Point Technology is looking for a TS/SCI cleared Cloud Engineer to assist with the development, integration, deployment, and sustainment of mission critical systems.
This program requires employees to have an active TS clearance with and SCI or the ability to obtain an SCI post hire and must pass a CI Poly every 5 years. If you have a Full Scope Poly, working this program will keep your Full Scope ACTIVE.
Position Overview
North Point Technology is seeking a driven AWS Cloud Engineer to design, deploy, and sustain mission-critical, cloud-based software solutions. You'll help shape secure architectures, streamline deployments, and ensure 99.9% uptime across multiple environments.
Responsibilities
Architect & Secure – Collaborate on AWS system designs, driving ATO compliance and hardening.
Requirement Analysis – Review system needs through a cyber-security lens; offer configuration recommendations.
Best-Practice Integration – Capture lessons learned and embed industry standards into new designs.
Pipeline & Ops Support – Maintain CI/CD workflows, triage outages, resolve integration issues, and support developer testing.
Service Management – Deploy and monitor EC2, S3, Lambda, OpenShift (PaaS), ensuring high availability.
Data & Metrics – Orchestrate data movement, track cost/utilization dashboards, and optimize resource use.
Change Validation – Execute end-to-end testing, validate government system changes, and author design/validation docs.
Required Skills & Experience
Proficiency across AWS services (EC2, S3, Lambda, CloudFormation, Terraform) and OpenShift.
Hands-on with DevOps toolchain: GitLab, Jenkins, Jira, Confluence, Zabbix, HP Fortify, ACAS.
Strong Linux & Windows administration, plus container orchestration (Docker/Kubernetes).
Solid grasp of software development lifecycles, code baseline management, and DevSecOps principles.
Excellent communicator and collaborative problem-solver.
Bachelor's in CS/IT or equivalent; active TS/SCI clearance (Poly-eligible).
Preferred Qualifications
IC/DoD cloud architecture experience (e.g., NGA ATO processes).
AWS Certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer).
DoD 8570 IAT Level 2/3 compliance; NGA Privileged User Account.
Familiarity with aeronautical datasets and SFA mission requirements.
Experience designing CI/CD pipelines and participating in Analysis of Alternatives.
Work Schedule
Mon, Wed, Fri – Work from Home
Tue – St. Louis, MO office or NGA 2nd Street
Thu – O'Fallon, IL office
As Needed – Customer site at NGA 2nd Street (2 days/week)
If you're ready to advance critical cloud solutions in a dynamic environment, apply today!

North Point Technology is THE BEST place to work for curious-minded engineers motivated to support our country's most crucial missions! We focus on long term projects, leveraging the latest technology in support of innovative solutions to solve our customer's most difficult problems.
At North Point Technology, EMPLOYEES come first! We value our employees by providing excellent compensation, benefits, and a flexible work-life balance. We strive for a close-knit and open atmosphere where the owners are always directly available to our team members.
Come join us! Apply with North Point Technology today!

title: FELLOW, POST DOCTORAL
full_description:
Hiring Department

UMSL Geospatial, VC Academic Affairs, St. Louis
Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Geospatial Post-Doctoral Fellow to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for conducting independent research and assisting with ongoing geospatial research projects at UMSL Geospatail Collaborative. This position is a full-time, temporary appointment for one year, with the possibility of renewal for an additional year, contingent upon available funding.
Responsibilities : Conduct independent research in geospatial science using advanced analytical and statistical techniques with a focus on addressing important societal and environmental challenges. Develop and implement geospatial models and algorithms to analyze complex spatial data. Work collaboratively with other researchers and contribute to ongoing geospatial research projects. Collect, process, and analyze geospatial data from various sources such as satellites, drones, and ground-based sensors. Prepare reports, manuscripts, and presentations of research findings for publication and conference presentation. Writing and submitting grant proposals to prestigious federal funding agencies such as NSF. Assist with teaching geospatial courses as needed. Mentor graduate students and participate in the training of junior staff.
Benefits : Competitive salary and benefits package. Access to cutting-edge research facilities and equipment. Opportunities for professional development and training. Collaborative and interdisciplinary work environment.
Qualifications

Ph.D. in Geospatial Science/Engineering, Computer Science, Geomatics, or a closely related field, with a strong focus on geospatial science and technology, earned within the past five years.
In-depth knowledge of remote sensing, GIS, and spatial statistics.
Expertise in geospatial data, including geospatial analysis and modeling techniques.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and/or MATLAB.
Advanced proficiency in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
Strong communication skills and a demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with others.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Evidence of research productivity through peer-reviewed journal publications or conference proceedings.
Application Materials

1. Submit an online application that includes a cover letter, CV, research statement, and a copy of your transcript (https://www.umsl.edu/services/hrs/careers/faculty.html).
2. Arrange for three Letters of Recommendation to be sent directly to Dr. Reda Amer via email at reda.amer@umsl.edu.
Application Deadline

The position will be open until filled.
Sponsorship Information

Visa Sponsorship Information:
Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. The University will not sponsor applicants for this position for employment visas.
Benefit Eligibility

This position is eligible for University benefits. As part of your total compensation, the University offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental and vision plans, retirement, paid time off, short- and long-term disability, paid parental leave, paid caregiver leave, and educational fee discounts for all four UM System campuses. For additional information on University benefits, please visit the Faculty & Staff Benefits website at https://www.umsystem.edu/totalrewards/benefits.
Equal Employment Opportunity
The University of Missouri is an Equal Opportunity Employer .

To request ADA accommodations, please email the Office of Human Resources at umslhr@umsl.edu .

title: Consulting Manager - Strategic Portfolio Management
full_description:
MANAGER - STRATEGIC PORTFOLIO MANAGEMENT (SPM)
WHO WE ARE

Maryville Consulting Group is a nationally recognized firm with an entrepreneurial spirit where you are encouraged and enabled to take on challenges every day of your career. For over 30 years, we have successfully helped organizations of all sizes and industries embrace technology-enabled strategies to improve business outcomes. By design, we remain a boutique consulting firm seeking to expand our selective group of highly valued and impactful leaders.

Our team enables global organizations in solving their most demanding challenges at the enterprise level. We are recognized as a cohesive team of business and technology leaders whose diverse backgrounds, skillsets, and capabilities help bring prescriptive, comprehensive, and sustainable solutions to our clients. We hire and grow dynamic individuals interested in building upon their existing capabilities by providing opportunities to learn, execute, and lead engagements with Fortune 500 clients.

To learn more about what clients you could be working with, how we help serve them, and where you may provide the biggest business impact, visit maryville.com.

THE ROLE

Maryville Consulting Group is seeking a consulting leader to deliver high-quality outcomes for enterprise accounts across the US. This candidate will bring experience participating in and managing engagements for Fortune 500 organizations with industry best practice approaches. This role will have the opportunity to impact existing client engagements and support business development opportunities. In all cases, we seek leaders that work to take unstructured problems and drive a well-defined and thorough execution method to delivery.

This role is within Maryville’s Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) Practice, which provides solutions to help executive leaders measure, manage and communicate the value of technology to the enterprise. We drive the alignment, prioritization, and optimization of enterprise technology to maximize the engagement and productivity of our client’s employees. Common engagements include managing and measuring performance, optimizing technology investments and implementing shared-service operating models. The SPM Practice is expanding with substantial opportunity for career growth and additional accountabilities.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT

As part of the SPM Team, you will provide guidance and offer unique perspectives that enable clients to run IT as a value-driving business partner. You will be expected to:
Impact engagements, lead client-facing teams (typically 2-8 people), and deliver timely outcomes while attaining the highest possible client satisfaction
Identify opportunities to expand and grow strategic accounts through high-quality engagement delivery and excellent client relationships
Support MCG’s growth through recruiting activities, client acquisition & retention, industry events, mentorship of associate hires, etc.

KEY QUALIFICATIONS
6+ Years of Consulting Experience, or equivalent experience in applicable field
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and spoken
Experience in enterprise technology, managerial finance or management & technology consulting
Demonstrable consulting & delivery management skills with the ability to drive outcomes both independently and while leading small to mid-size (2-8 people) teams
Comfortable influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives
Demonstrated leadership in problem statement definition, solution proposal, and solution execution
Ability and willingness to travel up to 10%
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Business development experience with a track record of developing new and expanding existing client relationships
Degree in Finance, Accounting, General Business, or Information Technology
IT industry understanding and experience of leading digital transformation initiatives
Strong Excel / Tableau, related systems background (with expectation of managing resources delivering in these solutions)

title: Langgraph, Azure, Databricks, AWS - Principal-Enterprise AI Architecture (Remote)
full_description:
Overview:
We’re a Little Different

Our mission is clear. We bring to life a healing ministry through our compassionate care and exceptional service.

At Mercy, we believe in careers that match the unique gifts of unique individuals – careers that not only make the most of your skills and talents, but also your heart. Join us and discover why Modern Healthcare Magazine named us in its “Top 100 Places to Work.”

Overview:

Principal – Enterprise AI Architecture
Langgraph, Azure, Databricks, AWS

Position can be remote (Work from Home)

Please note that as of the posting date of this job announcement, Mercy is unable to offer immigration sponsorship or visa assistance for this position. We encourage all eligible candidates, including U.S. citizens, permanent residents, and those with existing work authorization, to apply.

The Principal – Enterprise AI Architecture serves as Mercy’s top AI Architect, accountable for the design, orchestration, governance, and evolution of the enterprise AI architecture. This role leads the strategic direction for AI systems across clinical, operational, and business domains including the development of scalable, ethical, and federated agentic AI frameworks. The Principal ensures architectural alignment across Mercy’s federated model, drives enterprise-wide standards, and acts as the chief advisor and steward for all AI-related architectural decisions.

Qualifications:
Experience: 7 years of experience in AI/ML solution design, development, and architecture.3 years of experience leading enterprise architecture or large-scale AI systems
Required Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, AI, or related field with demonstrated ongoing education and personal development.
Other:
Demonstrated experience with agentic AI or autonomous systems is strongly preferred.
Strong knowledge of AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure), and containerization.
Proven ability to lead architectural governance and create reference models.
Deep understanding of security, privacy, and compliance frameworks.
Effective communicator with ability to translate technical architecture to business and clinical leaders.
Proficiency in Project/Product Management and Agile methodologies.
Collaborative leadership with a servant ethos; capable of influencing across a federated organization.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or related field.Experience as a Chief Architect or equivalent role overseeing cross-functional AI strategy.Experience implementing LangGraph or similar agentic AI frameworks.
We Offer Great Benefits:

Day-one comprehensive health, vision and dental coverage, PTO, tuition reimbursement and employer-matched retirement funds are just a few of the great benefits offered to eligible co-workers, including those working 32 hours or more per pay period!

We’re bringing to life a healing ministry through compassionate care.

At Mercy, our supportive community will be behind you every step of your day, especially the tough ones. You will have opportunities to pioneer new models of care and transform the health care experience through advanced technology and innovative procedures. We’re expanding to help our communities grow. Join us and be a part of it all.

What Makes You a Good Match for Mercy?

Compassion and professionalism go hand-in-hand with us. Having a positive outlook and a strong sense of advocacy is in perfect step with our mission and vision. We’re also collaborative and unafraid to do a little extra to deliver excellent care – that’s just part of our commitment. If that sounds like a good fit for you, we encourage you to apply.

title: Senior Manager, Architecture (M&A)
full_description:
Job Responsibilities
Lead and mentor a team of IT infrastructure architects, providing technical guidance, career development, and fostering collaboration within merger, acquisition, separation, and transformation (M&A) projects.
Establish and enforce architectural standards and best practices across IT infrastructure domains, ensuring consistency in networking, data center operations, and server management.
Spearhead the evaluation and adoption of new technologies, tools, and frameworks that enhance IT infrastructure integration in merger, acquisition, separation, and transformation (M&A) scenarios.
Collaborate with senior leadership, engineering, and merger, acquisition, separation, and transformation (M&A) teams to ensure IT infrastructure architecture aligns with broader business and integration strategies.
Assess and mitigate architectural risks associated with IT infrastructure consolidation, ensuring seamless transition and minimal disruption during merger, acquisition, separation, and transformation (M&A) activities.
Oversee resource allocation, ensuring the right networking, data center, and server expertise is applied to each project.
Drive continuous improvement of IT infrastructure processes, tools, playbooks, and frameworks to keep the organization at the forefront of merger, acquisition, separation, and transformation (M&A) technology.
Serve as a thought leader in IT infrastructure architecture, contributing to industry forums, conferences, and client engagements related to merger, acquisition, separation, and transformation (M&A) IT strategy.
Core Functions of the Role
Analyze existing IT infrastructure, including networking, data centers, server environments, and enterprise cloud platforms, to assess integration feasibility in transactions.
Develop comprehensive road maps for IT infrastructure transformation post-transaction, ensuring seamless integration of networks, data centers, and computing environments.
Align IT infrastructure initiatives with business objectives, recommending the most suitable networking, cloud, data center and on-premises solutions for clients.
Design execution plans for IT infrastructure consolidation, including networking optimization, server migrations, and data center integration.
Develop change management strategies to support the adoption of new IT infrastructure solutions across merged organizations.
Conduct due diligence on IT infrastructure capabilities of acquired entities, evaluating risks, scalability, financial models, and integration complexity.
Regularly update leadership on IT infrastructure integration progress, ensuring transparency in risk management and execution timelines.
Communicate IT infrastructure solutions effectively to clients, ensuring clarity in post-merger technology strategy.
Scope IT infrastructure integration projects, including defining workstreams, developing statements of work (SOWs), and creating staffing models to support initiatives and programs.
Education & Experience Requirements
Education: Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field required; Master's degree preferred.
Experience: Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in IT infrastructure, with a strong background in networking, data centers, and server environments.
Travel: Up to 25% (domestic and international) to support M&A integration efforts.
Key Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
The candidate has deep expertise in IT infrastructure architecture, including enterprise networking, data center management, server operations, and hybrid cloud environments.
They possess a strong understanding of IT challenges in mergers, acquisitions, separations, and transformations (M&A), including infrastructure consolidation, network security, and cross-platform interoperability.
They have extensive experience leading IT infrastructure teams, focusing on mentoring, technical guidance, and professional development.
They can align IT infrastructure decisions with business strategy, ensuring that transactions achieve both operational and financial objectives.
They demonstrate exceptional communication skills and can articulate complex IT concepts to technical and executive stakeholders.
They have significant experience in cross-functional collaboration, ensuring that IT infrastructure integration aligns with broader organizational goals.
They possess in-depth knowledge of industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscapes in IT infrastructure.
They have strong problem-solving skills and a proven track record of successfully resolving IT infrastructure challenges in complex integration projects.
Preferred locations include: AL, AK, AZ, AR, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, ME, MA, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NE, NH, NJ, NY, NC, ND, OK, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, WV, WI, WY. Other locations will be considered based on fit.
The well-being of WWT employees is essential. So, when it comes to our benefits package, WWT has one of the best. We offer the following benefits to all full-time employees:
Health and Wellbeing: Heath, Dental, and Vision Care, Onsite Health Centers, Employee Assistance Program, Wellness program
Financial Benefits: Competitive pay, Profit Sharing, 401k Plan with Company Matching, Life and Disability Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Time Off: PTO & Holidays, Parental Leave, Sick Leave, Military Leave, Bereavement
Additional Perks: Nursing Mothers Benefits, Voluntary Legal, Pet Insurance, Employee Discount Program
We strive to create an environment where all employees are empowered to succeed based on their skills, performance, and dedication. Our goal is to cultivate a culture of belonging that encourages innovation, collaboration, and respect for all team members, ensuring that WWT remains a great place to work for All!
Equal Opportunity Employer
#LI-MP2
#LI-REMOTE
Requirements:
Why WWT?
At World Wide Technology, we work together to make a new world happen. Our important work benefits our clients and partners as much as it does our people and communities across the globe. WWT is dedicated to achieving its mission of creating a profitable growth company that is also a Great Place to Work for All. We achieve this through our world-class culture, generous benefits and by delivering cutting-edge technology solutions for our clients.
Founded in 1990, World Wide Technology (WWT), a global technology solutions provider leading the AI and Digital Revolution, with $20 billion in annual revenue, combines the power of strategy, execution and partnership to accelerate digital transformational outcomes for large public and private organizations around the world. Through its Advanced Technology Center, a collaborative ecosystem of the world's most advanced hardware and software solutions, WWT helps customers and partners conceptualize, test and validate innovative technology solutions for the best business outcomes and then deploys them at scale through its global warehousing, distribution and integration capabilities.
With nearly 10,000 employees and more than 55 locations around the world, WWT's culture, built on a set of core values and established leadership philosophies, has been recognized 13 years in a row by Fortune and Great Place to Work® for its unique blend of determination, innovation and leadership focus on diversity and inclusion. With this culture at its foundation, WWT bridges the gap between business and technology to make a new world happen for its customers, partners, and communities.
Want to work with highly motivated individuals on high-performance teams? Join WWT today!
What is the Solutions Consulting & Engineering (SC&E) Team and why join?
Solutions Consulting & Engineering is an organization that is Customer Focused and Solutions Led. We deliver end-to-end and emerging solutions to drive customer satisfaction, increase profitability and growth. Our success is enabled by our world-class management consulting, delivery excellence and engineering brilliance. Our goal is to bring together business acumen with full-stack technical know-how to develop innovative solutions for our clients' most complex challenges.
A Brief Overview
IT Infrastructure Architecture Leadership in M&A
An accomplished IT infrastructure leader with deep expertise in networking, data center management, and server operations, specializing in mergers, acquisitions, separations, and transformations (M&A). This role is responsible for spearheading IT infrastructure strategy, ensuring seamless integration, and mitigating risks associated with complex transactions.
Key responsibilities include leading and mentoring a team of IT infrastructure architects, driving best practices, and aligning architectural decisions with business objectives. This leader collaborates with senior executives and cross-functional teams to develop roadmaps, execute transformation plans, and optimize networking, cloud, and data center solutions for M&A initiatives.
With a strong foundation in IT infrastructure architecture, this role ensures efficient resource allocation, risk mitigation, and continuous improvement of integration frameworks. Expertise in due diligence, change management, and emerging technologies enables the successful execution of IT infrastructure consolidation, delivering operational and financial value.
With 10+ years of progressive IT infrastructure experience and a track record of strategic leadership, this role demands exceptional communication, problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration skills. A thought leader in M&A IT strategy, this professional contributes to industry discussions and drives innovation in infrastructure integration.

title: Company Engagement Manager
full_description:
Claim Academy is a premier developer boot camp that offers immersive on-campus and online programs in software engineering and cybersecurity in St Louis.
Our mission is to change lives in 12-to 20 weeks with tracks in Java, C#/.Net, JavaScript and Cybersecurity designed to transform novices into industry-ready, software developers through rigorous coursework of pair programming, mentor sessions, and computer science industry programming techniques taught by expert instructors.
Participants complete their learning with multiple career coaching sessions, networking events, and soft skill training which culminates in a final capstone project where the students present to potential employers on the Demo Day and hiring event.
Extensive career training and placement assistance are provided, leading to many of our students receiving offers before they even graduate. We are fanatical about results for our students
We are expanding our team and our programs. We are looking for individuals who are ready to jump into a new role with us. We are a flourishing team and we really enjoy working together to improve our students chances of getting the jobs of their dreams!
If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, we'd like the opportunity to get to know you more.
Our Mission
Is to change lives with a career and help people fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods.
The Role
The Company Engagement Manager team is growing and we are looking for mission-driven career educators to join our awesome team.
As a Career Coach, you will be responsible for graduates' success by helping our job seekers develop their soft skills through a variety of workshops and 1-on-1 mentoring sessions. You will work cross-functionally with technical mentors, account executives, career advisors, content instructors and operations to promote engagement, process improvements, and data tracking.
Responsibilities
Act as the main coach for our students assisting them from resume prep, capstone project reviews, all the way up to salary negotiation
Provide 1-on-1 support to job seekers in the tech space ( software engineering and cybersecurity)
Support our students with resume writing, application strategies, personal branding, communication skills, capstone project practice and prep, interview prep, behavioral mock interviewing and negotiation
Learn about each student goals and experiences to determine how we can help them land a job
Ensure each student has the needed technical skills so that they can begin to apply to jobs ( refer to technical mentors, instructors etc for needed support )
You will act as the students’ go-to resource and inspiration as they work through the program
Accountability partner to experience job placements and ensuring students/grads apply to jobs and attend careers fairs
Responsible for reaching students retention and placement performance metrics (KPIs)
Managing outcome reports 15/ 30/60/180 days
Build community within Alumni groups by identifying, creating, and implementing connective experiences, like study groups, basecamp discussions, and student pairing sessions
Conduct assessments, holding students to a high bar of mastery for each content module
Conduct weekly check-ins with grads to discuss their job search updates
Work with our grads and other team members to ensure good data collection to track progress
Qualifications
3+ years of experience in career coaching at an organization or recruiting in the tech space
While this is a full-time role, some availability on evenings and some weekends may be necessary
Ability to work with or quickly learn: Google Suite, hubspot, Slack, typeform,basecamp, etc
High administrative acumen with the ability to onboard a new cohort of graduates every 6 weeks; you are that person who can manage 15 things at once and never miss a deadline - you are a zero-inbox junkie and love to cross things off your daily to-do list)*
Put our students and graduates first by having a passion for our mission and working collaboratively to pinpoint grads issues to help them land their dream job!

Benefits
Office and remote options available
Salary and Incentive Based Work; when our grads get placed - you get rewarded!
Great health, dental and vision benefits
Yearly Growth Target Bonuses
Paid PTO and flexible working hours
Paid 2 weeks vacation
Paid holidays

All applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, ancestry, physical/mental disability, medical condition, military/veteran status, genetic information, marital status, ethnicity, alienage or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. By completing this application, you are seeking to join a team of hardworking professionals dedicated to consistently delivering outstanding service to our customers and contributing to the financial success of the organization, its clients, and its employees. Equal access to programs, services, and employment is available to all qualified persons. Those applicants requiring accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should contact a management representative.”

Why WWT?
At World Wide Technology, we work together to make a new world happen. Our important work benefits our clients and partners as much as it does our people and communities across the globe. Founded in 1990, WWT is a global technology solutions provider leading the AI and Digital Revolution. WWT combines the power of strategy, execution and partnership to accelerate digital transformational outcomes for organizations around the globe. Through its Advanced Technology Center, a collaborative ecosystem of the world's most advanced hardware and software solutions, WWT helps clients and partners conceptualize, test and validate innovative technology solutions for the best business outcomes and then deploys them at scale through its global warehousing, distribution and integration capabilities.
With over 12,000 employees across WWT and Softchoice and more than 60 locations around the world, WWT's culture, built on a set of core values and established leadership philosophies, has been recognized 14 years in a row by Fortune and Great Place to Work® for its unique blend of determination, innovation and creating a great place to work for all.

Job Responsibilities:
This position will serve as the Senior Product Owner for the Strategic Partner Integration team. Core responsibilities include the following:
Develop Strategic Vision and Roadmap:
Define and communicate a strategic vision for B2B Supply Chain Integration initiatives—covering customers, vendors, carriers, and other partners—ensuring alignment with both business objectives and partner needs.
Gather and Prioritize Requirements:
Collaborate with internal stakeholders and strategic partners to elicit, document, and prioritize integration requirements, translating business needs into actionable user stories and acceptance criteria.
Product Backlog Ownership:
Own and maintain a prioritized product backlog of integration enhancements and support tasks, incorporating both new development and post-production support initiatives.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Work closely with Developers, Analysts, the Delivery Team Manager, and business stakeholders to ensure a cohesive approach to product development and the delivery of high-quality integration solutions.
Stakeholder Engagement and Communication:
Serve as the primary liaison with strategic partners across the Supply Chain, facilitating clear and ongoing communication to ensure integration solutions meet or exceed partner expectations.
Market and Competitive Analysis:
Monitor industry trends and competitor offerings to identify opportunities and potential risks in the B2B integration space, incorporating insights into the product strategy.
Agile Process Facilitation:
Actively participate in Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, stand-ups, retrospectives) to ensure timely delivery of integration projects and continuous improvement of processes.
Thought Leadership and Mentorship:
Serve as a subject matter expert on B2B integration and supply chain ecosystems, providing guidance, mentoring team members, and fostering a culture of innovation within the Strategic Partner Integration team.
Performance Measurement and Continuous Improvement:
Establish and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for integration projects, analyzing outcomes to drive ongoing enhancements and best practices across the team.
Risk Management and Issue Resolution:
Proactively identify potential risks and dependencies related to integration initiatives, collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop mitigation strategies and resolve issues promptly.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Specialist Senior - SFL Scientific
location: 100 S 4th St Ste 300, St. Louis, MO 63102
full_description:
Senior Data Scientist, Specialist Senior - SFL Scientific

Our Deloitte Strategy & Transactions team helps guide clients through their most critical moments and transformational initiatives. From strategy to execution, this team delivers integrated, end-to-end support and advisory services covering valuation modeling, cost optimization, restructuring, business design and transformation, infrastructure and real estate, mergers and acquisitions (M&A), and sustainability. Work alongside clients every step of the way, helping them navigate new challenges, avoid financial pitfalls, and provide practical solutions at every stage of their journey-before, during, and after any major transformational projects or transactions.

SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business, is a U.S. based, data science consulting firm specializing in building industry-specific, artificial intelligence (AI) technologies.

We are hiring a Senior Data Scientist to collaborate directly with clients to design and develop novel projects and solutions. Join a rapidly growing team of professionals working to build a world-class data science practice focused on solving complex and R&D problems.

Recruiting for this role ends on 6/30/2025.

Work You'll Do

As a Senior Data Scientist at SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business, you will define data strategy, drive technical development, and help us create the next generation of tools, products, and AI services. You will work closely with clients to understand their data sets, strategy, and operational requirements, in order to drive exploratory analysis and design long-term solutions.

Working with a team of interdisciplinary data scientists, engineers, architects, and consultants, our work includes novel areas such as cancer detection, drug discovery, optimizing population health and clinical trials, autonomous systems and edge AI, agentic solutions, and consumer product innovation. Join us to expand your technical career through the lens of consulting and work on novel projects and use cases to expand your data science & AI skills.
Guide clients with high autonomy in AI strategy and development, including understanding organizational needs, performing exploratory data analysis, building and validating models, and deploying models into production
Lead client initiatives to deliver AI/ML solutions, including providing thought leadership, long-term maintenance, and AI strategy objectives
Research and implement novel machine learning approaches, including advancing state of the art training, solution design, network design, and hardware optimization
Validate AI models and algorithm via code reviews, unit, and integration tests
Support prioritization of project performance and model development and ensure AI solutions are delivered to maximize business impact and new initiatives
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, project managers, and business teams to make sure delivery and presentations align with business objectives

The Team

Our Strategy offering architects bold strategies to achieve business and mission goals, enabling growth, competitive advantage, technology modernization, and continuous digital and AI transformation.

SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business, is a data science professional services practice focused on strategy, technology, and solving business challenges with Artificial Intelligence (AI). The team has a proven track record serving large, market-leading organizations in the private and public sectors, successfully delivering high-quality, novel and complex projects, and offering deep domain and scientific capabilities. Made up of experienced AI strategists, data scientists, and AI engineers, they serve as trusted advisors to executives, helping them understand and evaluate new and essential areas for AI investment and identify unique opportunities to transform their businesses.

Qualifications:
Master's or Ph.D. in a relevant STEM field (Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, etc.)
3+ years of experience in AI/ML algorithm development using core data science languages and frameworks (Python, PyTorch, etc.) and data analysis (NLP, time-series analysis, computer vision)
3+ years of experience and a proven track record applying traditional ML and deep learning techniques (CNNs, RNNs, GANs) across real-world projects, including model tuning and performance validation in production environments
3+ years of experience deploying and optimizing ML models using tools like Kubernetes, Docker, TensorRT/Trion, RAPIDs, Kubeflow, and MLflow
3+ years of experience in leveraging cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP) to deploy AI/ML workloads
Live within commuting distance to one of Deloitte's consulting offices
Ability to travel 10%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available

Preferred:
2+ years of experience working in a client-facing, consulting environment
2+ years of experience leading project/client engagement teams in the execution of complex AI data science solutions
1+ year of experience with LLM/GenAI use cases and developing RAG solutions, tools, and services (i.e., LangChain, LangGraph, MCP, etc.)
1+ year of experience with AWS Sagemaker or AWS ML Studio

Information for applicants with a need for accommodation: https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $107,600 to $198,400.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Operations Manager, Insurance Services
full_description:
Description:
Larson Financial Group LLC is looking for an experienced and forward-thinking Operations Manager to lead and optimize the technology and workflow infrastructure within our insurance department. This individual will play a critical role in streamlining operations, enhancing system efficiency, and ensuring seamless experience for clients and internal stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a background in and/or exposure to technology, process improvement, operational improvements, people leadership and management, and knowledge about the infrastructure of both life and disability insurance.
Requirements:
Key Responsibilities:
Technology & Workflow Optimization:
Evaluate, design, and implement workflow improvements using current and emerging technologies.
Act as a liaison between the Insurance department and IT/Tech partners to drive system enhancements and troubleshooting issues.
Lead automation and digital transformation efforts that increase efficiency and reduce manual touchpoints.
Own and manage the department’s operational tech stack (CRM, policy management tools, eApp platforms, etc.).
Process Management & Documentation:
Develop and maintain SOPs, training materials, and process maps.
Identify and eliminate bottlenecks, redundancies, or inefficiencies across the policy lifecycle (quoting, underwriting, issuance, and post-issue service).
Monitor KPIs related to cycle times, touchpoints, and error rates; use data to drive decision-making.
People Management:
Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team of insurance operations professionals.
Set clear goals, conduct performance reviews, and foster a culture of accountability and continuous improvement.
Align team structure and roles with evolving department needs and strategic priorities.
Encourage collaboration, innovation, and professional growth within the team.
Stakeholder Support & Training:
Partner with advisors, client service teams, and carriers to ensure smooth coordination and execution of insurance processes.
Train and support team members on new systems, tools, and workflow updates.
Requirements:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
An ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, while meeting set deadlines.
Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and accuracy, and a high level of accuracy and accountability.
Comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Commitment to maintaining the highest level of confidentiality with client information
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Operations Management, Information Technology, or related field.
Proficiency in workflow automation tools and technologies.
Experience in the tech industry and/or insurance industry. Must be prepared for a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with Salesforce and DocuSign.
Agile or PMP certification and/or experience in similar process improvement methodologies. (Lean Sigma).
Experience with project management tools (e.g., SMARTSHEET) is a plus.
Proven experience in operational management, workflow optimization, or related role.

Dental Insurance

This role blends strategic consulting with technical execution, with a primary focus on delivering impactful outcomes through WWT's service offerings. Spearheads the strategic design of innovative solutions by leveraging deep knowledge of the evolving technology landscape and maximizing internal WWT capabilities
Actively pursue business opportunities at large, complex customers; work with clients and internal WWT Teams to develop and negotiate statements of work, including project scope, deliverables, timelines, and costs.
Builds productive solution development teams, leveraging junior team members to support their growth and development
Technical Leadership:
Represent WWT's technical expertise to team members and customers through expertise in delivering scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud and containerization solutions
Design and implement container and cloud solutions and service offerings at customer sites - locally, regionally, and nationally - and provide feedback to drive continuous improvement
Serves as a trusted advisor to clients, adeptly understanding their unique needs and crafting tailored recommendations that drive value and foster long-term partnerships
Lead the creation of High-Level and Low-Level Designs for areas of expertise
Deliver with strong analytical, quantitative, and conceptual thinking skills and effective interpersonal and communication skills to ensure successful client projects & team performance
Maintain expert-level knowledge of WWT solution offerings and industry cloud technologies, including completing assigned courses and relevant certification exams when applicable.
Stay current with emerging technologies and advancements within existing technologies

Through its Advanced Technology Center, a collaborative ecosystem of the world's most advanced hardware and software solutions, WWT helps clients and partners conceptualize, test and validate innovative technology solutions for the best business outcomes and then deploys them at scale through its global warehousing, distribution and integration capabilities.
With over 12,000 employees across WWT and Softchoice and more than 60 locations around the world, WWT's culture, built on a set of core values and established leadership philosophies, has been recognized 14 years in a row by Fortune and Great Place to Work® for its unique blend of determination, innovation and creating a great place to work for all.
Want to work with highly motivated individuals on high-performance teams? Join WWT today!
What will you be doing?
The Engineer's role is to ensure that WWT/industry best practices and methodologies are applied to design, deployment and operations of TELCO/Service Provider technologies. We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Network Consultant/Engineer to design, implement, and manage advanced network infrastructures. This role focuses on providing consultative solutions, driving product adoption, and ensuring the successful execution of complex Service Provider projects. The ideal candidate will possess deep technical expertise, strong business acumen, and a proven track record of delivering innovative solutions that meet and exceed client expectations.
Job Responsibilities/Essential Functions/Competencies
Design and implement scalable, secure network solutions, including MPLS Service Provider Transport Networks.
Lead complex network migration projects, including MPLS-SR Spine-Leaf Fabric Network transitions.
Develop and execute detailed network diagrams, low-level designs (LLD), and implementation plans.
Utilize advanced networking protocols (BGP, ISIS, OSPF, MPLS, L3VPN, EVPN, BFD, ) for designing underlay and overlay networks (recursive route resolution, VRFs, pseudowires, control and data plane concepts, etc.)
Familiar with network monitoring practices (SNMP, syslog, gRPC) and able to infer from provided MOPs / deployment guides / documentation
Automate network processes using Python, Ansible, Terraform, and CI/CD pipelines.
Provide architectural consulting, including BOMs, SOWs, and solution presentations.
Train and mentor team members, enabling effective contribution to ongoing projects.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure seamless deployment and customer satisfaction.
Stay updated with the latest networking technologies and trends to enhance service delivery.

title: Langgraph, Azure, Databricks, AWS - Senior AI Engineer (Remote)
full_description:
Overview:
We’re a Little Different

Our mission is clear. We bring to life a healing ministry through our compassionate care and exceptional service.

At Mercy, we believe in careers that match the unique gifts of unique individuals – careers that not only make the most of your skills and talents, but also your heart. Join us and discover why Modern Healthcare Magazine named us in its “Top 100 Places to Work.”

Position can be remote (Work from Home)

The Senior AI Engineer will lead the design, development, and deployment of cutting-edge AI solutions, including large language models (LLMs) and advanced machine learning (ML) systems. This role requires expertise in operationalizing AI/ML models at scale, driving software development initiatives, and leading efforts to integrate AI technologies into clinical, operational, and business workflows. The Senior AI Engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve complex problems and contribute to Mercy’s vision of personalized, predictive, and proactive care.

Experience: 4 years of experience in AI/ML development and software engineering, with demonstrated success in deploying production-grade AI solutions.
Required Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
Other:
Experience mentoring team members or leading technical initiatives.
Proficiency in Python, Java, or C++ for AI/ML development.
Expertise with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.
Strong skills in NLP, LLM fine-tuning, and prompt engineering.
Experience with agentic AI design or orchestration tools (e.g., LangGraph, CrewAI).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), Docker, and Kubernetes.
Solid database experience (SQL/NoSQL) for structured and unstructured data.
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Education: Graduate degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience:
Experience with MLOps, distributed computing (e.g., Databricks, Spark), and microservices.
Familiarity with explainability tools, responsible AI practices, and regulatory compliance.
Track record of delivering AI applications that provide measurable business or clinical impact.

We Offer Great Benefits:

Day-one comprehensive health, vision and dental coverage, PTO, tuition reimbursement and employer-matched retirement funds are just a few of the great benefits offered to eligible co-workers, including those working 32 hours or more per pay period!

We’re bringing to life a healing ministry through compassionate care.

At Mercy, our supportive community will be behind you every step of your day, especially the tough ones. You will have opportunities to pioneer new models of care and transform the health care experience through advanced technology and innovative procedures. We’re expanding to help our communities grow. Join us and be a part of it all.

title: Construction Project Manager Technician - Parks
full_description:
This position works in the Design and Construction Division within the Department of Parks and Recreation and is responsible for mapping, coordinating construction permit projects, planning, designing, and constructing improvement projects at St. Louis County Park and Recreation facilities.

The typical starting salary range for this position is between $55,536.00 - $58,302.40 annually depending on the candidate's qualifications and experience as well as budgetary considerations. Additionally, we also offer a comprehensive benefits package and a generous Paid Time Off (PTO) policy. To learn more about these and other County benefits, please visit https://stlouiscountymo.gov/st-louis-county-departments/administration/personnel/benefits.
Examples of Duties
Develops and maintains maps and inventories of park facilities and assets using ArcGIS.
Maintains and operates the Parks and Recreation Department’s drone.
Coordinates and monitors construction project administration by inspecting work product and checks for compliance with design plans, standards, codes, and regulations. Prepares related documentation and monitors fund disbursement.
Develops or oversees the plans for new facilities and improvements to existing facilities with St. Louis County Parks.
Conducts the planning and design phases of facility construction by preparing preliminary drawings, completing plans, estimating costs, securing permits, and preparing and reviewing bid documents. Oversees professional services contracts for advanced designs.
Provides professional support for funding applications, maintenance projects, and large Department events. Coordinates with utilities and partner agencies for their uses of parkland. Oversees their designs and construction to ensure Department interests are upheld.
Performs related work as required.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Computer Science or a related field and three years related construction management experience; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
Must have or be able to obtain Remote Pilot Certificate from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA).
Additional Information
SELECTION AND APPOINTMENT: A selection committee will evaluate the qualifications of each applicant which will include recentness and appropriateness of the applicant's education and experience, answers to the supplemental questions, results of employment references investigated and any other appropriate information available.

The selection committee will admit to the interview only those persons who possess the most job related qualifications and may establish admittance criteria beyond the minimum qualifications stated above. The interview will comprise 100% of the applicant's earned grade. A candidate must earn a qualifying grade of 70 or more on the interview to be eligible for appointment. After initial interviews with the selected candidates are conducted, an email will be sent to the address on file with instructions on how to complete and submit a Conviction Questionnaire. Candidates have 3 days to complete the required questionnaire. The five top ranking candidates, based on the final grade, will be certified to the Department Director/Appointing Authority who will make the final decision.

All applicants conditionally offered a merit position will be required to submit to urinalysis to screen for illegal drug use prior to appointment. Screening will be performed by a reputable clinical laboratory. The cost of screening will be covered by the County.

St. Louis County offers its employees many excellent benefits with paid medical insurance, 20 days of PTO (paid time off) the first year and increasing with seniority, and 11-12 paid holidays. Employees hired for full time employment will participate in the St. Louis County retirement plan where they contribute 4% of their salary to the defined benefit plan with vesting after 7 years. Other benefits include: paid life insurance, a credit union, 457 Deferred Compensation Plan, pre-tax premium pay plan, dependent care and medical expense reimbursement plans, and short and long term disability insurance.

In addition to these benefits, as of January 1, 2023, St. Louis County approved up to 480 hours of paid parental leave for eligible employees welcoming new children, either by birth or adoption. The employee can also take up to 80 hours of leave for prenatal care and up to 80 hours for care of the child within the first year.

title: Principal Data Solutions Architect
full_description:
Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled Data Architect with expertise in designing, implementing, and optimizing data solutions within the professional services industry. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in Azure data services, data modeling, and AI/ML solutions to deliver advanced analytics and data-driven insights. This role requires strong collaboration skills to work with stakeholders, data engineers, and business leaders to align data architecture with organizational objectives.
Key Responsibilities:
Professional Services
Collaborate with the Delivery/Engagement Managers, pre-sales, and Account team to understand customer needs and business requirements/objectives.
Lead architecture, development, deployment, and maintain Azure generative AI and traditional machine learning solutions.
Experience engaging in high-level conversations with clients to shape potential projects.
Experience in pre-sales motions to support the sales and business development teams.
Experience collaborating with business stakeholders to understand business requirements and design AI solutions which meet those requirements
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
Excellent presentation and whiteboarding skills.
Experience communicating highly technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Be an expert in product, driving material impact and contributions back to the business. As an expert in the field, the role will have high levels of influence into customers’ needs and potential product improvements
Technical
Design and implement robust Azure data architectures for scalable data pipelines, data lakes, data warehouses, and real-time analytics platforms.
Develop comprehensive data strategies to support business intelligence, reporting, and AI/ML initiatives.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into end-to-end data solutions using Azure technologies.
Architect and manage Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Data Lake Storage to build scalable data platforms.
Develop and deploy AI/ML models within Azure Machine Learning environments to enable predictive analytics and improve decision-making processes.
Ensure data architecture adheres to data governance, security, and compliance standards specific to the professional services industry.
Design and implement data integration solutions for connecting Azure data services with third-party tools and enterprise applications.
Establish and maintain best practices for data modeling, ETL/ELT pipelines, and data transformation processes.
Optimize data storage, query performance, and cost efficiency across Azure environments.
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to data engineers, developers, and other team members.
Collaborate with AI/ML specialists to integrate machine learning models into Azure data solutions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for data architecture, pipelines, and AI/ML models.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience designing and implementing data solutions on Microsoft Azure.
Expertise in Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Data Lake Storage.
Strong understanding of data modeling, SQL, and Python for data transformation and analysis.
Background in the professional services industry with an understanding of key data challenges in that sector. Background in information technology consulting with a track record of success in the role.
Proven experience in designing secure, scalable, and high-performance data solutions.
Knowledge of data governance, data privacy regulations, and compliance standards within the professional services industry.
Experience building and deploying AI/ML models using Azure Machine Learning or equivalent frameworks.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex business needs into effective data architectures.
Preferred Qualifications:
Azure certifications such as Azure Solutions Architect Expert, Azure Data Engineer Associate, or Azure AI Engineer Associate.
Experience with Power BI, Cognitive Services, or IoT data integration.

title: Salesforce Senior Developer
full_description:
Equifax is seeking creative, high-energy and driven Senior Salesforce Developer with hands-on development skills to work on a variety of meaningful projects. Our Senior Salesforce Developer positions provide you the opportunity to join a team of talented developers working with leading-edge technology. You are ideal for this position if you are a forward-thinking, committed, and enthusiastic Senior Salesforce Developer who is passionate about technology.
This role requires being in the office 3 days/week on Tues - Thurs.
This position does not offer immigration sponsorship (current or future) including F-1 STEM OPT extension support.

What you’ll do
Design, develop, and operate high scale applications across the full engineering stack
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve the Salesforce platform.
Apply modern software development practices (serverless computing, microservices architecture, CI/CD, infrastructure-as-code, etc.)
Work across teams to integrate our systems with existing internal systems, Data Fabric, CSA Toolset.
Participate in technology roadmap and architecture discussions to turn business requirements and vision into reality.
Participate in a tight-knit, globally distributed team.
Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on network, or service operations and quality.
Manage sole project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Collaborate on scalability issues involving access to data and information.
Actively participate in Sprint planning, Sprint Retrospectives, and other team activity
What experience you need
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Minimum of 5+ years of hands-on experience in Salesforce development.
Proven experience designing and implementing complex Salesforce solutions.
Strong proficiency in Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), and Salesforce APIs.
Experience with common web technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS).
Solid understanding of Salesforce data model, security model, and sharing.
Proficient in Salesforce configurations (Objects, Flows, Process Builders, Validation Rules, Connected Apps etc)
Experience working in an Agile development environment.
Familiarity with version control systems, particularly Git.
Experience Working with at least one middleware system (Boomi, Mulesoft, Cast Iron etc)
Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I,
Salesforce Admin,
Sales Cloud,
Service Cloud,
Data Architecture & Management Designer OR Sharing AND Visibility Designer
What could set you apart
Salesforce Certified Platform Developer II,
Marketing Cloud, Experience Cloud,
Agentforce Specialist.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a strong ability to explain technical concepts clearly.
Proven ability to mentor and guide less experienced developers patiently and effectively.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
A collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive and a strong desire to help others learn and grow.
Ability to provide constructive feedback in a positive and supportive manner.

title: Adjunct Professor in Cybersecurity with Emphasis in Data Analytics (San Antonio, TX)
location: 470 E Lockwood Ave., St. Louis, MO 63119
full_description:
Description
The Department of Computer and Information Sciences at Webster University is recruiting adjunct faculty to teach in-person graduate cybersecurity courses, with an emphasis in Data Analytics at the San Antonio, Texas Campus . Adjunct faculty may teach one to two courses per term (5 terms per year) between day and night classes. Courses include but are not be limited to: data analytics, communications, social networking, critical infrastructures, intelligence/counter-intelligence, strategic operations, encryption/decryption, law and policy, threat detection, forensics, deterrence, protection of space assets, social engineering, or cloud computing.

Location:
Webster Groves Campus-WEBG

Graduate degree in either in Data Analytics or Data Science OR
Undergraduate degree in Data Analytics or Data Science and a graduate degree in computer science, finance, or related fields. OR
Graduate degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or related field combined with professional experience in any aspect of analytics.

Must reside in the San Antonio area, as this is a 100% in-person position.

Preferred Qualifications
Ph.D in IT or Cybersecurity or closely related field with a focus in cybersecurity. Additionally, experience in the fields of information security, cybersecurity, or a related area is desired.

Candidates should also have experience teaching or developing Data Visualizations and/or Analytics applications with languages such as R or Python.

Department
Computer and Info Sciences-CAIS

Please submit Cover Letter with Resume.
Include a copy of your unofficial or official transcripts.

Physical Demands

title: R&D Engineer II-Software (Data)
full_description:
Looking to build your career with a company that values innovation, stability, and people? Join our dedicated team as an R&D Engineer II-Software in Bridgeton, MO!
Since 1946, Hunter Engineering has been aligning cutting-edge technology with a strong commitment to quality. BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
4+ years of C#

4+ years of experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling
Experience designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems

Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies

Industry Leading Healthcare

Generous Paid Time Away
Tuition Reimbursement Program

Make Lives Better Together
Take Pride in the Extraordinary

title: Kibana Engineer
full_description:
Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Kibana Engineer to join our team at Scott Air Force Base, supporting the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA). The successful candidate will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining Kibana dashboards and visualizations to support data analytics and reporting requirements. This position requires a deep understanding of Kibana, Elasticsearch, and data visualization principles, strong analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain Kibana dashboards and visualizations to support data analytics and reporting requirements.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data needs and deliver high-quality data visualizations.
Implement and optimize Elasticsearch queries to ensure efficient data retrieval and visualization performance.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security by implementing best practices and adhering to relevant data governance policies.
Develop and maintain documentation for Kibana dashboards, visualizations, and related processes.
Monitor and troubleshoot Kibana and Elasticsearch issues, ensuring timely resolution and minimal disruption to operations.
Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve Kibana and data visualization practices.
Provide training and support to end-users on how to effectively use Kibana dashboards and visualizations.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field or equivalent experience.
Active DoD Secret clearance is required.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data visualization, data analytics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Kibana and Elasticsearch, including experience with designing and developing Kibana dashboards and visualizations.
Proficiency with SQL and database technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and data analytics frameworks.
Knowledge of data governance, data quality, and data security best practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., Elastic Certified Engineer, AWS Certified Data Analytics).

title: Senior System Engineer Edge Solutions
full_description:
If you are looking for a career as a Senior System Engineer, and you are interested in designing, developing, and rapidly deploying cloud-based and edge-based solutions to problems of national importance, then our Springfield, VA group of ARA has an exciting opportunity worth considering. Not only will you solve challenging core problems, but you’ll also be able to grow your career in an exciting environment that promotes teamwork and cross-training in a wide range of related disciplines.
The successful candidate for this position will have a strong passion in designing, implementing, improving, and troubleshooting cloud-based and edge-based solutions for new and/or existing systems. As a valued contributor to our team, your responsibilities will include (1) Implementing/Improving full stack solutions for unique edge, hybrid, and cloud environments; (2) Collaborative brainstorming and problem-solving to define requirements, objectives, and potential solutions; (3) Integrating and testing applications and data workflows on tactical systems; (4) Refining architectures from new ideas and customer feedback as part of an agile team.
The opportunity for career advancement and continued learning at ARA does not stop there. We strive to identify cross-training opportunities and encourage staff to become involved in upcoming R&D efforts. You will have the opportunity to inject new ideas into our longstanding operational programs. At ARA, we foster an environment where technical staff are empowered to research and develop their own ideas with resources and support from a strong internal technical team and external partners. You can expect day to day to have flexibility in choosing the level of autonomy suited to you, while at the same time enjoying a challenging technical career with great opportunities for personal growth.
This position supports a hybrid schedule.
Senior System Engineer Edge Solutions Position Requirements:
Must currently hold an active TS/SCI Clearance
BS Degree in Information Technology Management, or a closely related field along with 8-10 years of experience OR MS with 6-8 years of experience OR 13-15 years of experience in lieu of a degree.
Demonstrated knowledge in automation and development; Experience with Python, Bash, and Powershell scripting. Experience with Ansible/Tower and GitLab for configuration management and version control.
Familiarity with REST API usage and development.
Proficient in virtualization and containerization technologies such as: VMware, KVM, XenServer/XCP-ng, Docker/Podman, Kubernetes, OpenShift, Rancher, etc.
Working knowledge of enterprise cloud offerings and cloud-based environments.
Working knowledge of the OSI model and understanding of the interactions and dependencies of different layers.
Experience with F5 BigIP LTM and APM and/or NGINX.
Strong System Administration background for Windows Server and RHEL (or equivalent).
Senior System Engineer Edge Solutions Preferences:
Certification that meets the IAT level II requirement.
Strong experience with Automation, Development, and Data Manipulation
Experience with DOD accredited systems, government cloud offerings, and working within hardened environments.
Implementing security architecture based on Enterprise mandated security services
Who is ARA?
Do you want to work for a purpose? Applied Research Associates, Inc. (aka ARA) is an employee-owned international research and engineering company. We have been providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences since 1979. ARA has over 2,279 employee-owners and continues to grow rapidly. Together, our offices throughout the U.S. and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense, civil, and health technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement.
ARA also prides itself, on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. Employee ownership ensures you have a voice with what happens in the company.
To find out more about what the Intelligence, Surveillance & Reconnaissance Division has to offer, visit our website at: https://www.ara.com/benefits/
Experience
Required
8 - 10 years: Relevant Work Experience
Education
Preferred
Masters or better in Instructional Technology or related field
Bachelors or better in Information Technology or related field
Licenses & Certifications
Preferred
Security + Cert (CompTIA)
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.
