Job Summary
The System Architect is responsible for designing, developing, and overseeing the implementation of complex systems architecture. This role involves working closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications. The System Architect ensures that systems are scalable, reliable, and meet the organization's needs.
Job Responsibilities/Essential Functions/Competencies
Creates comprehensive architectural designs for systems, ensuring they meet business and technical requirements.
Develops detailed technical specifications, system diagrams, and documentation.
Works with business stakeholders, project managers, developers, and other architects to gather requirements and ensure alignment with business objectives.
Communicates architectural decisions and strategies effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Evaluates and recommends appropriate technologies, frameworks, and tools for system development.
Stays current with emerging technologies and industry trends to inform architecture decisions.
Provides guidance and technical leadership during the implementation phase, ensuring adherence to architectural standards and best practices.
Conducts code and design reviews to ensure compliance with architecture guidelines.
Monitors system performance and implement optimizations to improve efficiency, scalability, and reliability.
Identifies and resolves architectural issues and bottlenecks.
Ensures systems comply with security standards and regulatory requirements.
Implements security best practices in system design and development.
Experience with gathering and modeling data for system capacity and licensing planning.
50-70% Travel

title: Product Owner - Cloud
full_description:
Why Stifel:
Stifel strives for a culture that puts its clients and associates first: a culture where everyone belongs, everyone is welcome, and everyone contributes to the success of our clients, their careers, and the firm as a whole.

Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.
What You'll Be Doing:
The Product Owner (PO) is a member of an Agile Development Team who speaks for the client/end user. The Product Owner is responsible for guiding the team to create and deliver solutions that meet client, business, and firm goals by breaking down and defining small workable tasks (user stories) and prioritizing the team backlog to streamline the execution of priorities. The PO creates and maintains stories, and prioritizes work for new or revised features or enhancements. The PO has a significant role in quality control and is the team member empowered to accept stories as done. The Product Owner position has significant relationships and responsibilities outside of the agile team, including working closely with Product Management, customers, business owners, outside partners, and other stakeholders. The PO is cognizant, transparent, and proactive in managing dependencies across multiple teams and disciplines.
What We're Looking For:
Own the technical roadmap and adoption for an internal platform targeted to the developer community
Facilitate story creation and refinement with the team, ensuring stories adhere to the Agile INVEST model, ensuring the technical feasibility of the requirements.
Collaborate with product management, technical leadership, and technical teams to analyze the Firm's needs to ensure technical requirements and implementation align with business goals.
Manage cloud-related duties, working with AWS and Azure to ensure seamless integration, performance, and cost efficiency.
Oversee the deployment and operations of cloud infrastructure and DevOps practices, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security.
Articulate and communicate product vision and user stories in a manner clearly understandable to teams so the team understands target objectives.
Prioritize both in-flight and backlog work, including technical debt.
Set Sprint goals.
Monitor the team's progress and provide updates to leadership, product management, and stakeholders, as requested.
Ensure compliance with the Firm’s technical standards, industry standards, and best practices for cloud environments.
Identify and mitigate potential risks related to cloud architecture.
What You'll Bring:
Proficiency in deploying, configuring, and managing cloud infrastructure using AWS and Azure.
Experience managing cloud services and solutions on AWS and Azure.
Proficiency in deploying, configuring, and managing cloud infrastructure using AWS and Azure.
Strong analytical, organizational, management, negotiation, and people skills.
Strong decision making & analytical skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, team members, individual contributors).
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, flexibility, and adaptability to change, decision-making, and critical thinking skills.
Experience with Kanban, the Scaled Agile Framework, Agile, or Scrum processes.
Ability to understand evolving technologies and relate to current business demands.
Experience with cloud cost management and optimization on AWS and Azure.
Ability to build collaborative relationships across various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, team members, individual contributors).
Familiarity with cloud security best practices and compliance requirements on AWS and Azure.
Ability to design and implement cloud-based solutions that meet business requirements using AWS and Azure.
Strong analytical, organizational, management, negotiation, and people skills.
Strong decision making & analytical skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, team members, individual contributors).
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, flexibility, and adaptability to change, decision-making, and critical thinking skills.
Experience with Kanban, the Scaled Agile Framework, Agile, or Scrum processes.
Ability to understand evolving technologies and relate to current business demands.
Experience with cloud cost management and optimization on AWS and Azure.
Ability to build collaborative relationships across various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, team members, individual contributors).
Familiarity with cloud security best practices and compliance requirements on AWS and Azure.
Ability to design and implement cloud-based solutions that meet business requirements using AWS and Azure.
Education & Experience:
Minimum Required: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Project Management, Business Administration or related field.
Minimum Required: 5-7 years' experience of technology, business analysis, project management, or related study.
Licenses & Credentials:
AWS Cloud Practitioner or higher-level AWS/Azure certifications preferred.
About Stifel:
Stifel is more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Dynamics CRM Project Manager
full_description:
Job Type: Contract
Job Category: IT
Job Description
Role: Dynamics CRM Project Manager
Location: St. Louis, MO
Contract

Job Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Dynamics CRM Project Manager to oversee the planning, execution, and successful delivery of Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions. This role demands a proven leader with a comprehensive understanding of the Dynamics CRM ecosystem, along with the ability to manage complex projects, coordinate cross-functional teams, and engage with key stakeholders to ensure the seamless deployment of customer-focused solutions. The ideal candidate will possess strong organizational skills, deep technical expertise, and exceptional communication abilities.
Key Responsibilities:
Project Leadership:
Lead and manage all phases of Microsoft Dynamics CRM implementation projects, from initial scoping and planning to final delivery and post-deployment support.
Develop detailed project timelines, resource allocation plans, and milestones to ensure timely, within-budget project completion.
Serve as the primary point of contact for internal teams, clients, and external vendors, managing expectations, addressing concerns, and ensuring alignment with project objectives.
Team Coordination and Management:
Oversee a team of consultants, developers, business analysts, and other technical experts, ensuring that tasks are executed efficiently and effectively.
Provide leadership and mentorship to team members, promoting a collaborative and solution-oriented work environment.
Conduct regular team meetings to track progress, resolve roadblocks, and ensure that deliverables meet quality standards.
Stakeholder Engagement:
Engage with business stakeholders to understand requirements, translate business needs into technical specifications, and ensure that the CRM solution aligns with organizational goals.
Prepare and present regular project updates, risk assessments, and recommendations to executive leadership and client teams.
Risk and Issue Management:
Proactively identify project risks and issues, implementing mitigation strategies and adjusting project plans to address unforeseen challenges.
Ensure that all projects are delivered on time and within the agreed-upon budget.
Technical Oversight:
Provide guidance and technical leadership on Microsoft Dynamics CRM best practices, configuration, customization, and integration.
Ensure the implementation of high-quality, scalable solutions, conducting thorough testing and quality assurance prior to deployment.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, resource allocation charts, progress reports, and post-project evaluations.
Track project financials, ensuring costs align with the budget and provide regular financial status updates.
Qualifications:
Education & Certifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field.
Microsoft Dynamics CRM certifications (e.g., Dynamics 365 certifications) preferred.
PMP or other relevant project management certifications highly desirable.
Experience:
Minimum of 10+ years in project management, with a strong focus on Microsoft Dynamics CRM implementations.
Proven experience managing the full project lifecycle for Dynamics CRM, including requirement gathering, design, configuration, testing, deployment, and post-implementation support.
Demonstrated ability to manage complex, large-scale projects with cross-functional teams.
Skills & Competencies:
Strong understanding of Microsoft Dynamics CRM, including configuration, customization, integration, and administration.
In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) and tools (e.g., MS Project, Jira, etc.).
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and build relationships with stakeholders at all levels.
Strong problem-solving abilities and the capacity to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to drive change and innovation while maintaining a focus on delivering high-quality solutions.

title: Integration Engineer - Cloud, LAN, WAN
full_description:
Integration Engineer - Technology Acquisition and Engineering Integration
About Us: TULK is a premier boutique consulting firm specializing in technology and management consulting services for the US Federal Government. Our seasoned team supports Defense and National Security clients in acquiring, designing, managing, and developing advanced technology systems and business practices to drive their missions forward. We offer customized benefits, including comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, long and short-term disability coverage, flexible work schedules, performance-based bonuses, access to cutting-edge technology, tuition reimbursement, 401k plans, and more.
Opportunity: We are actively seeking individuals with diverse skills and passions to join our dynamic team. At TULK, we take pride in aligning our employees with assignments that perfectly match their unique skill sets and career aspirations. If the following position resonates with you, we invite you to apply and embark on the next phase of your career journey with TULK.
Overall Assignment Description: As a Senior-level Integration Engineer at TULK, you will play a pivotal role in spearheading the development of integration solutions for programs and projects spanning the entire enterprise. You'll be responsible for defining integration and interface requirements, collaborating closely with systems engineers, solutions architects, and programmers. Your objective: ensuring the seamless interoperability of applications and systems, delivering comprehensive mission solutions, and upholding the integrity of our system-of-systems enterprise.
Duties:
Provide a holistic systems perspective, encompassing a deep technical understanding of the relationships, dependencies, and requirements among hardware and software components.
Strategize, organize, and meticulously document solutions for complete systems or subsystems, utilizing a combination of internally developed and commercial off-the-shelf products.
Analyze, design, test, and assess network systems, including Cloud Resident computing capabilities, satellite networks, LANs, WANs, the Internet, intranets, and other data communication systems.
Orchestrate data management practices, treating and managing data as a valuable resource.
Collaborate with the Government to oversee system development initiatives, relocations, or modernization efforts. This includes in-depth analysis, telecommunications, planning, cabling, IT and cloud requisites, network security measures, and other essential factors.
Supervise the work of Mid- and Junior-level contractor Integration Engineers.
Required Skills and Experience:
US Citizenship and Top Secret SCI (TS/SCI) Security Clearance: Candidates must hold US citizenship and possess an active Top Secret SCI (TS/SCI) Security Clearance.
Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent: A Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or a related STEM degree program is required. Alternatively, candidates with equivalent Senior-level Integration Engineer experience will be considered.
Senior-level Experience: Candidates must have Senior-level work experience in government or industry, particularly in database management or Big Data analysis.
Desired Skills and Experience:
Master's Degree: A Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or a related STEM degree program is highly desirable.
Model Based Systems Engineering: Familiarity with Model Based Systems Engineering, including its processes, tools, and languages, is a significant plus.
Hashtags: #IntegrationEngineer #SeniorLevel #SystemsInteroperability #MissionSolutions #DataManagement #NetworkSecurity #BigDataAnalysis #ModelBasedSystemsEngineering #TopSecretClearance #STEM #ITManagement #USCitizenship #GovernmentContractors
Join us at TULK, where we empower you to thrive in a challenging and rewarding environment. Your expertise will drive innovation and impact critical missions. Apply today and be part of our accomplished team!

title: Sr Engineer, Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
full_description:
Brief Job Description:
Quality Engineers are involved in requirements analysis, test planning, writing test cases/scripts, test case automation, and execution of all testing (which may include application integration, system, system/network integration, performance testing and acceptance testing) required to ensure that the software is of the highest quality. After the project is released to production, These teammates are also involved to providing support to our internal customer, the technical operation group as well as service management. Besides, this role also plays a meaningful part of internal process audit and improvement to build efficiencies.
Scope and impact:
Typically work in a single QA team, as a member of a DevOps team.
Work on projects/changes, typically requires a general understanding of coordinated system and/or of at least one development environment.
Accountable for the quality of own work, delivered within agreed procedures and timeframes and passionate about internal and/or external customer needs.
Work independently within defined parameters, taking ownership of problems within own area of knowledge.
Decisions taken are made within guidelines.
Make recommendations for process improvements to immediate manager.
Some roles are responsible for limited co-ordination of the work of others.
Work under general supervision, carry out procedures to validate that all information systems products and services meet minimum company standards and end-user requirements.
Develop scripts and test cases, tests modules of larger software products or smaller stand-alone software products to ensure accurate operation and freedom from defects. Document all problems and works to resolve them. Report progress on problem resolution to management.
Implement pre-determined improvements to current procedures and reports on success of changes. Perform workflow analysis and recommends quality improvements
Required education/experience:
Bachelor’s degree or related experience (or above) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related subject area.
Minimum of 3 years testing or other development experience.
Shown expertise with software testing methodologies and tools.
Excellent English language skill.
Proficiency in Windows server and/or Unix/Linux.
Familiarity with Cloud technologies such as AWS/Azure.
Experience of formal software development lifecycle and good knowledge on process such as CMM/CMMI.
Good awareness of customer service and be an active teammate!
In-depth analysis capability.
Test automation and Programming languages skills, proficient in one or two of coding languages i.e., Shell/Python/Perl/Robot and/or C/C#/Java/VB, at least 2 years of experience in automation, 2-5 years programming experience.
Some experience on Networking, TCP/IP, financial markets, or project management is a nice to have.
LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.

title: QA & Testing Advisor - Cigna Healthcare - Remote
full_description:
Candidates who reside within 50 miles of the following locations may be asked to work in person on a hybrid schedule: Bloomfield, CT, Chattanooga, TN, Denver, CO, St Louis, MO, and Scottsdale, AZ
The QA Technical Tester is responsible for strategizing and implementing QA practices and processes across the Prepay organization. The candidate will be responsible for maintaining and adhering to Safe Agile practices. The candidate will work with the team in designing and ensuring overall integrity of the testing strategy. The QA will also work closely with Software Developers and other testers in small scrum or Kanban teams to deliver the highest quality products in a timely and cost-effective manner. Specific duties and responsibilities include creating, comparing and manipulating data, creating, maintaining and executing test plans and test cases, estimating test efforts, analyzing and communicating test results, defect tracking and participating in day-to-day testing activities. The candidate will also be responsible for ensuring regression test scripts are current and are in the appropriate format for automation.
Responsibilities:
Be a part of an ongoing effort to bring new testing knowledge and methodologies to the team
Works with business partners and IT staff to establish and maintain a consistent testing methodology
Identify and prepare complex test data to support the test cases defined by the team
Design, develop and code SQL programs to execute backend code tests
Design a comprehensive testing strategy & build test suites
Design, develop and maintain regression test beds and schedule test cycles
Leverage the testing process and test tool kit to create re-usable test sets
Ensure regression scripts are in appropriate format for automation
Test execution-manual and automated
Perform UAT of functional requirements
Utilize appropriate testing tools
Assist in the coordination of User Acceptance testing (UAT) and End to End (E2E) testing
Validate and report progress, risks, issues and defects to agile team
Communicates with business partners and agile team members throughout the project life cycle, to assist and support the design, development and implementation of effective systems and deliverables
Be an active participant during PI Planning, retrospective and daily stand-up meetings and business demonstrations
Participate in the review of QA procedures and processes and the development of QA metrics for assessing the quality delivered application software or systems.
Support all post implementation activities, such as post implementation testing and lessons learned analysis
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher strongly preferred in business or computer science or equivalent work experience required
6 + years of experience in testing. Experience with automation testing is highly desirable
Advanced database experience in SQL server databases and proficiency in Transact SQL required for the following:
Ability to insert data in a table
Ability to modify data within a table
Ability to delete/truncate tables
Ability to save off copies of tables
Experience with deciphering complex SQL stored procedures as required
Extensive QA/Software testing experience in large cross platform testing programs in both WEB (UI) and BE (database) testing
Exposure to working in Agile/Scrum environment
Familiarity with AAPS tools and applications a plus
Working knowledge of automated testing tools and techniques, broad knowledge of business modeling, process engineering, change management and test case generation techniques across the testing lifecycle
Solid experience in business requirements analysis, test design, defect logging and tracking
Demonstrated experience in tools such as Selenium WebDriver, Jenkins, GIT, and JavaScript preferred
Testing/working experience with Healthcare IT and familiarity with Healthcare IT terminology, business functions and processes
Experience in all aspects of JIRA
Experience working with business analysts, system analysts and developers for test requirement gathering, acceptance criteria etc.
Skilled utilizing test formulation tools for test management and operations, to include performance and load testing tools as well as test reporting tools (Zephyr)
Competent user of the following tools: SAS, Microsoft Visual Studio, ESP job scheduler, Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
Knowledge of how to query from PMHS, Proclaim and/or Facets a plus
Must be able to manage multiple assignments with staggered deadlines
Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation and documentation skills
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong team and task management skills
Self-directed and highly adaptive to changing priorities
Innovative thinking and possess a keen eye for detail
Comfortable working independently or as part of a team
Flexible schedule a must.
Employees will be required to work some evenings, weekends, or holidays.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.
For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 94,200 - 157,000 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.
This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.
We want you to be healthy, balanced, and feel secure. That’s why you’ll enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits, with a focus on supporting your whole health. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and paid holidays. For more details on our employee benefits programs, visit Life at Cigna Group.
About The Cigna Group
Doing something meaningful starts with a simple decision, a commitment to changing lives. At The Cigna Group, we’re dedicated to improving the health and vitality of those we serve. Through our divisions Cigna Healthcare and Evernorth Health Services, we are committed to enhancing the lives of our clients, customers and patients. Join us in driving growth and improving lives.
Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, childbirth (including pregnancy) or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.
If you require reasonable accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com for support. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.
The Cigna Group has a tobacco-free policy and reserves the right not to hire tobacco/nicotine users in states where that is legally permissible. Candidates in such states who use tobacco/nicotine will not be considered for employment unless they enter a qualifying smoking cessation program prior to the start of their employment. These states include: Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Nebraska, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, and Washington State.

title: Desktop Support Specialist
full_description:
Job Title

Desktop Support Specialist

Department

IT Department

Posting Date

June 17, 2025

Closing Date for Resumes/Applications

Open Until Filled

Salary

$61,331.17/ Annually

Comprehensive, Cost Effective Benefits Package:

Medical, Dental, Voluntary Vision, Life and Disability Insurance; FSA; HSA; Retirement and Deferred Compensation programs; Paid Vacation; Paid Holidays; Employee Assistance Programs and Educational Benefits.

Exempt/Non-exempt

Exempt

Status

Full time

Under the general direction of the Innovation and Technology Director, the purpose of this position is to provide end-user technical support for City information and computer processing systems. Primary duties include testing, installing, and maintaining desktop/notebook operating system environment, and working with vendors as needed to resolve difficult technical issues. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to: providing end-user IT support and training, resolving tier I and II hardware and software issues, maintaining and updating computer desktop environments and related equipment, maintaining and implementing user-facing systems and applications, researching new hardware and software solutions, tracking and managing IT work orders, and managing inventory, asset tracking and reporting systems.
Must have thorough understanding and technical proficiency in the use of Microsoft Windows desktop operating systems, Microsoft 365, microcomputer hardware, and other common peripherals in a Microsoft Windows environment. Apple/MAC OS X expertise is also highly preferred.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
The following duties are normal for this position. These are not to be construed as exclusive or all-inclusive. Other duties may be required and assigned.
Provide tier I and II technology support for technical issues including: Microsoft operating systems, Microsoft Office applications, enterprise applications, and PC hardware/peripherals.
Provide City employees with strong customer service skills during their interactions with IT.
Manage deployment and imaging of City workstations, laptops, and tablets.
Package, deploy, and manage OS and enterprise applications and updates.
Document internal procedures via work order notes and technical documentation.
Maintain EDR and related security applications.
Set up and maintain user accounts for Active Directory, email, and SaaS solutions.
Research and recommend hardware and software solutions for various City initiatives.
Assist City departments with computer system implementations, to include: solution selection, installation, and staff training.
Conduct special projects as needed/directed
Assists in assessing and prioritizing information technology needs.
Provides technical advice and assistance.
Assists and monitors record keeping for warranties and service contracts and inventory.
Performs system configuration and performance maintenance routines.
Conducts special projects as needed or directed.
Maintains knowledge of a wide variety of computer hardware and software applications and operations and procurement rules and regulations.
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Training and Experience Required to Perform Essential Job Functions
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT or related field or equivalent experience and education. A+/MCP certifications preferred.
Proven background of supporting users and devices in a modern networked environment.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft operating systems and Microsoft Office applications.
Experience managing user accounts in Active Directory and Microsoft Exchange.
Experience with NinjaOne or other systems management tools preferred.
Must be able to demonstrate mature problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to work independently performing tasks and solving problems in an environment of changing priorities and emergencies.
Must convey a professional image, have strong customer service skills, and have excellent written & verbal communication ability with experience creating technical documentation.
Must have strong organizational skills.
Ability to lift 50 pounds.

The City of Saint Charles is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify

title: Senior Software Engineer
full_description:
Job Description:

Position Summary: The Software Engineer is responsible for system design and full life cycle development and support of C++ code and related technologies in the user interface applications for Stereotaxis technologies. This role will design, develop, document, and test software written in the C++ language using Microsoft Developer Studio, and must be able to implement multiple complex software products within agreed schedule and budget.

Translate customer specifications for a software product into requirement specifications, defining architecture, and creating detailed designs.
Code software using C++ language and Microsoft Developer Studio.
Design, implement, debug, unit test and document assigned features.

10+ years relevant experience developing Object Oriented software
Proficient in C++ programming in Microsoft Visual Studio .NET and MFC environments

title: IT Technical Trainer
full_description:
Description:
New Horizons Computer Learning Centers (NH) is a premium technology & career school that offers training in all aspects of Information Technology, Leadership and Business Development. We are looking for an IT trainer (FT/PT) to teach content with official content from Microsoft, Cisco, CompTIA and other IT product vendors. Our mission is to change lives and prepare students to start a career in IT with training to transform novices into industry ready, IT workers through rigorous coursework of formal training, mentor sessions, and Information Technology topics taught live by expert instructors. Participants complete their learning with multiple career coaching, networking events, soft skill training by producing a final capstone project or prepare to achieve vendor certifications, which they present to potential employers upon successful completion of their program. Extensive career training and placement assistance are provided, leading to many of our students receiving offers while they are still in the program while finalizing their capstone projects.
About the Role:
NH is hiring trainers to teach local and remote classes in St. Louis, MO and O’Fallon, IL. The trainer will deliver approved curriculum through lecture and lab instruction to students. As a NH trainer you will guide students through assigned course work and developing their projects. You’ll collaborate with the team to meet our mission of changing lives, and provide a friendly classroom environment. This will be a full time role based in St. Louis, MO with some remote delivery options.
Requirements:
The candidate must have at least 6 months to 3 years’ experience in Computer Science / IT.
Industry-recognized professional certifications are required. (we will assist/guide candidates in achieving certifications as required)
Trainer certifications a plus (eg. MCT, CCSI, RHCI)
Candidates must submit to an interview process, including a 60-minute demonstration lesson.
Have the ability to deliver the curriculum in a fun and engaging way.
Provide feedback for curriculum improvement.
Experience teaching adults.
Ability to utilize a variety of methods and mediums in delivering course material.
Excellent written, verbal communication and reporting skills.
A desire to work in a fast-moving environment with a high degree of ownership and independence.
Proven educational or administrative experience in critical thinking and problem solving.
Engage with students, NH sales staff and student placement advisors as needed.
Positively advocate for the school and the program.
Responsibilities:
Prepares materials for the approved curriculum
Work with students 1-on-1, in pairs and in groups to support their learning and growth in the program
Prepares weekly assignments
Participates in training initiatives by providing regular, accurate, and timely feedback to students and the requirements concerning academics, behavior, attendance, etc
Motivates students to actively participate in all aspects of the educational process
Completes professional development and in-service activities in accordance with NH standards.
Where required, set up computers or LoD access at onsite locations and perform basic troubleshooting when equipment is not operational.

title: Senior Ground Segment Project Engineer
full_description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Defense & Space (BDS) is seeking a Senior Ground Segment Project Engineer to join the Ground Segment team in Berkeley, MO.
The Boeing Air Dominance business unit is currently seeking a Ground Systems Project Engineer to support Ground Segment Hardware and Software Development on a fast-paced proprietary program in Berkeley, MO.
You will be joining a fast-paced Air Dominance program where you will be responsible for coordinating across disciplines to drive project execution for Mission Planning, Debrief, and C2 activities. This role requires close collaboration across multiple IPTs the ability to coordinate tasking and drive execution for a geographically separated team. In this position you will be offered visibility to leadership, working closely with program managers and the customer on the subject projects.
Position Responsibilities:
Lead, develop, coordinate, integrate, analyze, and maintain integrated plans and schedules for complex projects
Identify risk and opportunity potential, develops mitigation planning
Coordinate tasking across local and offsite teams representing multiple skill areas to drive execution to program baselines
Lead Agile development planning as the Scrum Master for Ground Segment teams
Identify performance metrics and compares actual results to baseline plan to assess project performance, efficiencies, productivity and lessons learned
Provide status updates, milestone schedules and risk analysis summaries
Communicate program status, on-going financial viability and identification of key issues to IPT leadership
Develop and maintain relationships and partnerships with customers, stakeholders, peers, and partners
This position requires the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. An interim and/or final U.S. Secret Clearance Post-Start is required.
Ability to obtain and maintain Special Access Program (SAP) clearance

Bachelor of Science degree from an accredited course of study in engineering, engineering technology (includes manufacturing engineering technology), chemistry, physics, mathematics, data science, or computer science
9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Active Secret Security Clearance
3 or more years of experience with engineering project planning
Qualification in Project Management or equivalent preferred (PMP or CPM, etc.)
Able to work independently without high levels of supervision (self-motivated)
Familiarity with hardware and software development
Experience with Ground-based Mission Planning, Debrief, and/or Command and Control
Experience with system level verification and validation
Typical Education/Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, engineering technology (includes manufacturing engineering technology), computer science, engineering data science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience or non-US equivalent qualifications. In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

title: MP&P NDE Engineer
full_description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Defense & Space (BDS) is looking for Nondestructive Evaluation Engineers to join our team in Berkeley, MO. We are looking for a range of experience, including Mid-Level or Senior NDE Engineers.
The Midwest Nondestructive Evaluation (NDE) and Fleet Support team is part of the BDS Engineering department. We are an engineering team supporting space, commercial and defense air vehicles programs such as: 787, 777X, F-15, F-18, AV-8B, T-7A, T-45, MQ-25, KC-46, P-8, B-52, B-1, KC-135, Executive Transport platforms, Commercial Crew Transportation, Space Launch, and weapon systems. Our team is responsible for NDE Engineering supporting of pre-production, current production, and post-production efforts.
Along with supporting the aforementioned space commercial and defense programs; the team provides supplier standup/certification, fabrication support/trouble-shooting and fleet support activities across the Boeing value stream. The team also conducts NDE research and development for both internal and external customers. Our team is located in three cities: Huntsville, AL; Oklahoma City, OK; and St. Louis, MO. The chosen candidate will support the St Louis location.
We are Boeing Defense Space and Security (BDS) creates and implements innovative technologies that make the impossible possible and trailblazes the future of aerospace. We are engineers and technicians, skilled scientists and bold innovators; Join us and put your passion, determination, and skill to work building the future! #TheFutureIsBuiltHere #ChangeTheWorld
Position Responsibilities:
Apply nondestructive evaluation (NDE) methods/approaches, such as acoustic, electromagnetic, thermal, optical and radiologic principles, in developing new and novel methods/approaches to address affordability and supportability objectives
Develop new sensor technology and testing systems for nondestructive evaluation (NDE) applied to manufacturing and support areas
Define requirements for tools, equipment, materials, parts and processes used in the engineering design, manufacture and maintenance of products and approve their use
Lead development of specifications and other documents to manage the deployment of tools, equipment, materials, parts and processes
Maintain compliance with contractual and regulatory obligations
Evaluate emerging technologies for potential application to address business needs
Leads development, validation and qualification of new tools, equipment, materials, parts and processes to meet requirements
Manages test and audit programs to qualify suppliers to applicable requirements
Uses project management tools to meet cost, technical, and schedule requirements
Incorporates environmental health and safety, LEAN and Quality principles into (1) materials and processes, (2) research, design and qualification, (3) work procedures and (4) labs and office areas
Ensure compliance with industry codes, standards, and customer requirements (ASNT, ASTM, AWS, ASME, ISO, etc.).
Support audits, root cause analyses, and failure investigations as a subject matter expert.
Provide technical guidance and mentoring to junior engineers and technicians.
Supports the Team Lead and work statement, assist defining strategies and/or provides consultation.
Ability to travel 10% of the time minimum
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.
This position requires the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. An interim Pre-start and final U.S. Secret clearance Post-Start is required.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor of Science degree from an accredited course of study in engineering, engineering technology (includes manufacturing engineering technology), chemistry, physics, mathematics, data science, or computer science. (See level and experience below)
3+ years of experience in engineering
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
5+ years of hands-on experience in NDE/NDT engineering in a regulated industry (e.g., aerospace, defense, energy).
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Materials Science & Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Physics
Experience with nondestructive evaluation processes (e.g., ultrasonic testing, radiography, eddy current testing, and penetrant inspection)
Experience working in multi-discipline teams, a strong desire to work with technical and non-technical customers.
Strong understanding of materials behavior, stress analysis, and fracture mechanics.
Experience with project management tools
Excellent time management skills to manage several simultaneous projects effectively and across various geographical locations.
Active / Current Secret U.S. Security Clearance preferred but not required
Typical Education/Experience:
(Level 3) Bachelor and typically 5+ years' work experience or a Master and 3+ years’ experience.
(Level 4) Bachelor and typically 9+ years' work experience or a Master and 7+ years’ experience.
Relocation:

title: Solution Architect, ServiceNow
full_description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Seramount, Fair360 and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.


KPMG is currently seeking a Solution Architect, ServiceNow to join our Digital Nexus technology organization. This is a hybrid work opportunity.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with clients to understand their needs and develop solutions that meet their requirements within the ServiceNow framework or partner with Enterprise Architecture to suggest alternative platforms
Design and implement solutions that are scalable, flexible, and easy to maintain to include leading proofs of concept for new
Build integrations between ServiceNow and other enterprise systems using iPaaS (like Mulesoft), APIs, web services, MID servers, and ETL tools
Provide technical guidance and support to project teams throughout the project lifecycle, to include working with ServiceNow support and other technical teams to address and resolve critical issues; work with cross-functional teams to ensure that solutions are integrated with other systems and processes
Create comprehensive technical documentation including architecture diagrams, configuration guides, and development standards
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends related to ServiceNow solutions (IRM, HRSC, ITAM, ITOM, ITSM and more)
Qualifications:
Minimum seven years of recent experience in solution architecture, with a focus on ServiceNow including extensive experience in two or more ServiceNow modules (LSD, WSD, ITAM/ITOM, HRSC, IRM, CSM and more)
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, information technology, or a related field is preferred; ServiceNow CAD (Certified Application Developer) and one or more CIS (Certified Implementation Specialist) certs required and CTA (Certified Technical Architect) or CMA (Certified Master Architect) strongly preferred
Experience in supporting business solutions hosted on ServiceNow from a developer or administrator perspective, inclusive of the challenges associated with upgrades, integrations, and operational support
Strong understanding of practical application of ServiceNow as it relates to industry solutions, as well as an understanding of the interconnectedness between modules and core data
Proven familiarity with ServiceNow and other technology platforms commonly used to service core business functions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and cross-functional teams
Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. without the need for employment-based visa sponsorship now or in the future; KPMG LLP will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work visa status for this opportunity (no sponsorship is available for H-1B, L-1, TN, O-1, E-3, H-1B1, F-1, J-1, OPT, CPT or any other employment-based visa)

title: Advanced AI Research Engineer
location: 4220 Duncan Avenue, Suite 502, St. Louis, MO 63110
full_description:
We Are:
The beginning of a new Data & AI decade that will reshape work and society has begun. Accenture is stepping boldly into this future with a clear strategy and purpose: to help clients optimize and reinvent their business with data & AI. With over 45,000 professionals dedicated to Data & AI, Accenture’s Data & AI organization brings together our Experienced Innovation, Strategic Investment, Exceptional Talent, and Power Ecosystem.
You Are:
As an AI Research Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and deploying advanced AI models and systems that address real-world problems and drive business innovation. You will translate research findings into practical, scalable solutions, ensuring that AI technologies are effectively integrated into our products and services. Your role will involve working closely with research teams, engineering teams, and product managers to implement and optimize AI solutions.
The Work:
Development & Implementation:
Design, develop, and implement cutting-edge AI models and systems based on the latest research and industry advancements.
Translate research prototypes into production-ready code and scalable solutions.
Optimize algorithms and models for performance, efficiency, and reliability in real-world applications.
Deployment & Integration:
Deploy AI models and systems into production environments, ensuring seamless integration with existing infrastructure and workflows.
Collaborate with software engineers to integrate AI solutions into products and services, addressing technical and scalability challenges.
Monitor and maintain deployed models, making improvements and adjustments as needed to ensure continued effectiveness.
Collaboration & Communication:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to align AI solutions with business objectives.
Provide technical guidance and support to team members on AI development and deployment issues.
Communicate complex technical concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Research & Innovation:
Stay current with the latest developments in AI research and technology and apply relevant advancements to improve AI systems and models.
Conduct experiments and tests to validate the performance of AI models and identify areas for enhancement.
Contribute to the innovation pipeline by proposing and developing new AI technologies and methodologies.
Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.
This role requires working onsite at our Generative AI Center of Excellence located in Mountain View, CA.

Here's what you need
Bachelor's degree (or equivalent minimum 12 years' work experience, or minimum 6 years' work experience with Associate’s degree) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related backgrounds
2 years of programming experience with programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
1 years of programming experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g. Pytorch, TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning or natural language processing.
Bonus points if you have
4 years of programming experience with programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
2 years of programming experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning or natural language processing.
1 years of experience in conducting research in machine learning, natural language processing or computer vision.
Master or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronic Engineering or related fields
Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York or Washington as set forth below.

title: Sr Data Engineer
full_description:
Why Stifel:
Stifel strives for a culture that puts its clients and associates first: a culture where everyone belongs, everyone is welcome, and everyone contributes to the success of our clients, their careers, and the firm as a whole.

Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.
What You'll Be Doing:
The Sr Data Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure on the AWS platform. The Sr Data Engineer works with large volumes of data, ensuring its quality, reliability, speed, and accessibility. Tasks may include data ingestion, transformation, storage, data sharing and consumption, and implementing data security and privacy measures. This role is crucial in enabling efficient and effective data-driven decision-making.
What We're Looking For:
Build and maintain scalable and reliable data pipelines, ensuring the smooth flow of data from various sources to the desired destinations in the AWS cloud environment.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and design data solutions that meet their needs.
Understand data models/schemas and implement ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) processes to transform raw data into a usable format in the destination.
Responsible for monitoring and optimizing the performance of data pipelines, troubleshooting any issues that arise, and ensuring data quality and integrity.
What You'll Bring:
Extensive experience with enterprise data solutions, including but not limited to data warehouse modernization, enterprise data lakes, cloud migration, automation and reducing engineering toil.
Working experience with Amazon Well Architected Framework.
Proficient in programming languages such as Python and SQL for database querying and manipulation.
Strong understanding of AWS services related to data engineering, such as Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift, Amazon Aurora Postgres, AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, AWS Step Function, AWS Lake Formation, Amazon Data Zone, Amazon Kinesis, MSK, and Amazon EMR.
Knowledge of database design principles and experience with database management systems.
Experience with data storage technologies, such as relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and distributed storage systems (e.g., PySpark).
Understanding of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and experience with ETL tools like AWS Glue and SQL Server Integration Services is essential.
Skilled at integrating disparate data sources and ensuring data quality and consistency.
Understanding and experience with orchestration tools like Apache Airflow, AWS Glue Workflows, AWS Step Functions, and notification services.
Familiarity with IAC, such as Terraform, git, and DevOps pipelines.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities are essential to effectively identify and resolve data-related issues.
Ability to analyze complex data sets, identify patterns, and derive actionable insights.
Awareness of data governance practices, data privacy regulations, and security protocols is crucial.
Experience implementing data security measures and ensuring compliance with relevant standards is desirable.
Passion for mentoring less experienced engineers.
Education & Experience:
Minimum Required: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, related field, or equivalent experience.
Minimum Required: 10+ years of post-bachelor progressive experience in data engineering.
Licenses & Credentials:
Minimum Required: None.
Systems & Technology:
Proficient in the following computer languages:
Python
SQL
AWS technologies to include:
Glue
S3
Redshift
Lambda
Lake Formation
DataZone

#LI-LL1
About Stifel:
Stifel is more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior IT Systems Administrator
full_description:
Founded in 1952, RubinBrown LLP is one of the nation’s leading accounting and professional consulting firms. The RubinBrown name and reputation are synonymous with experience, integrity and value. RubinBrown redefines the full-service experience by combining technical and industry expertise with a commitment to personal and high-level relationships. https://www.rubinbrown.com/
Overview
Full-time, highly skilled Senior IT Systems Administrator who manages and maintains our company’s systems in our co-location data center as well as various cloud environments. The candidate will have extensive experience with managing hardware and software installations, network management and security, updating systems, Windows server administration, Microsoft SQL servers, and troubleshooting system errors.
Most importantly, this resource will provide very responsive product and technical support for our IT and business team members. The Systems Administrator will receive escalated support requests from Level 1 Help Desk team members and will stay in frequent communication about tickets status and work collaboratively to resolve issues and ensure 100% customer satisfaction. The Systems Administrator will proactively escalate issues to management immediately when needing advanced support.

Major Responsibilities
Provide superior quality and service. Respond promptly and courteously. Prioritize requests according to criticality. Identify timely and accurate solutions to technical issues.
Lead IT projects including system upgrades, migrations, and new implementations.
Assists, instructs, and coaches junior analysts and administrators in the support and administration of IT systems.
Provides advanced administration, support, and maintenance for IT hardware and software systems across all locations and the data center.
Maintain Microsoft Active Directory Group Policies, DNS, DHCP services, account and AD security management
Provide technical IT expertise and assist in the selection of new hardware and software platforms which follow the enterprise architecture principles, policies and standards.
Install, configure, test, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot systems and related hardware and software in order to deliver required service levels.
Administer application specific support processes coordinating with the business and/or other IT support professionals in issue and problem resolution.
Work with managed services partners and service providers to ensure appropriate prioritization for scheduled maintenance and upgrades.
Identify policy deviations, recommend corrections, and report results to management.
Responsible for systems operations lifecycle management including design, build, deployment, and support.
Responsible for disaster recovery planning and testing of enterprise systems
Responsible for maintaining security solutions on enterprise systems
Monitor, manage, and maintain system performance of all infrastructure components.
Document all standards, policies, and procedures.
Document all support activities in ticket tracking database.
All other duties as assigned.

Required Experience/ Background/ Skills
Excellent customer service skills including verbal and written communications.
Superior time management skills including sense of urgency and proactive approach.
Strict adherence to professional ethics.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Ability to work on and successfully complete multiple projects at the same time.
At least five years of relevant technology experience in related technical environment preferred.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.

Required Professional Background / Skills
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related degree required.
MCSE and/or MCSA certification required.
Excellent experience in:
Microsoft Active Directory services and security including group policy, security hardening, and remediation activities;
Windows Server operating system;
Microsoft Active Directory Services;
VMware virtualization products such as VMWare or Microsoft Hyper-V.
Strong knowledge of Office 365 enterprise systems, services, and security.
Strong knowledge and experience in storage area networks including administration, change management, and troubleshooting
Additional skill preference:
Knowledge of shell scripting (PowerShell) and HTML
Knowledge of Microsoft SCCM and SCOM
Knowledge of SOC 2 compliance
One Firm
To foster a highly respected, inclusive culture that helps foster and promote an environment that is diverse and equitable for all team members and the firm to achieve growth and deepened expertise. RubinBrown is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
