title: Database Administrator
full_description:
Database Administrator
Salary: $115,000 - $125,000/year
Job Summary:
The Database Administrator will oversee and ensure the performance, integrity, stability, and security of Azure SQL databases within DoD enterprise business systems. This role involves regular configuration validation, monitoring, and maintenance activities to support both test and production environments.
Key Responsibilities:
Performance and Integrity: Ensure database performance, integrity, and stability through regular configuration validation, monitoring, and routine maintenance.
Compliance: Conduct DoD Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) reviews and ensure compliance with established requirements for Azure SQL.
Security: Enforce database security measures, including user access controls, encryption, and vulnerability management, adhering to DoD guidelines.
Optimization: Monitor, tune, and proactively manage resources to optimize database performance.
Backup and Recovery: Ensure all database platforms are properly backed up, with documented and routinely tested restoration procedures.
Audit and Monitoring: Utilize Kusto Query Language (KQL) to review database audit logs in Azure Analytics Workspaces, satisfying Risk Management Framework (RMF) monitoring and audit requirements.
Contingency Planning: Support contingency planning efforts to ensure system availability.
Collaboration: Work cross-functionally with various operational teams to address performance or stability issues within the systems.
Task Management: Manage multiple tasks and priorities with excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Relationship Building: Collaborate closely with developers, system administrators, and business users to build strong relationships.
Required Qualifications:
Experience:
5+ years in database administration for Azure SQL databases.
3+ years with DoD enterprise application databases in the Microsoft Azure Government cloud Platform as a Service (PaaS) environment.
3+ years conducting DoD STIG and RMF compliance reviews in an Azure Government Cloud environment.
3+ years with Microsoft Azure Cloud logging and monitoring tools, including Log Analytics, Azure Monitor, and Kusto Query Language (KQL).
Skills:
High proficiency in SQL tuning, including writing and optimizing T-SQL queries for efficient database operations in Azure SQL environments.
Ability to write highly technical correspondence within professional etiquette standards.
Must satisfy DoD 8140 Foundational Requirements for the Data Administrator (421) - Intermediate work role.
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or Software Engineering.
Certifications:
At least one of the following:
CompTIA Security+ - Preferred
CompTIA Cloud+
Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC) - GIAC Security Essentials (GSEC)
International Information System Security Certification Consortium (ISC)² - Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP)
Database Certifications:
At least one Microsoft SQL related certification.
Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate (DP-300) - Preferred
Additional Requirements:
Security Clearance: DoD Secret clearance.
Areli is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
full_description:
To apply, please go to the Nursing CE Central careers page linked to this application.
Status: Full time, with benefits (Health, dental, etc.)
Start Date: ASAP
*No healthcare experience required!
**This position is a remote position.
Hours: 8am-5PM EST, Monday-Friday, remote position with overtime as needed and should be expected.
Who is Nursing CE Central?
Nursing CE Central is a private educational company serving nurses. We have over 500,000 users and represent one of the largest providers of CEU to nurses in America and worldwide. However, we are a small and nimble team with less than 25 employees.
The environment is fast-paced and hard working. You’ll need to be driven, ambitious, and an A-player to make it at Nursing CE Central. We live by our core values which are Innovate, Dedicate, Be Great, Collaborate and WIN.
What it’s like working at Nursing CE Central:
Working at Nursing CE Central is fast-paced and dynamic. You will be forced to think outside the box and pivot often. You will need to be willing to put the company first and focus on it 100% during working hours. If overtime and extra effort scare you this is not the position for you. This is not a relaxing desk job. This is a mission.
However, if you are a driven A-player who wants to push their abilities to the limit and grow, Nursing CE Central is perfect for you. You will have the room and ability to grow professionally and financially. And you will be surrounded by other A-players who are constantly pushing you to improve.
Here are our core values – This is how we operate every day.
If these do not fully resonate with you, please do not apply. It will become apparent in the interview process and we only hire true culture fits who align with our core values.
Innovate – How can we be better than the competition? Better than everyone else. How can we do things differently?
Dedicate – Make a plan. Stick to it. Don’t give up.
Be Great – Be the best at whatever you do. Take pride in your work. Mediocrity is the enemy.
Collaborate – Be a team player. Encourage your teammates to be better. Challenge them and achieve more together.
Win – Be number one! Don’t stop striving for success. Never be complacent.
Personal values that align with Nursing CE Central:
At Nursing CE Central we are cognizant of the culture we are building. Below are some of the most important aspects of our culture:
Empathy – Being aware of how your actions affect others and your role within the organization.
Respect – For your superiors and the overall mission of the organization.
Order – Working through problems systematically and with attention to detail.
Relentless pursuit of growth – Putting the welfare and growth of the company before personal needs and emotional needs of others.
Why work at Nursing CE Central?
Working at Nursing CE Central is a great career move, both long-term and short-term. It provides both stability and room for growth for select employees.
-Top notch pay and benefits
-Fully paid health insurance after one year. 50% paid in year one.
-Retirement with company match
-Fully paid dental insurance
-Fully paid life insurance
-Paid vacation and sick time
What will be my day-to-day Responsibilities? (On the job training provided)
We are seeking a resourceful and motivated Full Stack Web Developer to work across two companies within Slone Business Labs (Nursing CE Central and Slone NCLEX Review). You will collaborate heavily with our web development team on both front and back-end development for both company sites. This position reports to the lead Web Developer and will always have them as a resource, but must be able to work independently.
To be successful, the following skills and personal attributes are necessary:
-Acute attention to detail and organization.
-Forward-thinking, innovative mindset with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
-Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate and delegate complex concepts clearly.
-Outcome-driven mindset with ability to focus on project goals and critically think through difficult problems.
-High-level of reliability.
Experience/Education:
-Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field (or equivalent experience).
-Minimum of 5 years of experience in Website Development.
-Minimum of 2 years of experience in WordPress.
-Minimum of 2 years of experience in Front-End Development and Design.
-Extensive experience with WordPress, CSS, HTML, and JavaScript.
-Experience with databases and APIs preferred but not required.
-Experience with GIT and/or other version control systems.
-Experience with HubSpot and HubSpot API is a plus.
Key Responsibilities:
-Designing and developing: Create websites, applications, databases and APIs. Develop custom --WordPress themes, templates and layouts.
-Independently perform front- and back-end website development.
-Testing and debugging: Conduct routine updates and testing, independently and as a coordinated team.
-Collaboration: Collaborate with UX/UI Designer, leadership and marketing team to implement website designs/re-designs.
-Staying current: Keeping up with the latest web app and programming language technologies.
-Managing projects: Collaborate with the Web Development team on all relevant projects to ensure deadlines are met.
-Communicating and Reporting: Interacting with colleagues, managers and cross functional teams.
-Creating and customizing reports to ensure effective communication on major tasks.
Next steps:
We understand that job-hunting is time consuming. Please take the time to read and fully understand our hiring process. First, please read the job description in it’s entirety. We have laid out very clearly the type of person we seek and the requirements. Secondly, understand that our interview process is rigorous
for a reason. We do not seek to waste your time but do need several touch points to evaluate candidates.
Below is listed our flow for applicant:
Step 1: If a candidate meets all initial requirements AND respond to all pre-interview questions, a request for scheduling an interview is sent.
Step 2: Should you choose to continue, you will be given a link to schedule an interview.
Step 3: If selected, you will be sent a Figure-it-out challenge. This is a “mini-job” to showcase your abilities. This should take between 2-4 hours to complete.
Step 4: We will review the Figure-it-out challenge and send a final interview request with our hiring team.
Step 5: You will be hired (if all goes well) and join the Nursing CE Central team!
Excited after reading this application? If you’re an A-player we’re excited to hear from you!
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $85,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Work Location: Remote

title: Solultions Architect, Advisory
full_description:
CLOUDRISE, INC | Introduction
Cloudrise, an Exclusive Networks Company, is a security services provider focused on Security Access Service Edge (SASE), Data Security Posture Management (DSPM), and Cloud Security technologies. We strive to be the service provider of choice for both our channel and vendor partners, working as an extension of their teams, tailoring our scalable service model to security needs across the entire data lifecycle.
We build, deploy, optimize, and manage data security programs on market-leading platforms. With centers of excellence in the US, UK, and Colombia, our experience spans industries, geographies, and organizational sizes, demonstrating the success of our innovative and proven security talent acquisition and retention solution.
Now part of Exclusive Networks, a global leader in cybersecurity that provides partners and end-customers with a wide range of services and product portfolios via proven routes to market. With offices in over 45 countries and the ability to serve customers in over 170 countries, Exclusive Networks combines a local perspective with the scale and delivery of a single global organization. Our collective best-in-class vendor portfolio is carefully curated with all leading industry players.
Cloudrise partners with some of the fastest-growing cybersecurity vendors, including Netskope, Palo Alto Networks, Fortinet, BigID, Cyera, and Purview and supports over 100 value-added resellers and system integrators.
Driven by a leadership culture focused on innovation, service excellence, and the development of our people, Cloudrise continues to operate under its established brand. We seek passionate professionals who thrive on delivering exceptional results and making a meaningful impact in the cybersecurity space.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES | About the role
As an influential member of the team, you will help to create a positive learning culture, coach and counsel junior team members and help them to develop. You will be responsible for overall client service quality delivery in accordance with Cloudrise expectations. You will manage accounts and relationships on a day-to-day basis as it relates to services and explore new services opportunities, while establishing, strengthening, and nurturing relationships with our clients, partners, and vendors.
This role reports to Director, DSPM Professional Services
Key Responsibilities
Client Engagement & Leadership
Act as the primary Subject Matter Expert (SME) and Point of Contact (POC) for client executives and stakeholders, ensuring solutions are aligned with business objectives and exceed expectations.
Provide strategic guidance and thought leadership, educating stakeholders on cybersecurity trends and data protection solutions.
Lead complex architectural discussions to ensure scalable, secure, and effective implementations.
Manage client expectations and build enduring relationships, identifying and presenting new opportunities to drive value.
Solution Design & Delivery
Architect and oversee the delivery of enterprise-scale data protection and security solutions, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and compliance frameworks.
Lead multiple concurrent engagements, managing scope, budget, and timelines to ensure successful outcomes.
Proactively monitor project performance, identify and mitigate risks, and keep stakeholders informed of key developments and milestones.
Business Development & Sales Support
Partners with Sales to support pre-sales activities, including client pitches, technical scoping, and development of Statements of Work (SoWs).
Leverage your understanding of Cloudrise’s service offerings to identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities.
Build and maintain strategic relationships with clients, technology partners, and vendors to generate new business opportunities.
Team Leadership & Development
Foster a collaborative, inclusive, and innovative team culture.
Mentor and coach team members, providing guidance and feedback to support professional development and skill growth.
Industry Awareness
Stay abreast of emerging technologies, industry trends, and regulatory changes relevant to data security and client environments.
Bring new insights and recommendations to improve Cloudrise’s service offerings and technical capabilities.
Qualifications & Experience (Required)
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
6–10 years of experience in information security, data protection, or technology consulting roles.
Minimum of 6 years architecting and deploying complex cybersecurity solutions (e.g., Data Governance, Data Classification, Data Protection, Advisory Services).
Hands-on experience with enterprise Microsoft Purview implementations is required.
Familiarity with DSPM (Data Security Posture Management) technologies is a strong plus.
Deep understanding of data protection strategies, security frameworks, and regulatory compliance requirements (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001, GDPR).
Strong client-facing presence with a proven track record in business development and relationship management.
Certifications (Preferred)
Industry certifications such as Security+, Network+, CISSP, and vendor-specific certifications in DLP, cloud security, or data protection technologies.
Additional Skills
Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving capabilities.
Self-starter with a high level of initiative and the ability to work independently or collaborative
WHY WORK FOR US
We’re a team of creative problem-solvers, passionate about transforming complex, data-centric challenges into elegant, impactful solutions. Our people think big, act boldly, and bring deep expertise to every project. We don’t settle for the status quo—we challenge assumptions, push boundaries, and take pride in improving every customer’s data ecosystem. If you’re driven by curiosity, energized by innovation, and confident in your craft, you’ll thrive here. Visit our website www.cloudrise.com.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to the recruitment and hiring of individuals from diverse backgrounds and experiences, as we believe this strengthens our ability to develop superior solutions, make informed decisions, and better serve our valued customers. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, disability status, or any similar characteristic. Employment decisions are made solely on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business needs.
Our benefits include:
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short term disability, FSA, HSA plans
Vacation (Flexible)
Holidays (12 days)
WORKING CONDITIONS
Remote work
Exempt, salary
Travel may be required
To apply, please send your resume and a cover letter to careers@cloudrise.com
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $125,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off

title: Technical Business Analyst - P&C Insurance
full_description:
:

title: Senior Data Scientist
full_description:
Location: Remote (Work from home) or hybrid at offices in Atlanta, GA or Dallas, TX
Job Title: Senior Data Scientist
Compensation: Competitive
Benefits:
Unlimited vacation policy
401(k) with company match (immediate eligibility)
Medical, dental, and vision insurance options
Company-paid life and AD&D insurance
Flexible work locations – remote or office-based
Autonomy and ownership in your role
Career advancement opportunities within a growing company

Position Overview:
ConnexPay is seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join its innovative and high-impact team. This role is key to developing production-grade machine learning models and data pipelines within Databricks, focusing on solutions that optimize decision-making and enhance fraud detection within the B2B payments industry.

The ideal candidate brings deep expertise in machine learning and data engineering, along with hands-on experience in fraud analytics or payment systems. You'll collaborate across the business to prototype, deploy, and maintain ML-powered tools and insights that support real-time decisions and operational efficiency. This is a fully remote opportunity or can be based in our Atlanta or Dallas offices.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop, deploy, and maintain ML models and pipelines in Databricks, including full lifecycle tasks from research to monitoring
Partner with business stakeholders to answer strategic questions using statistical modeling, machine learning, and advanced analytics
Build and iterate on AI-powered internal tools that support automation and decision-making
Research and test new ML methodologies to enhance existing products and processes
Integrate and leverage third-party data sources (LexisNexis, Experian, Equifax) to enrich models
Present complex technical findings in clear, actionable ways to both technical and non-technical audiences
Manage multiple projects independently while collaborating in cross-functional teams

Qualifications & Skills:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field
5–10+ years in a data-focused environment (analysis, engineering, or science roles)
Strong experience in machine learning deployment in production environments
Expertise in Python, SQL, and ML frameworks (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Hands-on experience with Databricks and data pipeline orchestration
Experience with external data vendors such as LexisNexis, Experian, Equifax
Knowledge of B2B payments, fraud detection, or risk modeling is strongly preferred
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Power BI)
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Strong business acumen and ability to align data science solutions with business goals

EEO Statement:

title: ILUS - Software Engineer IV
full_description:
Overview:
About Us
Daifuku Intralogistics America Corporation is a leading provider of intelligent material handling systems. With hundreds of engineers in-house, the company designs, manufactures, integrates, and installs a full spectrum of intralogistics solutions to meet client needs. These include leading-edge conveyor and sortation systems, voice- and light-directed order fulfillment equipment, a suite of warehouse controls & execution software, robotics, Automated Storage and Retrieval Systems (AS/RS), mezzanines, and structures, all backed by critical round-the-clock service and support.

title: Power BI Developer (Contract)
full_description:
About the Firm
R.F. Wilkins Consultants, Inc. is a New York-based Business Development and Management Consulting firm. We partner with non-profits, small businesses, government agencies, and corporations to meet their development and expansion needs. Services under our umbrella include fundraising and capital sourcing, project management and technical assistance, marketing and branding, stakeholder engagement, and compliance. We are a growing and nimble firm working strategically to meet our clients’ goals. We have a close-knit team working in a fast-paced environment. Our staff are our greatest asset, and we encourage flexible work and continuous growth opportunities.
About the Role
Our client is looking for a freelance Power BI developer to create and update BI reports and communicate actionable insights to improve corporate decision-making. You should be able to manage data, evaluate its results, and display them strategically by using visualization tools, DAX queries, charts, and relationships. The role calls for part-time and as-needed development support, generally ~3-5 hours per week but could be more from time to time as the need arises.
‍This role requires an extensive understanding of modeling, databases, data warehousing, data integration, and the technical elements of business intelligence technologies. You should also be able to read and evaluate product, market, and share trends and have a strong technical understanding of business trends. Strong communication, organizational, and analytical abilities are required.
Roles and Responsibilities
Formulate automated reports and dashboards using Power BI and other reporting tools
Understand business requirements to set functional specifications for reporting applications
You should be familiar with SSRS and TSQL, Power Query, MDX, PowerBI, and DAX are just a few of the tools and systems on the MS SQL Server BI Stack
Exhibit a foundational understanding of database concepts such relational database architecture, multidimensional database design, and more
Design data models that transform raw data into insightful knowledge by understanding business requirements in the context of BI.
Develop technical specifications from business needs and choose a deadline for work completion
Make charts and data documentation that include descriptions of the techniques, parameters, models, and relationships
Developing Power BI desktop to create dashboards, KPI scorecards, and visual reports
Establish row-level security on data and comprehend Power BI's application security layer models
Examine, comprehend, and study business needs as they relate to business intelligence
Design and map data models to transform raw data into insightful information
Create dynamic and eye-catching dashboards and reports using Power BI
Make necessary tactical and technological adjustments to enhance current business intelligence systems
Integrate data, alter data, and connect to data sources for business intelligence
‍
Requirements and Skills
BS in computer science or information system along with 2-5 years of relevant work experience
Strong communication skills and ability to effectively explain requirements to internal and external teams
Exceptional analytical thinking skills for converting data into illuminating reports
Knowledge of data warehousing, data gateway, and data preparation projects
Working knowledge of Power BI, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS components of the Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack
Ability to articulate, represent, and analyze solutions with the team while documenting, creating, and modeling them
Familiarity with the tools and technologies used by the Microsoft SQL Server BI Stack, including SSRS and TSQL, Power Query, MDX, PowerBI, and DAX
Knowledge of executing DAX queries on the Power BI desktop
Comprehensive understanding of data modeling, administration, and visualization
Capacity to perform in an atmosphere where agility and continual development are prioritized
Detailed knowledge and understanding of database management systems, OLAP, and the ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) framework
Awareness of BI technologies (e.g., Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Expertise of SQL queries, SSRS, and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour
Expected hours: 3 – 10 per week
Compensation Package:
1099 contract
Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Manager, Network Operations and Cloud
full_description:
Company Description
Zayo provides mission-critical bandwidth to the world’s most impactful companies, fueling the innovations that are transforming our society. Zayo’s 141,000-mile network in North America and Europe includes extensive metro connectivity to thousands of buildings and data centers. Zayo’s communications infrastructure solutions include dark fiber, private data networks, wavelengths, Ethernet, and dedicated Internet access. Zayo serves wireless and wireline carriers, media, tech, content, finance, healthcare and other large enterprises.
The Senior Manager, Network Operations and Cloud is responsible for leading the strategy, implementation, and day-to-day operations of the organization’s cloud and network infrastructure. This role ensures high availability, performance, scalability, and security across both domains. The ideal candidate will manage cross-functional teams, drive automation and innovation, and ensure alignment with enterprise goals and industry best practices.
Key Responsibilities:
Cloud & Network Infrastructure Management
Oversee the operation, performance, and security of cloud infrastructure, including IaaS, PaaS, and cloud-native services (e.g., serverless, containers, Kubernetes, Docker).

Implement and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or Azure Resource Manager.

Ensure optimal use of cloud resources through capacity planning, performance tuning, and cost optimization.

Manage LAN, WAN, VPN, and network security systems, ensuring high availability and stability.

Configure and maintain network hardware (firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers) to support business needs.

Proactively monitor and resolve network issues to maintain uptime and performance.

Security & Compliance
Enforce cloud and network security standards, including implementation of zero-trust architectures.

Conduct vulnerability assessments, security audits, and incident response plans across both environments.

Develop and maintain network security policies in alignment with industry standards and regulatory compliance.

Deploy and manage monitoring and intrusion detection tools to ensure real-time visibility and threat mitigation.

Automation & Innovation
Drive operational efficiency through automation of routine tasks and infrastructure provisioning.

Develop scripts and implement tools for automated network and cloud management workflows.

Stay current with emerging technologies and recommend innovative solutions to enhance infrastructure capabilities.

Leadership & Collaboration
Lead and mentor a team of cloud and network engineers, fostering technical growth, collaboration, and a culture of excellence.

Provide hands-on technical guidance and ensure team adherence to best practices.

Partner with IT, security, and business stakeholders to align infrastructure strategy with organizational objectives.

Metrics & Reporting
Define and track KPIs for system uptime, performance, cost, and security across cloud and network platforms.

Utilize observability and monitoring tools (e.g., Datadog, Prometheus, SolarWinds, Splunk) for proactive insights and real-time visibility.

Deliver regular infrastructure reports and recommendations to senior leadership.
Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Networking, or a related field.

Experience:
8+ years of combined experience in cloud infrastructure and network management.

3+ years of leadership experience managing technical infrastructure teams (cloud and/or network).

Certifications (Preferred):
Cloud: AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud certifications

Network: CCNP, CCIE, JNCIP, or CompTIA Network+

Technical Skills:
Expertise in public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), cloud architecture, and security practices.

Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, ARM templates).

Strong knowledge of network protocols, routing, switching, firewalls, and load balancing.

Hands-on experience with observability and monitoring tools (e.g., Datadog, Splunk, Prometheus, SolarWinds, Wireshark, Nmap).
Estimated Base Pay Range: $139,5000 - $170,500 USD/annually
#LI-NP1
#IndeedC
The base pay range shown is a guideline and reasonable estimate for this role. It takes into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions. Actual compensation offered may vary from the posted range based upon geographic location, work experience, skill level, certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Non- sales roles may be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive plan. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a sales incentive plan.
Additionally, this position may be eligible for certain benefits, such as health insurance, life insurance, disability retirement plans, paid time off.
The posting will be active for a minimum of 3 days. The active posting will continue to extend by 3 days until the position is filled.

Excellent Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
Retirement 401(k) Savings Plan
Generous paid time off policy including paid parental leave

Who We Are
Embross delivers market-leading passenger automation and self-service technologies to the global travel market. That last flight you jumped on, there is a good chance an Embross hardware or software solution helped facilitate part of your airport experience. The world’s leading airlines and airports use Embross’ range of service technologies to help make the passenger travel experience faster, simpler, and less stressful. For our partners, that translates to offering more flights, more often with more (happy) passengers on board.
So, what’s great about what we do? We get to think creatively across a diverse solution stack of hardware and software to solve service and operations challenges for the world’s busiest public transit spaces. If you like challenges, we should talk.
What You’ll Do
We pride ourselves on staying ahead of the curve as we help our customers optimize and improve their service delivery models. We’re excited to be entering a new transformative phase of our stack as we explore new products, and new capabilities and embrace the growing data-driven demands of these environments.
As we continue to expand our presence across the United States, we are seeking a Service Technician to support our kiosk systems and related technologies. This dynamic, hands-on role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced, customer-facing environments.
The candidate will be responsible for supporting our product by acting as the liaison between the customer and other internal teams.
Main responsibilities
Perform on-site repairs and maintenance of Embross systems, including kiosks.
Provide immediate technical support and troubleshooting for deployed systems.
Collaborate with Level 3 Support Teams in Atlanta and other locations.
Deliver high-quality, customer-focused service and act as a key liaison between clients and internal teams.
Identify opportunities to streamline support processes and improve service delivery.
Deliver training to customers when required.
Basic Requirements
1-2 years of hands-on experience in hardware support.
Strong understanding of PC networking and protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, AD, DHCP, DNS).
Experience in configuration and troubleshooting of J2EE, web servers, and Windows desktop environments.
Proficiency in Office 365 and working knowledge of Oracle/SQL databases.
Strong customer service orientation with the ability to represent Embross professionally on-site.
Proactive approach with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Education & Qualifications
Diploma/ Certification in computer science/ IT or a related field.
Travel

Airport parking fee will be reimbursed.
Office Hours
20 hours per week, with availability on weekends (Saturday and Sunday) as required.

Security Checks
Employment is contingent upon successful completion of all applicable security checks.

Location
In Person

Pay
$25.00 - $30.00 per hour

What We Offer
World-class product engineering and development - You will join a team of leaders who are dedicated to creating innovative and impactful solutions for our clients and their customers.
Career growth and development - As a build-from-within company, we are committed to offering you a competitive salary package with responsibilities and projects designed to build mastery and leadership throughout the course of your career.
Dynamic and respectful work environment - Working alongside some of the brightest minds, you will collaborate on impactful work within a supportive environment - one where company values are always embraced and expressed, and diversity is a business imperative.

title: Military Service - U.S. Navy, Military Intelligence Officer
full_description:
ABOUT
These careers bring the expertise in all facets of Information Operations, making sure our fleet is capitalizing on the information vulnerabilities of our adversaries. Candidates seeking careers in this field should preferably have a degree that focuses on areas of study such as international relations, political science, government, engineering, physical science, natural science, computer science or other academic fields related to intelligence.
INTELLIGENCE AND INFORMATION SECURITY CAREERS IN THE NAVY
INTELLIGENCE OFFICER
Analyze top-secret information, interpret spy reports and direct the analysis of top-secret
satellite imagery. While others may see nothing, you’ll use your keen analytical abilities to perceive patterns in internet chatter. And as an IO, you’ll be the first to ascertain the implications of the latest intelligence.
CRYPOTOLOGIC WARFARE OFFICER
Few will have the deep understanding of codebreaking like a Cryptologic Warfare Officer. Create warfighting options for Fleet Commanders, advise decision-makers at all levels and achieve military objectives in cyberspace. In this job, your knowledge of the cyber battlespace is unmatched.
CYBER WARFARE ENGINEER
You are highly trained in specialized areas of disruptive technologies, cyberspace capability development and the full spectrum of cyberspace operations. Research, design, develop, test and evaluate software and firmware for Cyberspace Operations. Apply principles and techniques of computer science and computer engineering to build software and firmware to defend our nation’s vital computer networks.
INFORMATION PROFESSIONAL OFFICER
You lead your team of Information Systems Techniciansto ensure the delivery of communications capabilities by operating, maintaining and securing our networks around the globe. Assist with top secret cyberwarfare missions and discover tactical and strategic advantages afloat and ashore.
PAY AND BENEFITS
From the day you start, you’ll receive:
Competitive salary
Free health insurance
Free housing
A retirement plan
30 days paid vacation per year
EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES
Beyond professional credentials and certifications, the Navy can help ease your financial burdens and advance your career with generous financial assistance and continuing education programs.
Opportunities for further education within this platform include:
Post-9/11 GI Bill
Navy Tuition Assistance Program
The Naval Postgraduate School (NPS)
Navy War College (NWC)
QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree
U.S. citizen or equivalent
Must be eligible for a Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) security clearance
General qualifications may vary depending upon whether you’re currently serving, whether you’ve served beforeor whether you’ve never served before.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Officers in this community have opportunities to serve worldwide aboard ships, on bases and installations and in Joint Intelligence Centers such as the National Security Agency or the Pentagon.
PART-TIME OPPORTUNITIES
Depending on the role, there may be part-time opportunities available.
Serving part-time in the Navy Reserve, your duties will be carried out during your scheduled drilling and training periods. During monthly drilling, Officers in the Information Warfare and intelligence communities in the Navy Reserve typically work at a location close to their homes.
Take a moment to learn more about the general roles and responsibilities of Navy Reserve Sailors.
This job requires military service with a contract as a commissioned officer in the Navy. The application is for a specific position within the Navy.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Benefits:
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Retirement plan
Work Location: On the road

title: Project Manager - D365 Deployment Project
full_description:
Overview:
Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.

We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.

We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,114.7m (2023), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 20+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.

D365 Deployment Project Manager – United States of America
Location: US Remote (EST Region)
Staff or Contract role

The role of the Highlander Deployment Project Manager is a key role on our Programme.
Since 2023 the Programme Team have been building a core solution based on Microsoft Dynamics D365 F&SCM that will be rolled out across the Morgan estate.
This role will manage the planning, implementation and delivery of our core Highlander solution and associated ISVs and local Tax, Legal and Statutory (TLS) changes across our sites in the United States of America.

Play a central role in our wider Highlander global programme team and align all activities, plans and reporting to our overall Highlander programme plans and delivery methodologies

Monitor project progress, identify risks and issues, and implement mitigation strategies to keep projects on track.
Work alongside all other programme team members including testing, data, security, reporting, change management, business process owners to foster collaboration in the delivery against the plan.

Solution Architecture and Design:

(*) Note: Solution Architects have the responsibility for the solution delivery and solution integrity

Stakeholder Management:

Build strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure alignment on project objectives and project timeline.

Quality Assurance and Delivery:

Participate in the ongoing development of our programme delivery strategies and adhere to these strategies in the USA deployments.
Work closely with Highlander data teams and testing teams to identify and resolve any issues or defects prior to deployment.

Documentation and Reporting:

Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and meeting minutes, to track progress and facilitate effective communication.
Generate regular project reports and presentations for stakeholders to provide insights into project status, risks, and achievements.

Qualifications:

Experience of collaborative project lifecycle and software change management tooling (e.g. DevOps)

Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills

title: Sr Treasury Analyst- 25010268
full_description:
The Sr Treasury Analyst is responsible for understanding the infrastructure of the Company's Treasury Systems and applications in order to effectively support the requirements of existing process and the implementation of new and improved treasury management processes. This position will serve as treasury's representative for cross functional projects pertaining to the cash management function. This position will also develop a thorough understanding of the systems, software, technical processes and reporting in the treasury area in order to make recommendations for process improvements.
Primary Responsibilities
Supports multiple treasury centers operational processes, systems, software, technical processes, and report development in support of cash management's liquidity management processes.
Supports Treasury projects and initiatives. This will include system updates (non-coded), user acceptance testing, data management, and becoming a subject matter expert for systems, software and technical processes based on various systems.
Reviews existing processes and procedures and recommends changes that will improve controls and workflow.
Manages new initiatives and works closely with Treasury Operations, IT, Banking Integrations Team, and Treasury Analysts to integrate new process that supports the business units.
Initiates and leads cross-functional team members to integrate cash management processes of business units that have not been previously integrated.
Supports Treasury team in various payment processes including: SWIFT, SEPA, ACH, and Wire Transfers.
Research and resolves escalated issues related to matrices and tracking tools to support SLAs and internal controls.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Education
BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience.
Certified Treasury Professional (CTP) designation, preferred.
Experience
5+ years of increasing responsibility and experience analyzing and developing process improvements.
Essential Skills
Strong analytical and technical aptitude with the ability to evaluate system functionalities against business projects and needs.
Project management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.
Experience understanding strategic plans.
Experience with various treasury software systems including SunGard Quantum, Wieland, Reval, and FxALL, preferred.
Advanced Excel and Access query skills coupled with database, finance system and modeling experience.
Strong experience with data base reporting or business intelligence tools such as Oracle, Cognos, SQL, Crystal Reports etc., preferred.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Ability to work well with others under pressure in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.
Strong oral and written skills to positively influence all levels within an organization.
Excellent organizational skills.
